results.name: Heaven
results.address: The Arches, Villiers Street, London WC2N 6NG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Myself and two other friends (all gay) attended the venue on Thursday evening. After roughly an hour or so actually in the venue dancing and having only ONE drink (worth mentioning this was all of our 3rd drink of the entire night) we decided it was cigarette time, so we proceeded to the outside smoking area.
 
After our smoke we re-approached the entrance only to be told that we were not allowed back in because we had "had too much to drink". This was of course absurd and very confusing as we had literally had one drink in your venue and 2 prior to this, so we were not even on the cusp of tipsy. The doorman who initially refused our entry first picked out one of the three of us as being "too intoxicated" and after our friend proved he was not, the doorman then decided to pick on me because I had a limp. 
 
This instantly proved that the doorman and the rest of your "security team" were simply trying to minimise numbers in the venue by any means, and after being told that my limp was due to a Car Accident, the doorman then said, and I quote "walk for me", I found this extremely unfair, belittling and a complete abuse of my human rights.
 
Another doorman on the door told this other guy that we were all fine as he has initially let us in when we arrived, and he felt there was no reason to refuse us entry, so after our jackets were disgusting chucked at us, we were allowed back in. We spent a maximum of about 15 more minutes in the venue before deciding ourselves to leave, due to the fact our evening in Heaven had been too tarnished with abuse, prejudice behaviour and a complete disregard for our human rights.
 
We then went onto have some food and proceed home.
 
This email is prelude to a much larger bombardment on the venue and staff as I will be taking this further and posting it on every social media platform I know, and will also be asking if any of the local Brighton, London and south eastern papers would like to be involved in exposing the sort of behaviour your venue has promoted.
 
Also, as an ex venue promoter for Brighton and Hove, I know exactly how the club circuit works, especially gay venues and this was an awful representation of what should be a warm, welcoming and comfortable industry to be a part of, be it as a customer or employee.
 
I am not a greedy, selfish, or abrupt person. However after this atrocious behaviour, I do believe we deserve some form of apology, I especially after being told my temporary disability was fake and being made to walk purely for the amusement of a corrupt and unprofessional "doorman".
 
Also none of this is even remotely exaggerated and the CCTV will contest to that, in fact the above if anything is underplayed.

I visited with Freddie Shuffrey (see his review) and would like to add that, while I had a great time overall, I was forced to wait over half an hour for a glass of water while many male customers were served more quickly around me, and when I asked for water, I was told to 'go away' because I had expressed frustration at being so blatantly ignored, despite not behaving aggressively or rudely. It took other customers insisting on my being served for me to be provided with water. I will not be going to Heaven again as the staff was so rude and I did not feel comfortable as a queer woman in what should be an inclusive LGBTQIA venue.

The sad thing is that my party actually enjoyed our time INSIDE Heaven. It was the treatment we got outside that causes this review. Some of the bouncers were abominably rude to us, even though as a party of 15+ we were clearly going to be buying quite a few drinks. The female bouncer was particularly nasty and unhelpful. Despite me phoning up the day before to explicitly ask Heaven if getting a guest list would mean that we'd be able to get in hassle-free on Friday night at 12:30, the bouncer at the door told me this was "complete rubbish", begging the question what on earth is the point of a guest list if people can't get in? One of my party was arbitrarily barred from going in for asking about the guest list system. Two stars and unlikely to receive another visit from me or any of my friends, especially when hired bouncers, ESPECIALLY the female bouncer on Friday nights, are extremely rude and unhelpful to paying customers.

Pathetic little place. I was refused to enter and said I had too much to drink. Came especially with 16 friends and I was turned away. I did not have a drink and just finished work. I have a slight disability and I walk ''funny'' and that what I think was it. Thank you idiots for ruining my night. Also spoke to the 'manager'. Security pointed to a guy completely stoned, he did not said a word when I complained. Not sure of security either the guys didn't have their SIS Badges and refused to give their names. Places like this one should be closed down.

This is one of the best gay clubs I’ve ever been to!! I am loooving it! The crowd is wild and it can get very wild and crazy and you must be prepared for anything, hot and body to body dancing on the dancefloor and much more I guess the name of the club speaks for itself!

results.name: fabric
results.address: 77A Charterhouse Street, London EC1M 6HJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Second time I have been here and have been kicked out for no reason. They must be broke and trying to get more people in. I travelled over 2000miles to come here the music in this club. But when I bought a beer and was unsatisfied with how it was poured, the blame was brought to me and because I refused to pay for it they kicked me out. What Chafs, Scum bags!

The vibe is great, the crowd is there for fun, not for being posey or stuck-up and the live gigs are mind-blowing, so if you are into Drum & Bass beats, this is your place to be!!!! I’ve seen some negative reviews on here, but from the many times I’ve been here, I can’t recall, nothing but fun and dancing all night long to the beats, so I think you gotta check it out first for yourself, before to make up your mind.

Great venue and great sound! Ambience that makes you want to dance all night long, so if you want to have a great night life experience, you must go with your friends, put something more comfortably on and forget about all the fuss of the fancy and ultra-expensive night cubs and just let the great drum and bass don’t let you sit all night long!

Fabric is without doubt one of the best club venues I've ever been to. A labyrinth of rooms, with the most amazing sound system I've ever heard. The crowd.. hm.. I suppose with such a reputation you're going to get a good handful of people you'd probably not want to share a night with. But that's why you have friends, right? Make sure you leave late enough to catch the meat market in full swing. And yeah, I really mean a market that sells animal meat.

This club is unique in so many ways and epitomises what clubbing is all about. The three rooms provide a perfect balance without giving too much focus on any particular room. The sound system is excellent with Europe's first “bodysonic” vibrating bass dancefloor in room 1. The labyrinth-like caverns, arches and staircases provide a wonderful space to get lost in and simply enjoy the music for what it is. The music is almost all electronic, spanning a huge variety of genres (drum & bass, house, techno, electro, garage, dubstep, jungle and more), so if this music is not for you or you are looking for a 'regular club night' playing the latest chart/cheese then fabric is not for you! The lighting, smoke and atmosphere all add to the amazing clubbing experience and there is ample seating space throughout the club with huge leather sofa-like recliners near room 2. There are five bars, two cloakrooms and an outdoor smoking area. The only downfall is the occasional difficult bouncers, so be patient on the way in, because once you get in you will realise the long wait is most certainly worth it!

results.name: Electric Ballroom
results.address: 184 Camden High Street, London NW1 8QP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Be careful in there.. pick pocked operate inside!
They even hold a sign up at the start saying so! 

I went last night and me as 20 to 30 others got robbed! lucky they found a bag of phones in the loo and we got them back! I never had this done to me and i was pretty sober.

We spent a lot of time here this weekend for Desertfest and I have to say, it is a great venue! They have 3 bars so you don't have to wait too long for drinks and no matter how far away you are from the stage, you are almost guaranteed a good view! (I think the angle of the floor is subtle and the stage is just high enough to make a difference!) They have an upstairs mezzanine area also so if you don't want to be in the thick of it or want to chill in a booth, the option is there. Of course, the sound depends on a variety of factors but when these lined up, the riffs were crisp and the vocals audible enough to sing along with! The staff that work there are helpful and lovely also. Good place for a big rock gig!

Have you been to potterrow or indeed any student union ever? Electric Ballroom replicates the mix of cheesy and current music, cheap drinks and huge mix of people with varied interests in it's several large rooms. There's often a queue but it moves quickly and there's always space to dance. Sticky floors are made up for by the prices- it won't break your bank.
Cool place to see bands. Bark sweaty. Nice sound system and good views of the stage from anywhere in the main room.

Came here for the Zedd concert. The sound system is pretty good! The atmosphere was pretty chilled and it was a nice place for a good concert. The toilets are located upstairs and the bar's prices are quite fair - around 4.20 for a pint of lager and spirits cost around a fiver. I wouldn't mind coming back for another gig.

results.name: Tattershall Castle
results.address: Victoria Embankment, Whitehall, London SW1A 2HR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Great ship. But try to organise an event there, forget it, took a week to make a booking as are very slow at responding with detail/answers. They are no help at all for simple things, like providing a private spot for a hired professional Santa to change for 5 minutes, except in a toilet, despite paying £100 for booking and providing people drinking at their venue. 

On many occasions asked questions multiple times with no answer. And when wanted to do £16 per person buffet of food, got attitude like i'm being difficult. Originally was doing the £12.95 buffet, so was providing another £3 per person. Odd. This reply consisted of a suggestion to find another venue and will get my full deposit back. If wasn't 4 days prior I would. A quote I like "I’ve never had some much trouble trying to organize such a small party!" I have 30 ppl. Talk about stuck up. Id expect the same effort if it was 5 people or 50. In the end they cancelled my booking 2 days prior as I complained about the customer service but really they wanted the room for a larger group I found out.

Will pop in for my drinks now and then as I do but won't again organize a event with them.

After waiting 40 min for my food, I decided to ask what the hold up was since the people that arrived after me were already eating their lunch. They didn't even start cooking it. Since it was ham, eggs and chips it didn't take long to cook and they gave me a pint on the house and refunded me the meal. Overall, the meal was good. Make sure you order your food at the bar or you will be sitting around for a while.

Its an average pub on a fairly run down boat - don't get me wrong when the sun is shining and you fancy something different than the local beer garden head on down but don't expect anything outstanding. Average central London prices, get ready to depart with £5+ for most drinks available. Fairly grim toilet facilities. All in all good if you want the Thames breeze - if not head back inland.

Well, this is very cheesy London. A boat pub on Thames, with river views of all hot London stuff like the London eye, the south bank and the houses of Parliament. If you are not entirely fed up with that, it is a nice place to have a drink. It has both seating on the open deck as well on the bridge and the inside of the boat below. It is especially pleasant on decent weather around sunset time. You might want to tone down the alcohol consumption, because combined with the swaying of the boat I assume it it will definitely have an unpleasant outcome.
Nice views, service questionable. Decor inside reminiscent of Stansted airport departure lounge, stay on deck.

results.name: Hilton London Metropole Hotel
results.address: 225 Edgware Road, London W2 1JU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Looks awful on the outside but this hotel is actually rather nice on the inside. Pretty standard city centre Hilton, but the conference centre in here is well equipped and versatile, which makes it a very popular venue for smaller trade shows and larger business meetings. If you're visiting London and this place is in your budget, then it's an ideal hotel for being close to the city centre but not so close that you feel boxed in.

Paddington train and tubes are a quick (albeit confusing) walk and the two flavours of Edgware Road station are easy as well. You might have to cross the road a baffling number of times to get to them though.

I was at this hotel for one week, I already requested to provide smoking room to me , but at checking time , one of the reception staff told me that is not available at this moment and also they provide me my room at 16:00 , Normally hotel check in was also at 15:00 , that means 1 hour later than normal check in time in worldwide .

I smoked in my room for 1 time and next morning they charged me 100 POUNDS without any notice or warning . after this problem , they provide me the crazy room as Deluxe room , but unfortunately their deluxe room was scandal and so dirty in bathroom and so much smaller than my normal room .

For breakfast time also every time you will wait n Q for around 15 Min and specially more than this on Saturday and sunday .

My suggestion is DO NOT CHOOSE this hotel in london anymore .

My parents used to stay at this hotel when they come to visit me in london.Just an advice for the future customers.I rent a car in the green motion which is situated inside the hotel.They have been stealing from me.I rent a car for 2 days and they make me paid 1800 pounds.An advice never rent from them.When you go and ask the reception they will tell you to go and rent from them but don't make this mistake.Its look like hilton is ok to support these kind of business inside their hotel.Its a shame because I will never let my parents stayed to this hilton again.

Nice hotel but was very unimpressed with the mix up with our luggage. A porter came to our room and kindly took our cases and bags to the storage room for the day so we could have a few hours in London before our train home. He took the trolley straight into the storage room and came out with a ticket for 6 items. We returned a few hours later to catch a taxi to the station and they kindly offered to load our bags into the taxi after we had collected them. It was not until we got to the train station did we realise that a rucksack with my daughters ipad in was not with us. With only a few minutes until our train my husband had to dash back, only to be told that we gave in six bags and six were collected. We very naively trusted the porter to take those bags straight into the storage room while we waited in a queue for our ticket and did not count the exact number of bags(a lesson!!) Eventually my husband got the rucksack back but we missed our train and incurred extra charges. I explained this to the head of luggage and he said, "sorry!"
It was a lovely hotel with an amazing breakfast buffet; only wish I could have stayed longer!

results.name: 100 Club
results.address: 100 Oxford Street, London W1D 1LL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Simply fantastic. The 100 Club is an iconic venue, trurly one of London's music scene landmarks that's worth to be mentioned; the place is drenched with history thanks to almost half a century of countless bands and artists that graced its tiny stage; along with the Ronnie Scott's, this is the only historical venue in the very heart of London to have survived to this date unlike my beloved Marquee Club, The Astoria and other fantastic places that deserved to be rescued and kept alive as national treasures; at the 100 Club don't expect great service, huge variety of drinks, vanilla-scented lavatories of whatsoever frills, this place is Rock and Roll..!!! Sticky floors, sweaty walls and motley crowd; if you like party atmosphere, good vibes and real live music, this is the place for you.
Great music venue, but very expensive bar. Nice and central location.
Dismal. They've refurbished the entrance but stopped at the point you can't see from the street. A real grot box.

I have come with some friends here for a couple of drinks! The place is nice! It was a bit crowded the night we visited but there were lots of pretty girls! I am overall glad to come here every now and again!

I wanted to go to the somehow famous 100 Club for some time already, but for some reason I've never made it there. Now, finally, I was there. Not strictly for a music event, but for some mix between poetry and music. Anyway, the venue seems really okay, just the toilets are a bit shit. 

It wasn't too crowded on that Sunday evening, so it was really fine. Only the air con made it horribly cold at one point. But perhaps that's just me, and when there are more people, I'm sure you're grateful for a powerful air con. 

All in all, 100 Club seems to me to be quite a good concert venue.

results.name: O2 Academy Islington
results.address: N1 Centre, 16 Parkfield Street, Islington N1 0PS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great place, reasonable drinks and a good university feel for Friday and Saturday club nights. They have a couple of rooms and when bands play the atmosphere is really intimate. Propaganda on a Friday night is a good laugh with current indie music featuring heavily, and Saturday night is primarily cheese - like a student union!

I have only good memories of the O2 Academy Islington.

Here I went to see great artists and bands like: Goldfinger, Zebrahead, Mc Lars and many others.

Place is quite small, it can probably host 200-300 people top, but that's not too bad as it allows you to stay very close to your favourite artists if you want.

Here I also got a drumstick from the Goldfinger drummer and met MC Lars.

Terrible staff, great venue. Went to see Sebastian bach, didn't even get to see him as I was thrown out by a member of staff for stepping on a woman's toe. Staff are very hostile and rude. I'd avoid it going back there

Neat venue, good size and atmosphere. Saw VNV Nation here in 2013 and had a great time. Phoned up for information on the day of the gig and after navigating a maze of phone menus found the staff to be very helpful after all.

Drinks were a bit pricey but hey, it's London what do you expect?

Upper balcony/bar area worked as a great refuge from the gig when tired and the crowd (at capacity) was a great size, not too scary and not too small.

I'd recommend this place in general though having my water and glowsticks confiscated at the entrance was rather annoying.
Kenny wayne shepherd was truly amazing here, so good, great sound, small venue, talented musicians and a load of blues, what more could you wish for?

results.name: Café de Paris
results.address: 3 Coventry Street, London W1D 6BL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This glamorous venue puts on a pretty good variety cabaret. We sat in the gallery and shared a table with two lovely couples; the atmosphere was wonderfully conducive to friendliness and we had a great time together. The members of staff had a genuinely nice air about them and seemed to enjoy working there, which makes all the difference.

My only reservation is that I did feel the cabaret was a LITTLE lacking. I would have preferred a tad more female input. Only the showgirl dancers represented female talent.

It is an amazing place and I am interested in going to see the Cabaret, the music was incredible the whole night, from old school songs to the newbies I knew every song! I understand that it is based in central London so prices are going to be high, but £14 for a Double Vodka and lemonade seems a little pricey when its only £7 for a single!
Also at first we was discussing whether to have the table but we decided for how much it worked out for us to pay we would rather stay on the dance floor, which then we was made to re-pay our entry fee even though we had already paid once, so it cost the girls £20 to get in the end each and the boys £40! 
Amazing place and had a really good night but found the money situation a little ridiculous in the end!

Dreadful experience. Despite paying an over priced entrance, and an additional £900 for a friends birthday to be celebrated- we were given a lot of attitude by staff, especially bouncers. They refused our entry and when asked why, they angrily replied 'we legally don't have to give you a reason to allow you back in'. I would understand if I had been drunk, or even slightly wobbly- but I was neither. There was no justification for the way their bouncers had treated my friends and I. The birthday girl was told to 'wait outside for 15 minutes to cool down'. She also had not been tipsy and was not given any reasoning as to why she was told to wait outside. Strongly recommend you do not waste your time or money here.

Me and a few girls were lining up to go in because it was her birthday they seemed like they were in a rush to get us in? Within 2 minutes we were told to step out of the queue? There were 7 of us and we had some serious money to spend! We just wanted to have a good time. Anyways we were dressed appropriately so the only other conclusion is they are RACIST! All of us were black girls but we did not think that would be an issue? Seriously don't even bother going if your black, you will just get embarrassed. Thanks a lot Cafe de Paris for making us feel like were back in slavery days!

Café de Paris is an atypical club, it looks like a cabaret and the atmosphere is great! 
I went on a Saturday night with friends, we book a table through LuxGuestList and we were treated like VIPs. 
Performers enliven the party and the atmosphere becomes hot. 
I highly recommend it :)

results.name: Tiger Tiger London
results.address: 29 Haymarket, London SW1Y 4SP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
-Cheaters-

Well 
My friend had a birthday party there
He suggested me to buy a ticket online for the "VIP" or "Guest" or call it whatever you like list and avoid the queue,and I did it.
Once in the website this is what they write on it : """Tiger Tiger London is giving you the chance to cheat your way to the front of the queue!"""
Bought my ticket so I'm sure that after my 10 hours shift at work I can get straight in, and cheer my friend.
Well once in the entrance door I spoke to the security guys asking them what to do for get in and showing them that I have bought the ticket
They didn't give a s**a about that and sent me queueing
I'd told them that in the website is write that you get in straight with the ticket,and them answered: if you want in, then queue 
Not in the right mode to fight I took the queue,once back to the main door the security guy asked my ID, looking at it he asked why I'm alone ""What??"" I'm in a prison o are you just kidding me..
Me : No I'm not alone,my friends are in
Security : Are you sure
Me : yes sure
Security : Where are they
Me : WHAT???????
Security : Call them

Well at that moment I hardly keep myself calm
Tried to explain him that in that mess I would never hear my phone,and my friend is not phone addicted, as mainly people are.
Nothing to do, he putted me out! and told me to call my friend out!!!
After 10 minutes I was able to bring him out
Once inside the ""internal"" security, "doorladies" asked me £15 to get in!!!!!! 
I was getting mad!
Showed her my ticket and my friend told her I'm in the guest list ,
well....nothing to do, she sent me out.
After the security start argue eachother and let me in
I don't wanna write even about the service,cos I think there is no point...
Bought one beer £5.30 and one gin tonic £11.80

But if you want free tap water ask to the bar as wrote on the mirror behind the bar

...I'm used to deal with customers day and night and this is not the way to do business guys

This is pickpocket

Nice Music and that is all, over priced at the entrance £15 after 11pm, you then need to pay £2 in cash only for the cloak room, and off course drinks, so a 2 glasses of coke and JD is £22, anyhow its very hot inside, packed with people (stinky sweaty people) and you will have a terrible experience, I recommend you to AVOID. Security guards are nice and the staff but not worth it.

Tiger Tiger London it is a well-known party venue place in the city. The club is located in Haymarket Street close to Piccadilly Circus tube station. It is highly recommended to enter before 9pm due to the entrance is free. In addition, this will make you avoid the big queues outside. The club is divided in 6 different spaces: The Tiger bar, The Tiger Grill, The Cloud Lounge, The Groovy Wonderland, The White room and The Opal bar. You will find a different music style in any of these rooms, so there is a huge music choice for everybody. It is a good option to pre-book a table if you are a big group due to you will have some extra benefits in alcohol and food packages. Drinks are bit expensive so it is recommendable to go there for the happy hour (normally from 5pm to 8pm). Apart from that it is a classic club on the Londoners’ night which is worthy to visit.

Rubbish venue which only seeks to make as much money as they can!

Refuse to let you put your bag down on chairs or jacket making you go to the cloakroom just so they can make some extra money from you. As if charging what they charge for drinks isnt enough!!

Has gone considerably down hill in the last few years. Will not be returning.
Lots of dance floors and well managed. I enjoy this place and would go given the opportunity everytime.

results.name: Ministry of Sound
results.address: 103 Gaunt Street, London SE1 6DP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
MoS is an institution. It attracts many of the top old-skool DJs (Ferry Corsten, Erick Morillo, Paul Oakenfold, Paul van Dyk, Roger Sanchez, etc) despite it being a relatively small venue.

Over the years, the DJs that headline Vegas don’t play here anymore, but it’s still a great venue for last minute club nights. It’s got a good sized outdoor area for eating and smoking (not really my flavour). But all the same, it’s good if you need some “fresh air” and for a chat or as a meeting point… 

On Fridays, the main room is The Gallery and on Saturdays, it’s The Box. There’s also Baby Box – I’m guessing it’s where you can chill, but honestly I am always in The Box, so I really would know. You can get free membership at The Gallery and paid membership for The Box. Membership gives you a small discount and some other perks.

The cloakroom is quick as is the bar – but beware, two cocktails will set you back about £17+! I say, don’t drink there or drink beforehand! The crowd is also really respectful – just go!

If you like white people on drugs, sweaty black people, and a claustrophobic environment make sure you come here. Hell why not, you may as well also get punched in the face for the fun of it. But thats ok, because you can treat yourself to an expensive drink or a random hotdog stall outside.
Woo go ministry
If you like EDM its the best place to be. Amazing sound system and a good line up of artists every weekend.
Sweet clud & I play there come chechit out x

Among the popular clubs in the town this one has the best sound. But the reason people visit Ministry of Sound is the spirit of the place I guess. The bass is awesome and the DJ’s that play here know the meaning of good music.

results.name: The Roxy
results.address: 3 Rathbone Place, London W1T 1HJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Had an awful experience last night in which rude and aggressive bouncers refused us entry with for 'being too drunk' despite not having drunk that evening. Having queued outside for over half an hour, with other people in the queue being approached for being too drunk and sent away we were allowed up to the door and then immediately turned away by 'Damian' who could give us no justified reason, was smug, smirking and rude towards us (a group of young female professionals). 'Damian' refused to give us his name and was purposefully blocking his ID card from view so we couldn't obtain his details. After having asked for the manager we were then made to wait for another half an hour outside in the cold before she was able to see us. 'Beth' (manager) agreed that we were not too drunk to enter but despite this still wouldn't allow us inside (again with no due reason), it was also only due to her arrival that 'Damian' would give his name.

Today we phoned the venue and spoke to the general manager 'Simon' who was quiet possibly the worst manager I have ever dealt with. He repeated told us it was probably our fault for either (listing repeatedly) 1. No ID, 2. Being too drunk, 3. Having been barred and refused to even consider our side of the case. He repeatedly said "well what do you want me to do about it?", he refused to make any form of contact with the door staff or manager from the evening,he kept interrupting and attempting to blame us for last nights discourses and made numerous assumptions as to our behavior, insinuating that were were drunk and aggressive, despite him not even being present the night before.

When trying to end the phone call, I asked him to talk to the manager and door staff from the previous night and to then email me with his/their response, his response was an indignant "I am NOT taking your email." After having expressed our concern over the multitude of bad reviews of the club (based almost solely on the rude staff) and with this unacceptably response, I informed the manager that he could expect four more negative reviews and four less customers and ended the phone call.

Avoid The Roxy and its staff unless you want to be abused and victimized.

Rude pushy ignorant untrained slow staff. There is a reason why places like this takes photos of you, your drivers licence and serve in plasticware. Its because it's attracting the wrong type of people and you can tell the staff hate the custom here. Sorry for sounding cliché but if you don't like your job.... LEAVE.

I wish I could give less. I've been to some terrible clubs in my life but this one is king. Bouncers doing what they want and the manager had no clue. Young, inexperienced and hopeless, don't ever go to this club!

Never go here. The place is small, music is terrible, people who go here are pretentious. And worst of all the door staff, never have I ever seen such miserable and rude control freaks. Theres an old guy in glasses that stands on the front who seems to randomly pick out people from a group that he doesn't want to go in then uses the excuse that they are "too drunk". It's happened on two occasions that I've been there with two different groups of people. Much better places to go to in Central London.

The late nineties decor and improvised fire doors do not contain the explosive sexual tension which is palpaple throughout this high end establishment. Spurred on by commerical R&B and flavoursome pitchers, you may find yourself not wanting to leave until a stink-bomb goes off in your face.

results.name: The Windmill International
results.address: 17-19 Great Windmill Street, London W1D 7JZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: very disappointed the women looked like they where little girls there was no curvy beautiful women i felt like i was watching a pole dance on a pole. service drinks was good but overall would not go back need more women that are not so skinny and un sexy.
Overall i thought the girls looked like gollum out of lord of the rings.

I came to The Windmill night club last Saturday 13.03.2010 with 8 of my friends. We had complimentary passes and never paid to come in, we sat with few girls, the music was just like you hear in a night club, we couldn't sit still and all started dancing and singing, including the girls. We had loads of dances in private booths, some of them even by 2 stunning girls at the same time, £20 well spent! Their stage shows are breath taking and we were stunned by some of the professional pole dancers.

Andrew
You cant walk through the door without girls grabbing you trying to rip your jacket off as you walk through... and no English girls

results.name: Mahiki
results.address: 1 Dover Street, London W1S 4LD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
AWFUL PLACE EVEN IF YOU'VE BOOKED WITH THEM!!

I had been liaising via email and telephone calls with two members of the Mahiki team since 16th October in regards to my birthday booking. I made a reservation for a table of 10 at 23.00 on Saturday 8th of November. 

My group arrived at 22.45. At the door we were told that my table booking was made for 21.00 and I was two hours late thus my table had been given away. I produced my string of emails and booking form that clearly stated 23.00 to the man at the door, but was told (rudely) that nothing could be done. I then asked if any larger, thus more expensive tables were available as it was really important to me that I got in and celebrated my birthday. I was told no, and I was also told my group was too big to be accommodated (there were only eight of us) - we were not allowed to enter the club. I asked to speak to those I had been liaising with but was told they only work during the day.

I would like to point out at this point that my group were all EXTREMELY well presented. The six females were in dresses and heels, and the two males wore shirts, trousers and shoes. We were a mixed group all with ID. We followed every recommendation you had made. I also had my large birthday cake with me as I had also previously discussed with you, a cake that had cost me £90.00 and had been made for the occasion with a Mahiki style theme. 

The man at the door was quite rude and did not sympathise with my situation. We were refused entry despite offering to pay double the original minimum spend for a table. Now here is where one of the biggest issues lies. We were asked to not stand outside the club and thus stood across the road as we discussed what to do and were approached by a local promoter. Behind us in the queue were a group of six females, one of whom I knew and had had a brief discussion with in the queue. I therefore know that her group did not have a table reserved and were already highly intoxicated. As I stood on the other side of the road I was absolutely furious to see that these girls were granted admission to the club. 

Let me tell you something about my group of eight. I myself am a white British female. There was a white male, a black male, a black female, an Asian female and three mixed race females. I believe my group were turned away on racial grounds. How can your organisation clearly have made a mistake and not offer any kind of agreement or compromise? Why were the group of six white, blonde females allowed in but we weren't? Why were we ushered to the other side of the road, as if to say we made the club look bad? 

I am absolutely outraged at the way I was treated and I honestly believe if my group had been all white, this would not have happened. It's disgusting that we were turned away after so many weeks of planning and liaising. Any mistakes made were on your (Mahiki's) part, and yet it not only cost me financially, but it ruined my birthday night, that I will never get back. 

It' also funny how since the night i have emailed them and had no reply. Disgusting

My friends took me to Mahiki when I was in town, as they were much talking about it and I was eager to visit it! My first impression was not that good though, as I expected a bit more from the interior than the Hawaiian décor. We ordered the Pina Colada cocktails and I started forgetting about the décor, as the music was something I loved a lot! The mix of pop and r&b and even alternative, is exactly what I need to get in the mood and to have a fun night out in the company of my friends.

Having booked Mahiki as a surprise for my nephews 21st Birthday, I can honestly say that I have never been so disgusted by the way that we were treated. Both the lady on the door and the so called manager were extremely rude and dismissive.
I had booked a table, had printed confirmation of the booking from Mahiki in my hand was told that they hadn't got my booking and they couldn't accommodate us, they never apologised or offered any alternative, they simply turned their back on us, left us out in the cold and walked away......VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!!!
AVIOD.

One of the first bars I went to when I moved to London. Loved it originally due to the novelty of it and that I was partying in London! A good place to bring people visiting because of the following:
1) played British classics, like Stop - Spice Girls, Rock DJ - Robbie Williams
2) just the right mix of 'poshness' and 'laid back ness' - almost (but not quite) like East meets West
3) famous stars have shown up here for those who are in love with the idea of partying in places where celebs have been (makes for a good story)
4) the drinks are amazing. the pina colado comes in a pineapple. 15 for 1 but very much so worth it!

This place has two floors - one that serves food (mediocre food but gets you into the club to enjoy it a bit before the mayhem starts and is a way to avoid the lines), and the other with a dance floor with tiki torches. For those out to really celebrate, get a group and purchase the Treasure Chest!

The female servers were dressed in Hawaiian outfits & the male servers as pirates. One the servers even spoke in a 'pirate' accent.

Overall - a bit cheesy & tacky & wouldn't make it a regular haunt, but a fun place overall to dance & bring friends from out of town!

Extremely slow experience, however this is made up for by the taste of the drinks. Very beachy vibe with fun, exotic music. Big venue, pricey on entry which isn't great. Very clean and welcoming. Bar staff are edgy and fun and very good at making drinks! Very different tasting drinks which are highly addictive! Load your wallet before arrival.

results.name: Annabel's
results.address: 44 Berkeley Square, London W1J 5QB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Richard Caring has ruined what was once the greatest club in London by letting in "the bridge and tunnel chavs". I'm sad to say I avoid it now.
good but stale
Regal dining in an almost Through the Looking Glass atmosphere. A great spot for a date -but not cheap by any measure.
it is expensive but is really quite mundane, except for the wine list, for which one pays dearly.
a much better experience than i would have expected given its "snob" reputation

results.name: The Borderline
results.address: Orange Yard, Manette Street, London W1D 4JB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Right side of cramped for a rock show. Great atmosphere, love the fact there are screens at the back to allow people with obstructed view to see. Saw The Dangerous Summer there, sound was great, atmosphere amazing, staff helpful. Although, to note, do not rest your cup on the stage. I learnt, the hard way, that the volume of the sound is great enough to move your cup.
Cheap drinks and fresh atmosphere on friday nights. Indie and britpop music for dancing till 4.00 am.

The Borderline is the referent to listen to new alternative/rock/heavy music in London. They have an amazing venue, the acustics are fine and the bands are awesome! If you like alternative music this is your place to go!

My favourite venue mostly because they feature my favourite bands. This basement can get pretty crowded meaning people have to watch from the stairs! But always a great atmosphere and good sound all round. As it's so small, getting to the bar can be a bit of a nightmare!
Packed small central London club, best for its indie bands and rough edges. Nothing sophisticated here but for beers and loud raw music, its pretty good

results.name: The Roof Gardens
results.address: 99 Kensington High Street, London W8 5SA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Arrived here at around 11.30pm for a night out with 3 of my friends. We knew this would be an expensive night of drinks so chose to have a few glasses of champs at home before hand!
The doormen and staff were lovely, met a girl called Maria at the door who was very nice and sat us at a table with drinks for the rest of the night.
We all really enjoyed it, music and the atmosphere, leaving here around 3am..... Would definitely like to visit in the day to appreciate the surroundings and greenery!

Make sure that your overdraft is unlimited coz here you're gonna be needing it. (Unless you're filthy rich, or a trustfund kid or a lady who lunches) Despite the money thing the ambience here is beautiful, but don't take my word for it really it's one of those places to go and witness yourself and then you'll be able to say " I've been to the roof gardens"!!!
Overpriced! Really rude staff. The only reason it gets to stars as the drink itself was nice and the venue is really different. It's worth A visit but not as a regular place to go.
Great place. Excellent food. Interesting surroundings. Haven't seen a flamingo though.
A brilliant place for nice summer drink.

results.name: Barfly
results.address: 49 Chalk Farm Road, London NW1 8AN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing music is this club, located in the famous neighbourhood of camden. Is quite small but cozy. Bar at the ground floor and venue upstairs. For rock&roll fans!

A rocking little venue near Chalk Farm underground which has a nice atmosphere if you just want to come for a drink, then upstairs there's a dancefloor and stage which plays host to everything from hometown bands just getting started to big names who want to just play an intimate venue. I've seen a good few of my friends' bands' EP launches here and always had a great time.
Good music on both levels, with live music sometimes. Fun atmosphere with a good crowd of people. Reasonably priced entry and drinks. Overall a fun, inexpensive night out, I recommend it!

This ended up being my main haunt the first time I lived in London. The variety of different clubnights here combined with the fun and friendly vibe is absolutely second to none. The staff are usually cheerful and the bands are always well-selected. I've had some nights here where the DJs have pleasantly surprised me over and over again - I love those nights. :-)

For me, this is a venue I'd recommend to anyone wanting to get a flavour of the London music scene. It's an institution.
Good night ruined by an over-the-top bouncer and one rude woman behind the bar. Beer tastes disgusting and is served in plastic but great music.

results.name: 12 Bar Club
results.address: 26 Denmark Street, London WC2H 8NL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Loved the atmosphere and decor on the walls - old album covers and posters. The whole place has a kind of vintage feel to it, especially with the arcade. Music is great, a fine way to discover new good acts. A perfect place for live music, a few drinks and laughs, overall to have some fun and put the worries of the daily grind behind.

I love this place - it has everything for a great night out: live music, which still allows for a conversation, decently priced drinks, and lovely decor with old album covers and original artwork. The arcade with the pinball and ms pacman was a very pleasant surprise.
Great venue, nice people, well priced. This place is great for live music and good atmosphere with staff that know their subject matter - music. Its totally worth a visit.
Small bar.. it is a normal place. I like the drinks, but the atmosphere should be improved. This is my opinion, of course. I can't hide that some of the drinks are the tastier that I have tried.

I'll admit I judged this place before I walked through the door, but it is the very definition of a hidden gem. The club is covered in old album covers, music posters and drinks advertising that makes it feel like a true music-lovers venue. Staff were polite and drinks are pretty cheap considering the location. The back room has room to sit and offers up retro gaming classics - pinball and Mrs. Pacman! There was a live band playing that provided atmosphere, but you could still easily hold a conversation without shouting. Definitely worth a visit.

results.name: G-A-Y Late
results.address: 5 Goslett Yard, London WC2H 0EA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A place that refuses entrance to nice good looking people just because they think 7 is a big group doesn t even worth waisting my time doing a review
Great for a dance to pop music and cheap drinks! A fun place for everyone. Make sure to look after your bags in there though!
did not have a lot of fun cauz I hate commercial music ^^ but good club anyway
The best club in London - cheap drinks, free entry for members, just a magical place. I attend at least twice a week.

The place and the music was good but the service..I had to wait ages for a drink and please don't go to the blond barman! He didn't understand nothing about what I was asking and he argued with me cus he understood a different drink and he didn't served me cus he though that he was right!

results.name: Barcode
results.address: Arch 69, Albert Embankment, London SE1 7TP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Club full of drug addicts. Guys standing in long queues to the restroom to get high there. Drug dealers shamelessly offer you drugs next to the bar counter.

Friendly gay bar. Great funktion 1 sound system in the back room, be aware at weekends usually hosts cruisy-type parties however if you're looking for a late night venue where you don't have to re-mortgage your house a good place to go, and a 1 minute sprint to the train station if you have to run for a train!

Music has improved so much that it's becoming one of my favourite clubs. Two rooms of great music and great people 
Dark room is always busy but get's too hot.
Great Team good Musik nice People and super Dj's.I Love it and i miss

Great friendly place to hang out with friends to start the night and have a drink before going to an afterhours club in the early hours of the morning. Great music and sound system in the back dance room and fantastic disco ball lighting

results.name: O2 Academy Brixton
results.address: 211 Stockwell Road, London SW9 9SL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Really awful venue. I won't be going back. Was so crowded and awfully managed that we ended up leaving 50 minutes after Ben Howard came on, which was about 2.5 hours after we'd arrived. Sticking to Hammersmith in future.

A bit run-down, but a great venue nonetheless. The most obvious observation was the raked floor -- clever considering everyone gets a great view of the stage...but prepare for an achey back at the end of the show from resisting the urge to tip over for 2 hours! As per most venues, the washrooms were too small, but the Academy is about MUSIC, not the loo! The sound was fantastic -- my friends and I enjoyed a great show there.
Favourite place for gigs in London. Have seen so many great bands here. Why don't more places have a sloping floor towards the stage? Makes it so much easier to see from the back..

A really great music venue. The sloping floor is great as everyone is able to see the stage. It's a really good size also and I love the art deco interior! Drink prices are a little steep but overall an awesome place to go to listen to live music.
The best venue in London to watch a band, the worse venue in London for drinks. £5 a can of Tuborg is an insult!

results.name: The Half Moon
results.address: 93 Lower Richmond Road, London SW15 1EU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I went to see a gig by a musician friend, Nibs van der Spuy, at the Half Moon earlier this week. The place has a pleasant atmosphere when you walk in, the lady behind the bar who took the orders was pleasant, although the food delivery was very slow, and nothing was particularly good, nor bad.

I wasn't going to write a review until I found that the price of a Diet Coke, out of the machine, is £6. That is iniquitous.

Food is ok but I had to wait 50 minutes for my burger! And 3 months after it is not better, just waited 40 mins for some chips!

Here I am again a year after and It's got worse: we ordered an hour ago and still waiting!
Fantastic music venue and good ale! What more could one want?
I have to the half moon three times in the last month,on every occasion they have run out YOUNGS ORDINARY.How is this possible.

Great music, great atmosphere, some great life music bands.
Never tried their food, only a couple of drinks, I simply enjoy the atmosphere, deco and music. 
Visited for a friend's birthday celebration every year.

results.name: Royal Vauxhall Tavern
results.address: 372 Kennington Lane, London SE11 5HY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Brilliant place for a night out! Highly recommend the Bingo Night on a Monday! Great, entertaining evening to help you get over the start of the week.

They also do brilliant themed 'Push The Button' nights on a monthly (end of) basis that are a great laugh with awesome music that everyone loves and quirky gags throughout the tavern (fans, kinder egg toys, giant glasses, hand clapper slappers, etc) With a performance after midnight and a DJ bringing great tunes!
Been there several times on sunday and saw the wonferfull show with our dame and the great after party. Would love to go every sunday but live in antwerp :-(
a bit pricey but it was my first time and i loved it - I went for Miss Sherry Vine :)

This used to be a fantastic venue on a sunday when it was the dame edna experience. 
Now its charlie hides tv it has gone downhill. 
It was a 5 star venue before. Now its barely a 3.
 I hope edna comes back
being around the corner from this venue i have spent many sunday afternoons with mates . i stil go there on special ocasions and hope the RVT wqill be there for a very long time

results.name: 93 Feet East
results.address: The Old Truman Brewery, 150 Brick Lane, London E1 6QL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: One of the worst pieces of crap I have ever been to. Waffen SS security check. Awful security people. Cheap music and vomit EVERYWHERE. atmosphere was also awful.
Tired dull bar/club. How it is still alive is anyone's guess. I used to be a big clubber at one point and I always remember this place for average nights out.

Personal preference but the music on my visit was not to my taste. However decent selection of drinks and service was quick and painless. Security is tight and the bathroom leave alot to be desired but no worse than other late night establishments in the area. If r&b is your thing then pop alone for a look.
They gave me beer in bad condition (red stripe), smelling like shit and wired taste, and manager said it was ok, they didn't exchanged. I invite the manager to drink it and I have to buy a Guinness.
cheap and crazy. you can play ping pong and dance. weekends are better!

results.name: The Box Soho
results.address: 11-12 Walker's Court, London W1F 0SD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Maybe one of the rudest clubs! Got told q was about 20 mins (6 people in front) not 1 in 1 out either and after 30 mins n rain starting I wanted 2 find out what was going on seems as it was a friends bday. I got told we prob ant getting in so what do they think it is fun waiting for them 2 play god..... absolute c###s AVOID if u want fun not drama oh n fake goldie on door that must pump him self full of steroriods that he has 2 act like a big man for the lack of trouser snake he has!!! P.s u can always get hold of his snake 2 get in if u r that desperate 2 rub shoulders with pretentious idiots. Thanks for making my friends bday so supper special the box!!!

The Box used to be the best club in London, especially when Dino and Chris were at the door. But now (July 2014) only the junkie and useless people get in and some rich tourists think it's cool because they hear the old stories. I don't wanna give names but the black girl at the door constantly smokes while working and the guy is lying to everyone - nothing is done professionally. Not worth waiting, just junkies around. Rubbish

Bouncers are complete idiots. Great club once you are inside, but bouncers treat customers like animals.They have this self-power thing going on, where they lose sense of reality and think they are god like. After 11pm, unless you have paid for some mega table or personally know someone, good luck. Club is trapped in a bubble and staff are delusional. Not a way to live your life.

WTF waste one hour in the queue only to talk to door manager which whisper to my ear that I can only get in if I buy bottle of Chapman!? Basically they are trying to create the impression of the gods club and other shit.
BOX = delusion, brain wash and manipulation techniques.

Best night out!! I loved the intriguing atmosphere, sort of like a secret place where anything goes. The show was quite interesting and it definitely spiked up the night. It was a fun, different, naughty night!

results.name: Electric Brixton
results.address: Town Hall Parade, Brixton, London, SW2 1RJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
place was clean, door staff were friendly, Sound system was loud & crystal clear compared to some joints I've been in

location of male bogs is a negative though as you'll need to work your way through a crowded dance floor to get there

Proper decent venue nowadays! Great sound, lighting, etc... and the staff were cool and welcoming all night long... even into the early hours! Dancefloor was packed and the atmosphere was perfect. Good night!

Saturday 15th March The ORB.

My ticket stated the Doors would open at 10pm, but we was all kept outside for the Film Crew to get in their places until 10.30pm and it was very cold.

The Bottled Water (saka) can be purchased at Tesco's for 29p, so why does this club charge £3.50?

Some area's in the club are dark and you can't see some of the Steps, white paint will prevent further falls and spillages.

Huge Bottleneck on the Balcony after The ORB had finished playing.

Anyone caught Cat Napping will be chucked out immediately.

No Locks in the Ladies Lavatories 

My ticket stated that closing time was 6am, but we was all chucked out at 4.30am. However, I did overhear that this was because everyone was drinking Tap Water and No alcohol was being purchased.

Friendly approachable Crew, plenty of Bar Staff, so no time wasted waiting.

Will I go again?

Defiantly.

Decent gig venue now. Came here for a few late nighters when it was still The Fridge and it was a little sweat box. They seem to have mostly fixed that problem now. They also attract some good bands and DJs here, though the venue is fairly small so you often need to be quick to secure tickets.

Really great venue to see live music as it is smaller then Brixton Academy it feels a bit more intimate. The seating area upstairs gives a great view and where ever you stand you don't feel miles away from the stage! It is about 5 min walk from the underground station too which is perfect!

results.name: Aura Mayfair
results.address: 48-49 Saint James's Street, London SW1A 1JT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Aura is a place where the rich and famous come to visit have a few drinks and a laugh. We all had a fantastic time as always the staff are the nicest people friendly and always have a laugh with us.
Ok we are not famous but all work in the city and love this place for a few drinks at the weekend. it is expensive but if you want to come to Aura you pay your money, you want cheep drinks go to Weatherspoon's or your dive bar in the more rougher parts of London. Aura provides amazing music nice classy people and a great atmosphere £20 for drinks is normal its MAYFAIR not leyton

A very selective club with amazing party. 
The music is good and high quality service.The line to the club was big but we went fast and without any problems ( and for free!) Anyway the venue itself looks very nice - glamorous like we wanted it. Our table with drinks were perfect (thanks to lux glist, really cool guys! So we were dancing all night and I would say that I might back to Aura Mayfair. The people around were good looking and having fun - that what I wanted from such place. I think we will return!
Rude door staff, way too many people in the small space. No actual dancefloor and very boring generic music. There are much better places in central for a fun night out!
great place to party, great staff, good music. great cocktail. lots of good music and celebrites are hangin around the place.
Has a 'modern' Turkish decor that needs updating! White seats needs replacing.

results.name: The Joiners Arms
results.address: 116-118 Hackney Road, London E2 7QL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: oh my goodness me! if you are somehow out in Hoxton on a weekend, and you unfortunately pass across this bar, beware, and do not enter!! went there for one pint, to see some friends off and get an early one. spent half an hour standing at the bar, watching people that once were 6 people behind me get served before me... having worked in clubs before, I can appreciate annoyance caused by someone clicking their fingers or shouting at you over the bar- however, finally managing to catch one of their darling bar staff's eyes I asked, as ever, simply and politely if there was any way we could be next, seeing as I only wanted a beer and had been there forever at the front of the Queue, being wilfully ignored by Fanny Cradock and her clan for the previous THIRTY MINUTES- what did I get, but Harris Glenn Milstead, who seemed provoked and furious at my request, DONT I KNOW WHO SHE IS? he, a small, squat creature with bulbous eyes and an attitude rivalling Mussolini firmly put me in my place, when she declared "I decide who gets served next!" At which point I decided to leave the establishment. shame really, I was so full of high hopes. Of a pint of beer and maybe no insults to go with it??! (I know, so bloody naive-And I gave them a fiver to be offended?) If I'd known I'd gone in for some sort of derogatory treatment, I probably would have settled for Browns strip club across the road.I hate it when bitchy queens get all high and mighty. especially when they are being paid £6.50 an hour. I hope you get Ebola. Merry Christmas.
Large space with good choice of beer and real ale . However music terrible early on and inattentive bar staff. Dirty loos,
Atmosphere great, music iffy but good talent. long queses for toilet, but good smoking area (for meeting guys).
Is a very dirty place and make me feel.sick
Fun

results.name: Underworld Night Club
results.address: 174 Camden High Street, London NW1 0NE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I saw Carcass and Corrosion of Conformity in this place... The sound quality is so bad it just spoils everything. The Corrosion of Conformity concert I couldn't finish to watch it because of this. The concert was interrupted twice for equipment failure...
Very bad. Waste of money and time.
Bad sound, dirty and extremely unfriendly staff.

When I am going out I don’t prefer siting in a pretentious bar and just drinking. I enjoy places where I can dance all night. Maybe that’s the reason I like The Underworld so much. Every time I’m leaving this place my feet hurt me … from dancing of course.
The club is not special but the music never disappoints you. The staff is rude and the toilets are disgusting.
Grimey little place. Perfect if thats what you're into

results.name: Electrowerkz
results.address: 7 Torrens Street, London EC1V 1NQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
A proper venue, this place is the typical, dark, dingy place, with just a random door down a street next to Angel, and it makes it perfect.

They have massive doors between each area and I think depending on the gig, can open them up even more.

They serve Red Stripe by the plenty, which is the go-to beer for gigs, I think they are bigger cans too, so need to carry less around you.

The crowds have always been good, but it will always depend on the band you are seeing, so never saw a bouncer get involved.

If you are off to see a band here, I’d suggest finding it first, then going to the Wetherspoons nearby for pre-drinks.
I've only been once, but I had the time of my life. I'm definitely going to be scheduling another visit soon. I could have definitely used a place like that during my adolescence!
Nowhere quite like it. It has its imperfections, but they're part of the charm.
Dark dingey and dirty, ideal for the kind of events that are held there and lots of fun to be had. lots of rooms, lots of floors etc

I freaking love this place. Lots of floors and lots of rooms with different things in to choose from. If you're done with dancing to the harder stuff, you can go chill out and watch a movie for a while. If you want to dance to something a little different, just shift over to the next room. There are plenty of bars, and I believe you can bring your own alcohol in. I always go for Slimelight, and have been happily surprised to see some of my favourite bands play there for not a whole lot of money.

results.name: Wellington Club
results.address: 116A Knightsbridge, London SW1X 7PL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Best club in london if you're looking for a positive and friendly staff, mix of international people, good music and an eclectic vive

We booked a table for a large group on a Saturday night. They were really helpful and accommodating. The bar staff were lovely, service was great and the security guys were amazing. Loved the aesthetic and music, vibe was laid back and cool but fun. Definitely recommend The Welly, if I were London based I'd be a regular.
The Welly is a landmark of London clubs. Now in it's 10th year it continues to enjoy a unique mix of celebs and joe public - no special VIP sections here - just alot of fun :)

results.name: Tramp
results.address: 40 Jermyn Street, London, St. James's SW1Y 6DN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Fantastic

Lovely venue to meet up with friends on a Saturday night. Regardless of the endless queue that is getting on my nerves sometimes, I will visit the place again. Once you get in is all fine. Staff is helpful and very talkative. Been there even alone a few times.

results.name: National Liberal Club
results.address: Whitehall Place, London SW1A 2HE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Beautiful building. Like a step back in time.

results.name: The Troubadour Club
results.address: 265 Old Brompton Road, London SW5 9JA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Found this place by searching online, it's hidden away underground underneath an off licence - so you'd hardly know it's there, but it's worth the find as this a really cool little club!

It's proper jazz music here, as opposed to a number of other 'jazz' clubs in London (I won't name names but they know who they are) - raw, live and underground. Tables are spaced nicely around the band(s) to ensure intimacy but without being in their face, and as well as more established jazz acts there are also a number of great up and coming acts given a chance to shine.

The price of the beers is a bit on the steep side, but worth it for the quality of music and the setting.

results.name: Ruskin House
results.address: 23 Coombe Road, Croydon CR0 1BD, United Kingdom

results.name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel London - Westminster
results.address: 30 John Islip Street, Westminster, London SW1P 4DD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Stayed with a few of my friends on my first trip to London- split between us it wasn't too expensive for the proximity to central London. Plus, we got an abundance of free, warm cookies.

What an impractical hotel - 10 mins. to check me in; a computer monitor in the room instead of a TV; aircon LED lights lit up room so it was really bright and i couldn't sleep; sink plug wouldn't open. 
I told the receptionist next morning and she clearly couldn't care less. Steer clear!

Decent hotel I guess but really disappointed in the Internet. Absolutely one of the worst Internet connections I've found on my travels. Can't believe a nice hotel would do itself in by not having decent Internet. How is a business traveler to get any work done? Also the rooms are really cramped. Needless to say I will never be back. Shame on you

2nd stay, still ridiculously overpriced, nothing of value or prestige to justify the price of this hotel. Reserved for a week, left after 1 night. Ordered room service, nothing is in stock, "sorry we're out of this and that", £20 for some chips and a couple of drinks (colas not beers). That included the £5 service charge for room service. I could understand if it showed in 5 minutes but it took 30 minutes. They should have paid me! 

Nothing exceptional, very unimpressed with the hotel. Find a Best Western or Holiday Inn if you want a standard hotel.
Always welcoming and a nice, standard business hotel. Pleasant but not luxurious for personal stays.

results.name: Queen Of Hoxton
results.address: 1-5 Curtain Road, London EC2A 3JX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Huge multi-level bar serving a respectable array of beers and spirits in a very relaxed and friendly environment with some truly eclectic décor (the roof terrace is currently undergoing renovation so food isn't currently available), the ping-pong table and pinball machine merely add to the charm.

The real credit however belongs to the staff, bot bar and door, who are genuinely welcoming and a credit to their profession.

Pretty much the de facto East London hipster bar. Lots of floors means lots of variety and lots of culturally original (sometimes pretentious but often refreshingly earnest) events. The rooftop area has several bars and tents so it's good in any weather though it gets very cramped on sunny weekends. The pub quiz sounded like a good laugh too in passing. A definite jewel in the slightly tarnished vintage crown of Hoxton.

Security on the door was a bit much, not particularly friendly, and I certainly wouldn't queue to get in here. Paying over four quid for a pint always hurts a bit too.

Good selection of games, photobooth etc. 

The main draw is the roof. Great views, nice vibe, and much better than downstairs.

The Queen is another multi-purpose venue, describing itself as a bar, club and art gallery - the 'ultimate youth club for adults of the east side'. Split over several floors, the basement houses the club, the ground floor the bar and gallery - all concrete floors, school desks and chairs and a ping pong table - whilst the rooftop (up five or six flights of stairs) is a wide open space with a hot kitchen and a bar serving rooftop-only cocktails. In the winter, they rigged up a giant wigwam to stave off the weather and now, it's a perfect open destination for when the sun decides to shine. At weekends they hold a Rooftop Film Club and they're announcing pop-up food events over the summer. I drank a 'Don't Go to Dalston' (from the downstairs bar) and mintless raspberry mojitos (they'd run out), after really fancying a Bloody Mary (but no tomato juice). Not too bad a place, I'd be keen to see what happens on boozy summer evenings but whilst fun, it's nothing too special just yet.

A fun and hip bar on the edge of Shoreditch near Liverpool Street Station, The Queen of Hoxton has an awesome roof terrace which is perfect for sunny days in London. It can get quite crowded but is much better than being cooped up inside. In winter they have WigWamBam in which a tipi complete with BBQ is put on the roof as well as wood burning fire pits. You end up stinking but it is a nice feeling to be outside by a fire. They have regular events with comedy, live music and DJ's making it a really great bar to head to in the area.

results.name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel London - Tower of London
results.address: 7 Pepys Street, London EC3N 4AF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
+ Off the tourist tracks but close to everything, + contemporary but inviting interior, + delicious breakfast, + attentive staff

Surfing the web to find an affordable hotel in London I ended up with a bargain for the Mint/Doubletree Tower of London!
First I was skeptical since rates under £100 usually means thick carpets in the bathroom, moldy air and run out furniture in England’s metropolis but I was incredible wrong.
The Mint/Doubletree is awesome and I would return immediately! 

At our arrival a super friendly receptionist who fulfilled our wish to a quiet room with a nice outlook greeted us.
We really liked the sleek, modern and still cozy the interior of the rooms. A design that completely runs through the whole hotel, from the rooftop, down to the breakfast room and mainly attracts a young and sophisticated target group.

Its location is great and racking my brain over it before was redundant. I haven’t been to London for several years and thought that the hotel’s location at Tower Hill would be too far off but again I was wrong. The surrounding transformed over the years and with areas like Shoreditch and Bermondsey close by it is a great starting point to discover the city’s nightlife in the East. 
If you prefer a classier surrounding than the new hotspots the area around St. Katherine’s Pier or at Butlers Wharf have a lot of variety to explore.

The tube is around the corner and within 10 minutes you are at Embankment. When you cross Tower Bridge you can walk the opposite river shore up to Lambeth. After exploring London with its many touristy and packed areas you will really enjoy the hotel’s location.
Although there are still tourists around this area is just so incredible off the crowds – awesome! 

BTW – from the rooftop bar you have a scenic view over Tower Bridge, the Gherkin, and other sights in the city.

Visited in Autumn 2012 and booked into a King City Suite. Had amazing views over the tower of london. The room was large and comfortable with a lounge area and great bathrooms, comfortable bed. There was an incredible sky bar on the top of the building with a big outdoor terrace, again - views were stunning panoramic over the river and had a good cocktail menu.
Very busy lobby area during the weekdays but much more peaceful during the weekends. Friendly bartender and drink prices were reasonable for the area. Would be nice if they did happy hour though!
Great location ,walking distance form tower hill tube, large hotel with good facilities. And good restaurant and bars, including roof top bar.
Very nice hotel, in the City of London. Has a good restaurant on the ground floor - good for lunchtime meals

results.name: Circus Tavern
results.address: Meads Corner, Purfleet RM19 1TS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Had a great time there about 15 years ago.
Fantastic venue, the exotic dancers are mesmerising

results.name: All Star Lanes
results.address: 95 Brick Lane, London E1 6QL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I nver been their but you the best I just put fahmida begum.so people don't know I'm famous I am Katrina kalf I am coming to all star lanes
amazing place, great Interior Design and cool bar directly from the 50's. good place for an unsual night out with friends. key words: hidden, exclusive, cozy style, american.

So glad we stumbled in to this gem! When we arrived at midnight, we never expected to be able to bowl --but the staff were so accommodating! The atmosphere is key - super fun and vintage-feel, and the funk music made for great dancing between frames. Only downside, it was £8.95/person and we only got to play one game. Had we been able to play another round included in the cost, this would be a 5-star joint!
Cool interior that reminds me of a 50s American diner kitted out with bowling alleys and bars
Great food. Proper naughty stuff! Plus u can bowl, play pool or do kareoke

results.name: westminster school of performing arts
results.address: 12 Old Pye Street, London, Westminster SW1P 2DG, United Kingdom

results.name: ibis
results.address: 3 Cardington Street, London NW1 2LW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Perfectly fine hotel but unbelievable complaints against us for TALKING too loudly at 7pm in the evening. Email of complaint sent. If you like to talk in your hotel room during the reasonable hours of 5-8pm, make sure you whisper otherwise you'll get a telling off.

Excellent front of house service. Nice reception and bar area, very modern, clean and open. Free WiFi throughout hotel. Rooms are slightly dated but powerful hot showers a big plus. 2 main walk to Euston station. Great value if you book in advance.
The room was super dirty and the breakfast was quite bad. Really overpriced for what it is... Also staff is not friendly at all and the area is very noisy and dirty.

I like the hotel. It is simple but you feel comfortable. Nice restaurant and lobby. 
Near the train and underground station ...that is good!!!
Its clean but No better than a roadside motel in the states. A kin to Days Inn with NO Air conditioning! Ridiculously over priced!

results.name: Nightjar
results.address: 129 City Road, London EC1V 1JB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
We visited on a Thursday night in November of 2014. We arrived about 9:00pm but had not made reservations. The good staff there found us a table for two in the corner near the bar anyway, and we were not disappointed. 

I'm glad we got a table where we could see the bartenders...I mean, bar-artists work their craft. Watching them make the drinks was almost as impressive as the drinks themselves. We also got some free snack popcorn to munch on while we drank and conversed.

The band was excellent and not so loud that you couldn't have a conversation despite the small size of the underground establishment. The staff was friendly and helpful and even gave this North Carolinian a pack of NightJar playing cards on the way out. It was, by far, the best bar I went to in my week visit to London.

Should I ever find myself back in London, I will be sure to make reservations for this club. It should not be missed!

we just loved it. we waited outside for about 45 minutes but it was worth it.
cozy, exclusive cocktail bar. they have Live music sessions but also good ambient music playing. the cocktail menu is just sick, every cocktail has between 7 and 10 different ingredients, very special recipes. we tried the signature cocktails and were just unforgettably good. prices between 10 and 14 pounds. they have got sharing cocktails for 20 pounds.

Live music was great, ambiance was nice and cocktails were good but nothing mind blowing, there are plenty of places in London that do better for cheaper. Was just one of those places where there is so much hype you expect the best place in the world.
My friends and I organised ladies' night here. It was such a crazy experience. Live music, pleasant atmosphere and most importantly, amazing cocktails and food. We loved it.

Lovely atmosphere, great people and (despite my not being particularly keen on jazz) the band was brilliant. They played our requests for 1920s music (we were there on a 1920s themed hen do), even though they specialised in the 50s and later. The cocktails were amazing - we had a couple of sharing ones and they came out beautifully presented and tasted fantastic. We had plenty to last us all evening (which was good for us, as we were on a bit of a budget). The loos could have been nicer, but that's really the only criticism I can find.

results.name: The Social
results.address: 5 Little Portland Street, London W1W 7JD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Very cool little bar hidden away from the hell that is Oxford street. American style booths and interesting design crowd. It's small so don't come from afar to visit, it's just for if you are in the area and need a drink.

Only been here a couple of times, but I constantly rave about it and recommend it to others looking for a great night out. Friday nights seem to be best with old school hip hop and funk providing the perfect dancing atmosphere. Drinks prices are very reasonable and it's generally pretty easy to get to the bar. So get some drinks in you, be sure to wear comfy shoes and dance the night away!

There are two floors here, and I'm principally talking about the upper floor.

This is a cosy little place that does some lovely food, reasonable beer + wine but is really defined by it being out of the way.

The most unusual characteristic of the place, unlike a lot of other places in London, is that you are *expected* to be social and share your table.

This is great if, say, you are on a date - not only can you display your nous at having find a fairly cool place but you can also demonstrate social skills too.

When looking for a place to go out ‘out’ during the week The Social comes highly recommended. The nicely furnished upstairs bar serves great cocktails thanks to an expert mixologist and contrasts nicely with the downstairs ‘nuclear bunker’ that hosts a great mix of live acts from indie to bass, Hip Hop Karaoke and monthly literary nights...

To read more on The Social and other unique independent businesses across London visit the Twenty Something London website

A very chilled out and cool venue! Cool events happening downstairs and a more chilled out vibe upstairs. Cheap drinks, fun staff and a casual laid back atmosphere located right in the centre of the cetre! Also on thursday evening they have a unique event, well known throughout the city, Hip Hop Karaoke. If you are looking for a fun & different night out - THIS IS IT!

results.name: The Old Blue Last
results.address: 38 Great Eastern Street, London EC2A 3ES, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Even if you set out to start or end your evening at The Old Blue Last, you'll end up there regardless. 
While the service isn't the quickest and you'll be left standing at the bar wondering 'am I ever going to get the bar staffs attention?!' - it's a bit of a Shoreditch institution of grubby cool which is difficult to avoid. 
Once you do get served, the prices are pretty reasonable and it's always worth keeping an eye on their website, as they hold regular gigs and quite a few secret ones too. Stay for the people watching, if you can get a table.

The whole building looms out across Great Eastern St, practically dominating it. It's a little cosey pub that is almost out of place. The crowd is usually mixed, though it has been mostly Caucasian when I have been (if this matters to you, at all). Nice and spacious, as it hardly seems crowded, with decently priced drinks. They have live gigs on every night in the rooms upstairs, which is always an excuse to head on over there. The selection of drinks isn't that broad, but it doesn't matter as it is just a nice place to hang out. Open till around 12 or 1, I'd definitely recommend it.
My favourite live music venue in London by a stretch. Excellent sound, and line ups really well curated.
Great vibe, fab bar staff and really friendly. I have never received a compliment in a bar in London, but I did there.
Open until slightly later than most other places. Nuff said.

results.name: Spearmint Rhino
