results.address: 161 Tottenham Court Road, London W1T 7NN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Average, The yankee women are usa rejects (siren/nikki/silver) tall ebony with wing tats. The vegas girl come to bank roll you. stick with the local ladies they treat you right. SIRIEN please fly away, and wax.

Boring and over priced night out. Male staff were arrogant and aggressive from the point of arrival. Particularly the fat bald man taking the entry tickets. Cheesy DJ who sounded like he was at a cheap wedding. Overall it was a joke which explains why it was virtually empty by 12.00

I went to Spearmint for my friends stag do. Had a great time. These girls are Hott! would recommend to anyone for a good night out in London. The door staff and the bar staff were also very friendly and professional.
HOT HOT HOT!!!

This is a con. Dances are 20 pounds, but you can negociate directly with girls for longer, more private shows. It's not really worth it, since they go into a dance routine that circles around. If you're friendly you won't have any trouble with the staff. I've been to the Spearmint Rhino in Vegas, and London has lower standards: older, less attractive girl, some of them even a bit ugly. Girls were friendlier in the US as well, I felt that SR UK ladies were a bit pushy.

Warning: DON'T EVER WITHDRAW FROM THEIR CASH MACHINE (huge fee) and DON'T LEAVE YOUR CARD TO THE WAITRESS for an open tab. I had a very unpleasant surprise when I found out someone used my card to withdraw cash from the ATM accross the street while I was enjoying a private dance. Beware.

results.name: Hilton London Green Park Hotel
results.address: Half Moon Street, London W1J 7BN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but I felt I had to for the Hilton Green Park hotel. I took my friend to the Tiger Green Brasserie for afternoon tea to celebrate her 30th birthday. The food and tea was lovely and great value for money. But the key was how nice and friendly the staff were. They noticed it was my friend's birthday and gave her a slice of chocolate cake, with candle and sang happy birthday. After we went to the bar for cocktails and the bar staff were great there too. Will definitely be going again.

You book this hotel for the location - not a lot more. Rooms and most public areas are decidedly average. Good bar but slow service on a Friday night. Breakfast pretty average and definitely nothing to write home about.
Lovely stay, Can't fault it. Wouldn't hesitate to use again.

This hotel became my home away from home on my regular trips to London. It's not large or luxury but strangely because of this in a combination with the welcoming staff I feel more comfortable and relaxed. Nicely furnished rooms, the heating system works properly and it's always peaceful and quiet.

This hotel is a 5 star hotel in London. The service is average and check-in to the hotel can take some time due to the queues. This is similar for check-out. The room itself is relatively OK. It however looks old and dainted but internet is included. Room service is average but xostly. The mini-bar is about the right price for 5 star hotels. I would not recommend using the mini-bar. For a 5 star hotel it lacks some amenities like a swimming pool. However for a business stay it is OK.

results.name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel London - Marble Arch
results.address: 4 Bryanston Street, Marble Arch, London W1H 7BY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: if you like indian food please Try The Taj Restaurant in 10 Carlton Parade Orpington Kent BR6 0JB open 7 days a week Monday to Saturday 5.30pm to 11.30pm and Sunday 5.30pm to 11.00pm
Crampt, clean with poor HVAC... Wifi at 10£ for 1 Meg speed is really bad for the business traveler.

I visited my cousin in London last weekend and stayed at this hotel. It's not for the first time that I've been staying at a Doubletree hotel and all I can say is - they did it again. Friendly staff and high level of hygiene. In fact, the room was cleaner than my own bedroom at home. And I used to consider myself an experienced housewife.

Stylish hotel, it has been recently refurbished and now it looks like boutique property. Experienced staff, good organisation and management, no complaints at all. They really cared for the comfort of the guests, this was what I liked the most.
الفندق ممتاز

results.name: Babble Mayfair
results.address: Lansdowne House, 59 Berkeley Square, London W1J 6ER, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: good looking venue, good looking people, great music! went there on Saturday and had a blast. I will be back!
Amazing night. Lovely staff and the service was spot-on! Cocktails were delicious, music was awesome.. can't fault the place at all!! Would go back every night if I could!

My piña colada was disappointing but then I compare with the ones I had in the Caribbean and Mexico. Love the happy hour half price on cocktails that are about £9 each so you could try them and find your favourite. Seating was a bit of a problem upstairs everything was reserved they listed the time on the reserved card so we knew when to clear out. We discovered they had a whole seating area downstairs where they could have put the hen party people as limited space upstairs but they didn't. I guess they wanted to look bustling. All in all it was ok
Great place though overpriced drinks

Absolute shambles trying to book a table online at this place, even worse when I phoned up to try and book an area for a group of work colleagues again (a week in advance). Will always profit from passing trade in the location they are based, but won't be recommending to anyone in the future. 

Fuming.

results.name: Rainforest Cafe
results.address: 20 Shaftesbury Avenue, London W1D 7EU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The food in this place is dreadfull. I had a horrible dried up burger that was obviously just a frozen economy product, in a terrible cheap bun. It was inedible. Given the rock bottom quality, the prices are outrageous. And the staff got arsey when I refused to pay. The rest of my family had meals equally as bad. Won't set foot in a rainforest cafe again.

Upon arriving on a rainy day we had to wait outside for five minutes outside in the pouring rain whilst two members of staff shut the doors in our faces. They stood on the other side and watched us as we were confused as to why we were not allowed in. (it was due to a puddle of water flooding the front doors) however they did not articulate this to us as we were getting soaking wet outside. 
Waited 20 min after entering the restaurant for a drink and after finishing the main course we waited 30 min for the bill as we got up to pay at the bar the guy who was serving us rushed and got the card machine we had been waiting for!

PRICE- Expensive, they added a service charge also. 
SERVICE- Poor and slow- would of not like to have given the 12.5% gratitude as they didn't deserve it!
DECOR/ATMOSPHERE- Inventive and without this the restaurant would go out of business. 
FOOD- Mediocre and not worth the money.

Busy place and the wait for a table can be long. Great place for kids though, with some great entertainment for them. The kids menu has much healthier options thankfully. Overall the little ones will find this place quite fun.

I celebrated my daughter's 5th Birthday Party here and discovered their barbecue ribs - extremely delicious. My girl loved it - you have to bring your children here, they will love to take food in a jungle!

I am big animal lover so this rainforest theme was up my street. It was my cousin's birthday so we went here and I've never eaten in a place where the atmosphere was so entertaining. Every so often various animal noises would happen or you would see the elephant raise its trunk now and again, I liked that :) Whilst the food was nice it was super-duperly overpriced so I'd only come here again if I had a good reason too such as a birthday. I also hear that at night time this venue turns into a club? That would be kind of trippy :P

results.name: Hilton Garden Inn London Heathrow Airport
results.address: Eastern Perimeter Road, Hounslow TW6 2SQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Definitely would not stay here again! First the bad then... (well nothing since there was nothing positive). Do not expect a peaceful sleep - the noise between the rooms is seriously disturbing. I stayed in December and the heating did not work. The power in the room cut out twice. The internet was almost unusable (and overpriced despite the misleading "free wi-fi" claim). I changed rooms with no improvement. The food is overpriced and poor. It was actually unbelievably bad. For an airport hotel where the prime purpose is to relax before/after a long flight etc. this hotel must simply be avoided!! 

By the time you factor in the extras and the poor relaxation you might as well pay the extra price and go elsewhere. And to be honest this has always been my experience with the Hilton chain.
Stayed here with my girlfriend and found the hotel comfortable and spacious. I would definately stay here again.
recently updated rooms and reception look nice. can be noisy between rooms but very handy for Heathrow

I have always been impressed with this hotel for many years now. I use it several times a year on business and family trips into London. Its valve for money if you stay & park and with your reward points it allows you a free breakfast next time you stay. Wi-Fi last time was free and they will always print off your boarding cards as an extra bonus without charge. The Hoppa bus is expensive but walk to Hatton Cross (Watch the Traffic) and the regular service bus is free. 
The hotel staff you will find friendly and the hotel clean – the rooms are quite but travellers do get up early and forget others are still sleeping. The bar manager remembers his regulars and offers his hand every time – he still remembers my name and asks about my family if I’m travelling alone. 
Breakfast is a must you can eat until you are full (I do) bar meals and drink are pricey but if you are on a budget there is a shop at Hatton Cross where you can by snacks. Note: the hotel allows you to have a takeaway delivered to the hotel. 
A good place to start any trip – long haul flights it’s a must park your car in a secure car park and relax – highly recommend.

Nice hotel.

Good food.

Same about wifi costs.

results.name: The Old Queens Head
results.address: 44 Essex Road, London N1 8LN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Absolutely love the Old Queens Head; from the quality ales, slightly macabre decorations and the awesome food and music, this is a great place to go for just about everything.

Although you will get a fairly traditional pub experience here, it won't seem like you are in a standard English pub due to the quirky mixed Contemporary/Victorian decor. The variety of stand-alone and communal seating makes for a great spot to meet with groups.

We came here for a dinner night with a friend who was in town for the weekend - it was a Monday night. The food was delicious - particularly the parsnip chips with their generous serving of dip - and the drinks were reasonably priced. We had intended on heading up for a gig but ended up just sitting around in their comfortable chairs chatting the night away while the DJ churned out some beats and the pub filled up with lots of kids in their early twenties! Very good energy here, easy to get to and definitely worth a visit!

I went to The Old Queens Head last week after work. My colleagues insisted to have a drink on Friday. So, they took me to The Old Queens Head and I really loved it. Great drinks, good food and lovely sons. We decided to book a table there every Friday!
Brilliant pub in Angel, had a party there a few weekends ago and was very well taken care of. Great vibe, people and music. Nice and chilled downstairs and fab dancing upstairs!

results.name: Hilton London Canary Wharf Hotel
results.address: South Quay, Marsh Wall, London E14 9SH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Currently at the hotel where we have been made very welcome. The staff have assisted in making our time here easy as one of our sons is on crutches. As things are we are happy as we get ready to watch the UCI track championships

The Hilton canary wharf is situated in the financial district just a few minutes walk from canary wharf underground station with hand links to the DLR and Jubilee lines. 

First impressions are average the outside of the building is a grey rather bland looking building but these thoughts soon perish once through the door. Upon arrival you are greeted by a nice modern interior and friendly bubbly staff although it can take a moment to grab there attention in order to check in. 

The room's: Upon walking through the door first thoughts are "what a lovely room" Decent sized bathroom and a rather modern décor to the room. Unfortunately this is where it ends staying on the second floor facing the DLR is not a room I was comfortable in. Staying in this hotel for 2 days meant no natural light coming into the room as you are pretty much at eye level with the DLR trains meaning ZERO privacy. These rooms would benefit greatly from better sound proofing and also one way glass giving the guests the privacy they expect in any hotel room.

Breakfast: Sadly I was left VERY DISAPPOINTED not only by the layout which in my opinion needs a complete re think (Some tables are very awkward to be sat at as you have people bumbling past every few seconds) Also the food was in my opinion worse than even a motorway service station! Flavourless bacon which was clearly cooked long before I arrived no sausages available as they where still in the oven cooking (This shows a total lack of observation to the trays) The tomatoes simply grilled with zero seasoning or even a trickle of skill and the mushrooms where ruined by the total lack of flavour. I stayed for 2 nights and on a B&B basis i attended breakfast once and was left appalled.

Nights sleep: Unfortunately on night 1 my night was interrupted by noisy guests at past 1 am screaming for help to get away from a "man" After a few guests shouted at him all settled down but you would of thought the hotel would attract a better clientèle Secondly the DLR and work done at night is rather intrusive on the second floor so again more sound proofing needed.

Check out: Swift as I used the quick check out option 

Would I stay again: After staying in several Hilton hotels around the world I would have to say no. I know of cheaper and much more comfortable hotels in the same area.

Room: 212 
Dates stayed 30/05/14 - 01/05/14

I stayed here with my girlfriend during the London marathon. We really liked our room, which was a great size, very comfortable and very stylish. We were impressed by the breakfast as well. Although there is a nice restaurant beside the hotel and close to train stops, there isn't too much to do in the surrounding area (very much the financial district, so a bit dead on the weekend). Our only real complaint with this hotel was that we thought the wireless fee was a bit much and the connection kept dropping. 

I would definitely stay here again if I decided to run the marathon again.

We used this hotel recently for a work event and I have to say I was very impressed. 

We received a very good level of customer service and nothing was too much trouble. 

The food and drink was very nice, surroundings were attractive, clean and relaxed but with a business atmosphere too. 

The location is very handy too as it's right by the South Quay DLR station.

It's been a few years (2008), but this was our "landing" hotel when we arrived in London from the USA. Exhausted. And they treated us warmly and welcomed us. Our rooms were quiet with lovely views toward downtown London. Outstanding executive lounge and outstanding executive lounge breakfast and outstanding service from the bottom floor to the top.

results.name: Hilton London Islington Hotel
results.address: 53 Upper Street, London N1 0UY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Excellent Hilton hotel very modern. Rooms are very clean and kitted out with new furniture/cupboards etc. Nice big wide screen TV which is a nice touch. Breakfast excellent. Staff extremely friendly. Recommended. Good location not too far from Angel underground. Islington has lots of bars and restaurants few with live music.
The staff were veey accomodating. The rooms were vwey clean and I had a great stay.

4 days with really crappy Internet in an old hotel with what appears as an Ikea make over. When the Internet (for which I was charged separately) did not work, I was asked to talk to BT, and spend hours with support. Had supposedly the full package with executive lounge access - and yet I had to sign room number and give signature so a single banana that I asked for between meetings could be fully charged to my room. A banana! Showers needed a fix, water out everywhere. When I first switched on the shower, dirty hairs and soap water was rising up in the bathtub. Staff are doing what they can in what appears as a really poor yet very expensive hotel that I cannot recommend in any way.

We had a 3 night stay here on a short break to London. On arrival we enjoyed a warm welcome. Our room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Breakfast was delicious and rich. We were impressed by the friendly and helpful service. When we return to London we will definitely stay here again.

It's been renovated since I last stayed here. Big rooms, contactless keys for rooms, and really friendly and helpful staff. Had access to the executive lounge, free drinks and canapés. Used them a starter before going out for a meal, could have happily stayed at eaten them all night. Big selection. Only issue was the lounge isnt as big as other hotels, it seems more like a bolt on/after thought more than a planned development.

results.name: The Hoxton Pony
results.address: 104-108 Curtain Road, London EC2A 3AH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Tge clientèle are a bit up themselves and the downstairs area is so cramped. Plys thr drink prices are ridiculous!

Terrible surly bar staff. Happy hour ends dead on 9pm (even if you order at 8.50pm and the bar maid takes 10 minutes to produce 2 cocktails).

Drinks very overpriced and music choice very poor (if u can call that music...). That being said, the tiny club area and poor sound system don't help...

Dont waste an evening of your life here - go throw £100 in the thames and spend the evening playing on a train track - it'll be a cheaper evening, and almost certainly more fun.
a good drink, nice music and lot of girls is exactly what i was looking for enjoy my Saturday night. Best club in Shoreditch
God I love this place... It always has the best music and cocktails. I can't recommend enough - am booking a table for my birthday in June. Best cocktails in town!!!

We are affluent arty types, well travelled and very young at heart. Right so the facts: staff inside were polite. That's the 2 stars. Cocktails laughable. We tried the signatures. Each cost 10GBP. We love expensive fine drinks. These were expensive and poor. The club was cramped. Sound system basic. Need to dress up to get in? Not really. Everyone inside was wearing cheap H&M dresses and Jeans. We would not return to the venue.

results.name: The Wilmington Public House and Dining
results.address: 69 Rosebery Avenue, London EC1R 4RL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this gastropub that reopened last year, located just off Farringdon Rd. The beer selection, the service, the main dishes, the desserts, you name it. Really had a wonderful meal here and plan to come back. They have pub quiz nights as well.
Sunday treat! Love this place, food is always so delicious and fresh. Cocktails just yum!

We visited a day after the grand opening and it seemed the refurbishment had helped with its popularity - it was completely packed. Quite a plush pub, slightly pricey, even for round Islington way. Advertised prosecco on tap, but a bottle was better value, once they found it. Keen to go back to try out the food (especially the platter of croquettes) but will perhaps save for a special occasion.

INCREDIBLE EXPERIENCE ALL ROUND!
I am so impressed with NEWLY RENOVATED Wilmington, now rebranded the WILMINGTON PUBLIC HOUSE AND DINING ROOM. What a transformation! I went for it's soft opening last weekend - three times it was so good!! It was 50% off so I made the most of it while I could! Both the food and design were faultless. 

DESIGN:
I fell head over heels in love with their beautiful design touches, particularly the combination of dark wooden flooring with chequered floor tiles around the bar, the exposed brickwork, tweed covered seats and eye catching lanterns over the bar. 

FOOD:
The braised beef ribs for two to share melted in the mouth and came paired with pumpkin, forest mushrooms and horseradish mash - yum!! My friends also had killer dishes. For starters we loved the palourde clams with ham and sherry and the fritto misto with roast fennel, as well as my beautiful meaty rock oysters. 

For the main event, (aside from the ribs) we were blown away by the pork shoulder with apples and celeriac, the wild rabbit and mushroom fricassee with kale (this was my favourite) and their roast chicken with quail scotch eggs (that's just for Sunday roast though).

Then, for dessert I can recommend the honey roast autumn fruits with vanilla ice cream, the custard and nutmeg tart and last but not least their sticky toffee pud. God, this is making me hungry just writing about the place! 

DRINK:
I also loved their interesting mix of top notch wines, their prosecco on tap and my guy mates loved their selection of craft beers. Oh and I also had a great cappuccino which comes with a very tasty artisan pistachio shortbread on the side. 

All that's left now is to try out their very appealing (and very distinctive) breakfast menu! I will definitely be back!! If you're around the Exmouth Market area it is definitely worth trying out, whether it's just a chilled drink or a full meal.

Not as cool or as bustling as it was a few years back but that leaves more space for Exmouth market's media trendies to enjoy their well-priced pints at the plentiful tables and leather sofas inside this decent pub. The music slants towards indie, and they often have bands upstairs, too.

results.name: Yates's
results.address: Leicester Square Chambers, 42 Leicester Square, London, Leicester Square WC2H 7JZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: i had good time dont know where those bad reviews come from. nice music food was ok
Spoke to disgustingly, and one barman insulted my friend as well. Steer clear, there are better pubs around!
Watery pints and sticky/wonky tables are common place. Food once served 45 minutes after ordering with little in the way of appology
Happy hour 2 for 1 cocktail pitchers is about as good as you can expect here! #mywifeisntworkingclass
Myself and my wife had a meal and i had beef vindaloo wife sassage and mash and the portions we was given for the price we paid was very bad. It was 3 mouthfalls per dish for £8 each. Rip off

results.name: Hilton London Olympia Hotel
results.address: 380 Kensington High Street, London W14 8NL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: It is in the middle, between Barons Court and Hammersmith Tube Station. Take the bus from either to the hotel for less walking. There is a Tesco if you take a right from the front door; across the street, where you can buy water, fruit, sandwiches, groceries, etc. for much less than the street vendors. Plenty of pubs, restaurants and shops close by and a very nice neighborhood. It was unusually hot and humid this trip so it was too warm for me in the room, but that was not their fault but the weathers. The concierge and desk staff were very helpful and nice enough to help me with any request I had. I would definitely stay here again.

Not sure why this hotel is rated four stars, other than its restaurant/bar area which is immaculate. Rooms are averagely decorated, nothing built into the price of the room, tv doesn't work cause of the software designed at ripping you off, room is incredibly hot, air conditioning is like a Nun's cough (pointless), windows don't open and if you pick the water bottle up, they'll charge you £3.95!!

I'll never stay at another Hilton after this experience...

This must be the worst Hilton ever. Booked a standard room and expected a room. I'd call it an oversized walk in closet. And the furniture..... Desk full of scratches, floor lamp leaning like the tower of Pisa. I am appalled that Hilton let's their customers stay like this. I am a loyal Hilton customer and now I don't understand why.

London is a lovely city but there is something in the atmosphere that always makes me feel farther away from home than expected. A feeling I can hardly get rid of. Thankfully there are few nice hotels like this one where they pamper you not as a guest, but rather as a part of a big merry family. It is great to rely on such hospitality.
Hilton London Olympia Hotel is one of the best hotels in London that have ever visited. Love it!

results.name: Ember
results.address: 99-100 Turnmill Street EC1M 5QP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Ember is the perfect place to meet a friend for a beer or something else. The place is a bit weirdly decorated, but I like it. The bartenders are nice guys and seem to know very well their stuff.
Book your table in advance as it's always overcrowded.
frienly bar. mostly not too crowded. great for after work drinks. is supposingly gay but there is not much scenic gay about this place
Bland soulless bar catering to people who wouldn't know a good drink if it slapped them in the face
mid week. nice atmosphere. not crowded. music was not too loud. attractive people.

results.name: Paradise by Way of Kensal Green
results.address: 19 Kilburn Lane, London W10 4AE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
With a 50% off food deal via Open Table and friends living locally we had to try this place out, we learnt it was well worth the visit even without a food deal or being local.
What we liked:
Short menu where everything sounded amazing
Full flavour food
Great venue (bar, restaurant & club)
Friendly staff
What could be improved:
Mistakes on bill (but were quickly corrected)
Price of drinks

I do love this place, always have done. Great for dinner, Sunday lunch and especially for an evening out with some good music. Wicked guest DJs, DJ Yoda tonight in fact!
But this place is becoming a victim of it's own success. Door policy is pretty hit & miss, and it just gets ridiculously busy. Moreover there are some nights where, should a 'celeb' decide to turn up with their friends, well you're plain out of luck when it comes to getting in.
Used to open later too.
If you can sort it, or book a table and get in though, it's still got that special something.

I had such a fantastic time at paradise. The staff were really attentive and the food was incredible. We had a take for six for a friend's birthday and I really felt like the staff wanted to make it a great experience for us.i am thinking about having my birthday here as well now as it was such a great time!

A unique experience from start to finish. What looks like a pub on the outside is actually something that reminds me of Alice In Wonderland on the inside. Well run by ma boi Clement Ogbonnaya. Had some great nights here. If you like Hip Hop give Dope a shot. Good line ups and sound system. Superior crowd than Central London in terms of friendliness and fashion. Place has a proper London vibe to it ya'know. Great bar/club in an overcrowded market. Give it a go. You won't regret it!

London certainly isn't lacking in fantastic spots for a Sunday roast, but what set Paradise apart for me was not only the great food (and generous portions!) but the beautiful decor. Just a wonderful, elegant environment to relax with friends at the end of the week.

results.name: SUSHISAMBA London
results.address: Heron Tower, 110 Bishopsgate, London EC2N 4AY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Food and atmosphere matched only by the views. The delicately rich and diverse flavours turn what, on the face of it, appears to be a standard Asian menu into a Bible of culinary delights. Twinning Japan's ancient techniques with the explosive flavours of Brazil and Peru, there is surely something for even the most well fed foodies to experience something different. 

Do not think you need to be Einstein to wrap your head around it all, the knowledge of the staff ensures you feel very comfortable with what you're ordering, even for a Sake novice like myself.

The place is fascinating. There you can enjoy in the view the whole of the City of London.
I love their nutrition menu with temptations dishes that are gluten free. I can admit their Sushi is the most delicious, that I have ever taste. It's the perfect place for couples and not only. The bartenders were polite and the cocktails, which they prepared for us was impressive.

I couldn't have been luckier to have my birthday dinner at SushiSamba! What an incredible experience from top to bottom. The views are unparalleled, the service is exceptional (we referred to our server as a 'ninja'...she would always seem to swoop in when we needed her!) and the food -- well don't even get me started. Hands down the BEST salmon sashimi of my life. Other winners? The yellowtail taquitos, Tokyo sky train roll and the wagyu gyoza. Don't get me wrong, you get what you pay for. Tiny starter plates go for around £15 and cocktails start at £13...but this is a restaurant worth saving up for. A word of advice? Plan ahead. Tables open up for reservation 60 days ahead of the reservation date -- and book up in an hour!

Honestly, I had never tasted sushi before. a friend of mine who is a Japanese food lover took me at Sushisamba last night. Well, I can say that the California Maki I ordered, surprisingly suited my taste. The food was extremely good. I recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to try something unusually tasty.
Excellent food. I'd recommend the shrimp and green been tempura, filet stake. Ume Shu for drink.

results.name: Eagle London
results.address: 349 Kennington Lane, London SE11 5QY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
A superb evening out. The Eagle gets busy but there is still plenty of room to bust some moves to an array of funk filled Disco! 

The staff are friendly and waiting time at the bar is at a minimum. Also a large outdoor seating area is great to grab some fresh air or just to hang out on a warm summers eve.

Hit and miss. DJ California used to be a resident dj here, and he really got the dancefloor going properly with his skills. There's another person called James Hillard, he thinks he is a dj, but he doesn't know how to play a proper set or to get the people in the mood for dancing. Avoid any night with him.

I have always found the Eagle - one of the few independant gay bars in London a welcoming, relaxing and comfortable place. Without the attitude of the West End you are easily able to strike up conversation. The outside space is a great asset and there is a mixed crowd on most occasions. One slight frustration can be the price of the drinks although they are lower than West End standards

I really love this place. The have an excellent food menu at reasonable price. They also served some vegetarian menu. Surely delicious and healthy foods. The sandwich is very good, full of toppings and the patty is large enough for a serving. The fish and chips arealso flavourful too.

The early to mid week is a great time for meeting up with friends or meeting someone new. There`s a pool table & smoking area in a beautiful urban beer garden. The music is`nt too over powering that you cant enjoy a good chat and it`s very friendly & welcoming.
The weekend bursts full of character. From Thursday to Sunday anyone who loves going out in London will pass through the doors during this time. There is something different every Thursday night which draws in a great mix of people. Tonka friday`s is always nice and busy with bar food and the odd free shot! Saturdays has a different party each week with a BBQ`s or free shots depending on which night is on and to round up your week, finish it with a BANG! that is Horse Meat Disco! Not only will you feel like your part of a modern Studio 54 with the best Disco tracks from yesteryear but it will leave you wanting more which is why it has become the place to go on Sunday nights. Don`t be surprised if you see the odd celebrity there too!!! ; )
Have Fun!!!!! :)

results.name: Storm Nightclub
results.address: 28A Leicester Square, London WC2H 7LE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Horrible! Rude bouncers One of the bouncers asked if I had been drinking - around 10 pm last night. I said ''yes' and waited for a response - I was lucid and speaking clearly. After some silence, I asked 'Can we come in, yes or no' - guess the response - not a trick question.
Whatever the reason, because I am gay and with my boyfriend or that my boyfriend isn't white, I think the treatment of their potential customers is disgusting! 
I heard Marcarena playing in the background - do they know that this is 21 century? That they in the center of the UK capital? No - ignorance is bliss, so typically British, thinking that they are better than everyone else. Here's some news friends, those days are long gone ... say no more

I must have walked past this place a thousand times and never noticed it, hidden between a Yates and another nondescript pub on Leicester Sq. I was there for a comedy event and the place looks much of what I'd expected - a bit run down. It's in the basement, so can see it getting hot when packed full of people on their club nights. Also it means there is no phone signal. On the plus, the stage was set up well so I could see the acts (even from the back row) and they had a full bar, which they served efficiently.

went to the comedy club. totally unsuitable venue for comedy, we managed to grab one of about 20 seats where you could actually see the performer. Others were stuffed in down the sides with a very poor view.
Rude staff. we had 6 tickets; they couldn't cope with 4 of us arriving before the other two for some reason. extraordinarily poor customer service. NOT going back.
Place is good, misic is old skool, chicks are nice :)
Good place.Great evening out with friends lots of Fun

results.name: The Phene
results.address: 9 Phene Street, London SW3 5NY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Went on a Friday night with a girlfriend to grab some beers, enjoy the sun on their outside patio for the short bit it while it was out and have dinner.

Food: My girlfriend and I both ordered the burger. She added the pulled pork and I added the bacon to our burgers. Clearly we know how to eat! Unfortunately being from the states we expected our pulled pork and bacon to taste differently and were both disappointed. The burger itself is yummy as is.

Drinks: We ordered two beers with dinner. 

Price: For two people we paid 45.28 GBP.

Ambiance: The outdoor patio is great when the weather is nice. Definitely get there early since it's first come first serve. The space inside is very welcoming and cozy.

Service: Everyone from the bartender, hostess and server were all very friendly.

Would I go back? Definitely! It's a great spot in Chelsea.

Worst service in history. Sat down in a very smart and lovely place and waiting for over 10 minutes to receive the menu. After choosing our dishes for the menu we asked to for a wine recommendation only to be told by the waiter that she didn't drink red wine and have us a story on why she didn't like it. We then asked for an ale recommendation only be told that she didn't like that as well. I ordered the steak and my friend the venison. About 10 minutes after we had the order taken, the manager lady who also took our order returned to inform me that they had run out of steak. I ordered the venison instead, then about 5 mins later another waiter returned to say we that they couldn't take the temperature and then another waiter came to say the same thing and then another one. After finishing the main the rude lady manager waiter then came back again and after we repeated we didn't want dessert 5 times she finally left! Over all a really poor experience, however the food was good and the blonde girl waitress very nice.

This is my place! The Phene is definitely the best example of a pub in London. The place is really popular and gets busy, especially in the late hours. Reasonable prices and unique atmosphere. Highly recommend it.
Lovely Pub, I visited it recently and was delighted with the food. Thoroughly recommend this pub.
I went to the Phene for a business. The service was poor. I reckon this pub needs a better management.

results.name: Guanabara
results.address: New London Theatre, Parker Street, London WC2B 5PW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Brazilian traditions have always been interesting to me. When I visited it for the first time I had so much fun. It was like a carnival in Rio de Janeiro. Dynamic atmosphere and nice people. The food and drinks are great. Very interesting place.

Had food here before seeing War Horse at New London Theatre. We were a bit sceptical at first because it's clearly a night club rather than an evening meal restaurant however as we had booked our table in advance we went for it and was pleasantly surprised. The burgers we had were lovely, the waiters was top notch recommending cocktails and which we loved. Made our theatre night out, really enjoyable. Would like to go back for a night out.

Well organised for the World Cup, great food, service, atmosphere, staff, security. It was never on my list of places to go. But now I know the establishment I shall return in the near future for other sporting events!
a bit expensive and not necessarily the best! try Chimarrão in Portugal, a lot better
There are better bars/clubs around. Generic beer served by slow staff. Busy and bouncers ordering you around on busy nights. Pass!

results.name: The Roof Gardens
results.address: 99 Kensington High Street, London W8 5SA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Impeccable service, great view, very good food but quite expensive. Oh and the drinks are amazing!!

I had lunch here a few months ago. Pig cheeks, belly pork and chocolate brownies. Given the cost of the meal and the cost of pig cheeks, I'd have expected more cheeks on my plate... (just the one) the belly was ok - nothing special and another really small portion yet the brownie - 2 portions. I'd suggest another resturant if you want to impress, then come for a walk around the gardens and a cocktail.
Thank you very much all the crew :-)

The food here isn't anything to shout about but they have that beautiful rooftop space with amazing views. The gardens are split up with one side looking very Spanish villa-esque and the other slightly more traditional English. It's a nice place to visit once, but there isn't really anything compelling to bring you back repeatedly.

If you are attracted by the advertised view, keep in mind that it is available to those sitting at the few tiny tables on the outside terrace; people coming in for food sit inside, and their view is the terrace. As you dine, you have waiters and bar-terrace visitors - including elderly Japanese tourists with cameras - walking in front of you, and waiters and restaurant visitors - including loud and fiercely-dressed Russian-speaking ladies, apparently drawn to Virgin brand - walking immediately behind you, as the tables form a corridor alongside the terrace. The food is decent but unspectacular, and, together with the somewhat tired décor and competent but occasionally uncoordinated service, does not make for a competitive dining choice. You may very well consider coming here for drinks at the terrace, but as a place for a dinner (or lunch), "Babylon" is a questionable investment.

results.name: Rumba
results.address: 36 Shaftesbury Avenue, London W1D 7EP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I came here a few weeks back for a comedy night on a saturday night. The place was packed within minutes and there was a good atmosphere. Before the show started we made good use of the happy hour, which was really good value for money. Otherwise, the drinks were typical london prices. The comedy show was decent, as you usually expect, you get a mixture of good and slightly cringey acts! We enjoyed ourselves and considering we got our tickets from time out offers for dirt cheap, it was a good night!

Wow I never thought I would be giving Rumba a 1 star since I used to love their Thursday Movement DnB nite so much. We went on a Sat night and firstly a member of the door staff came over to us and said he would let us jump the tiny queue. Now I was standing at the cash till and they were demanding 20GBP each! I paid as we were meeting guests and did not want to argue and not be allowed in at all. Inside was awful. Gfriend groped at the bar within 5 minutes of going in. The main fault lies with the club's greedy entry policy in letting any out-of-town Tom, Dick and Scary into the club. And if you're going to pick up girls then good luck -- the place had so many frustrated men outnumbering the women it was like an angry sausage factory.

Came here for an after work drinks session that went on a bit longer than intended! So from what I can remember.... an amazing party atmosphere, DJ was great and even took requests! Drinks were cheap... again I think! Would definitely return, but don't tell the wife!

Came here on Friday with my girls and absolutely had the best night I've had in a while. The staff looked great, the DJ was awesome and a very fast service😍 coming back very soon to have another great night out.

If you're looking to be robbed 10+ pounds, look no further away. This is the ultimate place to have apple syrup shots in 1 inch plastic cups and enjoy the smell of sweat and rude staff. Total horse dong

results.name: The Loop
results.address: 19 Dering Street, London W1S 1AH, United Kingdom

results.name: Grace Bar & Restaurant
results.address: 44 Great Windmill Street, London W1D 7NB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Myself and my elderly, disabled, wheelchair user had booked a two course meal at this retaraunt four weeks in advance, making it clear that one of the parties was a wheelchair user. We made our way from South East London (about an hours journey) in the cold to what should have been the start of an enjoyable evening for my mother. Ten minutes before we were due to arrive at the restaraunt, I was called by the booking agent to say that the restaraunt had cancelled our booking, and that they were full.
By this time, we were outside the restaraunt, greeted by a security guard who also said they were full and could not accommodate us despite our booking many weeks in advance. 

I was left in the rain to wheel my elderly mother around from restaraunt to restaraunt to try and find somewhere else to eat, all of course were full due to the time of year and the majority needed previous booking. 

We were both extremely disappointed and put out, and this totally ruined what should have been a fun night of food and theatre. 

Very Poor Indeed!!!

This is an excellent place to go out! It has a big modern bar and great restaurant area upstairs, and downstairs they have a stylish cocktail lounge and club. No matter where you are there's a bar nearby. The service at the bar in the club can be slow, but that's the only drawback. Service at the other bars is as you'd expect it to be. It's a fun place.

I've had some brilliant nights out here and would highly recommend it! There's an area for you no matter what you feel like.

I came here for an event and thought it was pretty ok. It was on a Monday night, so I was sticking to soft drinks. But at £2.10 a pop I'm glad I didn't venture into the land of cocktails - my purse would not have been pleased with me. I'd probably come here again for a happy hour.

I really can't understand how people have rated this so highly. It is a terrible bar and club - officious and rude staff, expensive drinks, bad food. having booked an area for 10 people to eat, they shoved us in a corner of the dancefloor.

As a student, this was one of the places we often went to. The club isn't as big as some other clubs e.g. Piccadilly Institute and Ministry of Sound, but its still a nice club to go to. Luckily, its never been hugely packed when I've been so I was actually able to walk around without rubbing up anyone else.....
Would recommend going to if you're in Central London and looking for a night out.

results.name: Hilton London Stansted Airport
results.address: Round Coppice Road, Stansted CM24 1SF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Dreadful experience. Booked a meeting room, was forced to sign a contract; then when I had to cancel for a legitimate reason was charged £100 anyway. This was not explained when I cancelled, I only found out from my credit card bill.
When I called it was explained that I had signed a contract so tough luck!

Would expect better customer service from a "reputable" global hotel brand.

Will never go near them ever again. Feel like I have been completely cheated.
Not walking distance from the airport. You have to take shuttle and pay £6 roundtrip

Was very surprised. Very quiet considering how close it is to the airport. The front desk service was excellent: friendly, helpful and professional. The room was really nice and tidy and the bathroom was great. The pool and saunas were perfect. Exactly what was needed after the traveling. The provision of towels could have been a little more straightforward, but nothing to really complain about. The whole atmosphere is so relaxed and welcoming. There is a small outside area to sit and drink/ eat relax in. It would be really nice if this was bigger to accommodate more guests but was still lovely. The largest complaint was having to wait for 30mins for a cocktail, which, when it arrived, had no alcohol in it. Another one was provided another 15mins or so later free of charge. Took a very long time. Other than that, a great experience and will be back again!

Stayed for one night before a birthday party. The hotel was clean and tidy and just a few minutes to the terminal. The room was a little small but comfortable. Slept very well and I was feeling good on the next day. The breakfast was cooked very early - at 5.30am, which was surprising. The staff were friendly and very efficient. Would recommend it.

I stayed here for a night prior to an early morning flight. For me the experience was just average. The hotel itself is pleasant enough, and the room was well finished, but one thing I really need a hotel to get right - especially when I'm on business - is enable me to get a good night's sleep. Unfortunately the rock hard mattress and noise from what I think was a hot water heater (which constantly cycled on and off throughout the night) meant I slept poorly.

The price is reasonable, so I suppose that should be taken into account, but to have to pay extra for a shuttle bus or WiFi is simply penny-pinching in my opinion. After all, how many people who stay at an isolated airport close to nothing but an airport won't use the shuttle?

My own experience wasn't great, but yours may be better. After all, this is a perfectly decent hotel. Maybe pack a set of ear plugs if you're a light sleeper.

results.name: Number 1 Bar & Restaurant
results.address: 1 Duke Street Hill, London SE1 2SW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This is a great all night bar, sport playing on lots of screens, pool tables at reasonable prices. Drinks are pricey, but it's free entry. They serve food, although I've never eaten here. Staff are good.
Toilets could do with a refurb (no I'm not obsessed with toilets, I just like roomy new age loos, not dingy small loos)
Very good pub to watch football games. The pints are not expensive and there are lots of screens. They also have a private room.
Excellent food, excellent music, excellent service. Very very nice!! We will definitely be back.

I booked a Christmas party for my office and we all loved it.

The food was really good and plentiful, the staff very helpful and the place was very clean.

We also used the sports bar to play pool which was a lot of fun. Again quite clean and very helpful staff.

A great venue for a good night out. 
£8 per hour for pool which is very reasonable for central London.
All of the staff were lovely and very welcoming.
Started off quite quiet but very quick got very busy downstairs and had a great atmosphere

results.name: The Shoreditch
results.address: 145 Shoreditch High Street, London E1 6JE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I had a horrible experience here. The 'MANAGER' singed off some of my hair when making some one a cocktail. I asked to speak to speak to the manager as when alighting an alcoholic drink in a busy place, it is vital to be careful. The bartender as the time told me she was the manager and was very rude to me. I was even more disappointed as she then tried to get me kicked out as i consisted with trying to speak to the actual manager and shouting over the music. After the bar closed, i decided id try to speak to the manager. The door staff refused to give me the managers name. STRANGE. I then saw the actuall manager walk into the bar, i then tried to speak to him and the bouncer, very aggressively picked me and chucked me out onto the street. I HAVE NEVER BEEN TREATED LIKE THIS ANYWHERE. ABSOLUTELY SHAMEFULL

Good value for Happy hour but all a bit run down. Held a surprise birthday here and they let us decorate the area with balloons and streamers which was good. Also allowed us to bring a cake. the music is standard radio hits. All good for a dance but there are better bars in the area once happy hour is done and dusted

I came for a surprise birthday bash, on my way in I was asked if the gift I brought in was alcohol, yes, a bottle of Rum. It was taken off me to be stored in the security office, wasn't happy with this as 1, it was my friends gift and 2) It could be seen in the window by people coming in so could've spoilt the surprise. I spoke to the manager who spoke to the door staff and agreed I could bring it in on the promise of not consuming it in the venue. Obviously I agreed.
We went downstairs for the main do, we had a small area reserved which soon filled up and other people were coming down as there is a strange/small dance are in the room next door where music was playing.
The décor is not great, the atmosphere was great, but due to the party guests not the place. The drinks post 8pm were overpriced, hopefully to save up for redecorating and the staff were quite abrupt at the end of the night in trying to get people out.
I wouldn't recommend it for the area, although it didn't spoil a great party.

Worst experience I have ever had in a venue. 

Booked in advance for a group of 10 for my 22nd birthday. Food arrived over an hour late, was cold and came in the front door not cooked on site, then flies proceeded to constantly land on it. Charged for several cocktails, never served them. 

Manager then had us evicted by security for complaining about the food and asking for a refund even though we hadn't eaten it. Reason: wasting her time while she could be serving other customers. Avoid at all costs.

Went here for a surprise birthday party last night. The downstairs area was booked for us, the bar staff is very friendly and surprisingly very quick service. Happy hour is 2 4 1 on cocktails and 4 bottles of beer for £10. But it only lasts till 8pm. They have a big cocktail menu with quirky glasses to serve them in. Personally I prefer the top bar- as they have better beer selection and is not as hot as downstairs!

results.name: Village Underground
results.address: 54 Holywell Lane, Shoreditch, London EC2A 3PQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Visited the Village Underground for the first time to see the most excellent Kate Tempest. Incredible show in a fantastic space which was beautifully lit and had an ass kicking sound system and even a few tasty beers to sink during the show. Well worth a visit!

I was invited to the Village Underground as a guest for a concert. Upon arrival, I joined the 10 minute queue, that led to me my first contact with the club - the bouncer. Having been an experienced clubber in the 2000's, I know the drill. But as I approached him, the badly organised queue led me to tripping and giving the bouncer a remark that the fence is too far from the pavement and as such is dangerous. This is where the bouncer felt inclined to comment I was "spaced out!!" He proceeded to search me thoroughly including all my pockets and a bag search with a 4 inch flash light! He felt authorised to dispose all he thought was trash in my bag, like bits of paper or empty water bottles. He stole (took for him self and put it in his pocket) the last remaining dustings of my 420. Finally, having checked every little pocket of my wallet and the amount of money I had on me, he cattled me through to the club.I felt utterly harassed and violated. This is where my visit ended. On the exit, I spoke to a few friends who all seem to agree this behaviour is usual and, as such, normal. I disagree. I was there to spend a good evening with friends, enjoy some music, have a drink and go home reminiscing a pleasant experience. That can't happen if the club chooses to proceed with Drakon entrance policies, that I do understand have their healthy and safety role, but their execution is law violation. Even the police needs a reasonable grounds of suspicion for a search. I wouldn't recommend this club to anyone.

Great venue. Went to see a 5 piece band and it was so intimate, fantastic. 

Definitely a great venue for music, but also a really cool venue for other events. 

And for us girls... The toilets were clean, paper available and the sinks were clean too!
Brilliant venue, light and airy, comfortable accommodated our group, staff were all very friendly.

I have been to the Village Underground twice for the Blitz Party. Both expereinces were a trip back to 1939 without the bomb threats. This was a serious party, where people took pride in the way they dressed to ensure they complied with the time's fashions. No one looked like they in costumes, and if anyone was, it was obvious and strange. People really went out of their way to wear authentic clothes from the that time. Men wore uniforms, women wore dresses with bright red lipstick and their hair up in Victory rolls. The setting is also perfect because the Village Underground is an old warehouse with only windows on the ceiling, so you did get the feel you were in some kind of shelter. There was a live swing band performing that were so very talented. There were ladies there doing girls' hairdos for free with Victory rolls and such. The people are creative, relaxed and friendly. My only recommendation is make sure you dress in layers when you go to the Village Underground. Outside can be cold and inside can be scorching hot. I highly recommend the Blitz Party at the Village Underground.

results.name: Platinum Lace Bar & Gentlemen's Club
results.address: 13 Coventry Street, London W1D 7DH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This strip club is very controlled, in the sense that if you are a customer you really need to stand your ground to choose the girls you actually like. There is a lot of bribery within the staff (security, managers, DJ's...) and some 'favourite' girls (which aren't the prettiest or more talented ones). These 'favourite' girls tip substantially the staff so they can access high spender customers easily with no competition. Good customers are escorted by security to their tables, then they are only introduced by the 'favourite' girls (which aren't the best girls), the management and security make sure that other girls don't approach the big spenders. Actually if other girls try to reach these customers and complain about security being unfair, then the management sack them, that's how unfair and dodgy this club's workplace is for the girls. Now, if you are an intelligent customer with money to spend in return of great fun, when you come in go to the bar, get a drink, and choose the girl that you like. If the staff persist that you should go with certain girls, say no, it's your choice. When you make a choice and you are happy talking to a girl, if she is all of the sudden called on the stage, just take her straight away for a dance to skip the stage (DJ's are tipped by the 'favourites' so they don't dance on the stage and call girls talking to customers so the 'favourites' can grab these customers. During the dance you will have more time to decide to take your girl to the VIP, unless you have done it already. I'm sure the DJ will be pestering your girl to go on the stage as soon as you come out of the booth.
Easily the best gentlemen's club in London, very professional management team and a first rate service, also a very beautiful club. More than worth a visit

As an ex-regular of this place I can highly discourage people from going there. This place has gone way downhill. When it first opened was quite nice. The best strip club I had been at the time. 

The decor is probably the best I've seen. This place has quite a cool atmosphere. The only downside can be some constantly moving disco lighting that sometimes can get in your eye and irritate you.

With a negative now. This place is not what it used to be. It is NOT a Gentlemen's club. It is a low lifes place as far as the strippers are concerned. Where before I could hardly find a rude one, these days they are everywhere, they are aggressive, pushy, will get your for a private dance only to start proposing what else you could get if you pay more, they will lie about the duration of their dances and generally they will treat you like a soulless cash machine. Surely not all girls are the same but i can speak confidently that the vast majority of the girls are complete idiots of no class. It is very obvious to me that the management doesn't give a toss of who they hire.

Now as far as the handling goes from the management while you are there I have goods things to say. Few times i had to complain about something and they were always attentive and very professional in dealing with it.
They do seem to genuinely care. At the same time i don't get how they have so many low lifes working there for them.

In addition this place has nowadays terrible waitresses. They will try to rob you on purpose. I have had this happened to me more than once and remember i was a regular for a long time and am in a position to know. What they do these days is to keep your change or as with some other staff to try to subtly psychologically black mail you in order for you to leave a tip. This begging/aggressive attitude that I have seen really does no favors to this place. Be aware of the waitresses. It is up to the customer to decide when to tip and how much.

Lastly the quality of the girls in terms of looks is slightly above average in my opinion.

If you care about class, manners and a human attitude avoid this place. You will be treated like a loser but I suppose you would expect mostly losers in places of this caliber. There are better strip clubs out there, places that are REAL Gentlemens clubs with capital G.

Last night i had a great experience with Platinum Lace in Piccadilly. I must recommend that Gentleman's club is the best. Thank you for organising our event last night. Everybody enjoyed the occasion and commented on how well it was run. The venue, food and staff all contributed to the great atmosphere...

I visited Platinum Lace on Coventry while working away on a business trip, I was really surprised at how plush and sophisticated the club was, the girls are not pushy at all. It made me feel comfortable which is what I was looking for.

results.name: SophistiCats
results.address: 28 Marylebone Lane, London W1U 2DR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I have been too many places in london i've been to many places all over the world including las vegas nevada. the vibe in sophisticats. There is no way to describe it the only way to experience it is if you book a v i p on any Saturday night any time of the year, just make sure it's saturday & make sure your wallet has a fat belly don't worry if you have one! All that matters is your wallet.
Now if that has put you off then close this review and forget sophisticats ( tourists are welcome as well i'm sure just don't hang about because you won't have much change to take back home)
Now for the real g's out there. I will eat my hat if you don't have the experience of your life
Siesa is amazing. Would go back in a heart beat!!!

results.name: Hilton London Docklands Riverside
results.address: 265 Rotherhithe Street, London SE16 5HW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
We booked this hotel on Hotwire and got a Friday night for £54.00 which I actually thought was amazing value. However, based on the idea that if we had booked with Hilton directly and had to pay £100+ I would not say that the hotel is worth it. 

Located a fifteen minute walk from Canada Water the hotel is a little out of the way. If you want to get food near your hotel then you are better off getting something at the mini retail park near Canada Water station (if Pizza Hut & Frankie and Bennies is your thing) or getting something before going to the hotel as there is just one pub near the hotel itself. 

Our hotel room was of reasonable size with a partial river view. There was a small balcony but it wasn't clean and there were no chairs to sit out on it. We don't smoke but if you are a smoker then I imagine it will be perfect for you as its not fitted to do much else. 

The bed was wooden and creaked terribly but apart from that was quite comfortable. The black out blinds were fantastic as we had wanted to make use of the late check out, however, the cleaners came at 9am, 10am and again at 11am to check if we had left our room. Needless to say we felt pressured to check out as they wanted to clean the room which wasn't the relaxing experience we had expected. 

All in all this is not a bad hotel but I wouldn't say it's any better than a Travel Lodge or a Holiday Inn. Yes, there are more facilities like the spa, fitness centre etc but the spa had been out of order for four days prior to our arrival and so the supposed 'luxury' extras didn't make a difference for us. As a place to put your head down for the night it's decent but nothing special. There are much nicer hotels which a much more central location for the price they are charging. (However, for £54 that we paid? It was great.)

Lovely holt over looking the river and service you expect from a Hilton. My room was small but adequate on site gym / pool and amazing views. Free boat to canary wharf which makes travelling easy enough. Breakfast is buffet style with a good variety and good quality. On a warm day you can have breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Thames and Canary wharf.
An excellent hotel in an excellent location! Rooms were clean; staffs were friendly and helpful. An excellent choice for everybody.

Incredible day and nighttime view of Canary Wharf - having a private river taxi over the river was a really special edition as the hotel itself is a fair distance from a tube stop.

We arrived to freshly squeezed lemonade a lovely addition to our warm welcome.

The staff were incredibly helpful - I just wish I had known there was a swimming pool free for use by guests before I arrived!
Wonderful place , used a wowcher but was treated equally , with respect so much so that have since been without a wowcher and the food was excellant. Illy could nothave been more helpful !

results.name: Queens Ice and Bowl
results.address: 17 Queensway, Bayswater, London W2 4QP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: It was fun. The atmosphere was pleasant and I had a great time. It's more exciting with all your friends and family!

I've been there several times for some fun when i was visiting and the experience was absolutely horrible. Some of the iceskating staff are kind but most of them are mean. The management sucks. The food is fine but i cant say anything for bowling since i've never been. The ice is hard and rokety. If anything is stolen they are in no way helpful, its as they're saying " Yah, ok. Your stuff got stolen. We'll pretend to be helpful to make ourselves look and blame the rest on you. Oh! and we'll also ALWAYS say you 'lost it' instead of it being stolen. If anyone is planning to go ice-skating, then i'd recommend Natural History museum in winter, or Alexandra Palace witch is open all year. DO NOT go to Queens for iceskating. If you are having lessons, the teacher are great, very kind. The shoes are made of plastic and will give you blisters, and after they redo the ice they let you go on with ought it being dry, so your skating on half ice half water.

This is the worst experience I've had in my entire LIFE!!!! We were 5, we went there on 1st nov 2013 at around 6:00pm. Paid then started playing. We put our bags right next to us and after 15min of playing one bag was GONE! Management was not cooperative at all to call the police nor to show us pics on the camera that was right above our heads. !st the cashier said noone was allowed to vision thefilm apart rom the police. They did not call the police when asked several times, then they told us to call them ourselves...(we're French we don't even know what the number would be) They said after 20 minutes of waiting and anguishing (all our passports, credit cards, money, keys ...etc were inside that bag) that the angle was not right and that they could not vision the film. When we threatenend to sue them, all of a sudden they accepted to show us the film which clearly showed that the people next to us had stolen our bag. We asked them for the French embassy number and the answer was: "surf yourself to the number..." Eventually when i complained to the police that these people were not cooperating and that something was fishy (we suspected they were involved), magically the bag reappered between the game machines with everything inside. THIS IS a TERRIBLE PLACE TO GO TO..DON'T EVER SET FOOT THERE!! N"Y ALLEZ PA!!! VOUS ALLEZ VS FAIRE ENTUBER D"UNE FACON OU D"UNE AUTRE. We said we were going to open a file against them but didn't have time to go to a police station and were too happy and relieved to go back home with our passports...All neighboring shops told us that this kind of felony was happening EVERYDAY in that place!!! Don't use your LONDON PASS to go there, pick another destination!!!!!

I've been to Queens a few times and the staff have always been friendly. The skating's great, with lessons, discos etc. happening all the time and as one of the other reviewers mentioned, the food is really good and freshly prepared, which you don't find too often. It's fun - definitely worth a visit.
Easy bowling alley that's close to work. Great for a game during lunchtime. Found that through January they are doing a sale and so two games cost £5. Friendly staff.

results.name: The Mayfair Club
results.address: 49-50 Dover Street, London W1S 4NY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A great way to carry on the night after Mahiki or Funky B. Hot dancers, nice venue and reasonable drinks prices- a much better choice than the over-saturated commercial alternatives- a class above.

Finally find an elegant and very exclusive gentlemans club London that doesn't rip you off. Very modish, luxurious surroundings, hottest and classiest girls, relaxing until late night, girl on the pole, Lap Dance and many more attractions which made your evening fully entertaining.

On my personal Experience I believe this statement that “The Mayfair Club is really one of the most lavish gentlemens club London”. Luxury atmosphere, finest girls, Lap Dancing and V.I.P services make smile on your face. So why not you take a visit I am sure you also find your precious relaxing moment there.
Cold beer , best service, comfort zone

results.name: The Horse & Groom
results.address: 28 Curtain Road, London EC2A 3NZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Bad loud music, expensive drinks, ripoff cover, very hot with no air circulation, and definitely way too many people. Overcapacity so they can make more money even though it makes everything horrible. Save yourselves. Avoid.
Late-night dirty Shoreditch boozer with two floors of sticky dancing. It's open until 4, hence the draw. Enter at your own peril.

Friendly, clean and simple. 

Ideal during the day for a place to get a nice quiet pint and wait for all of this to blow over.

Horse & Groom are the kind of friendly local that often host private parties and events for a cool, creative crowd - drinks are cheap, staff are friendly and they let you bring in your own DJ/decorations. It's also a top secret tip if you want to be able to get a table during the week; others nearby are always rammed but this is (if events aren't on) usually peaceful.

I've been to some really great music nights at The Horse & Groom, with a great crowd and a fun atmosphere - but it seems this must be restricted to the weekend.

I called in on a Tuesday night and the place was dead - actually not a single person. Nor was there any music on, so there was no atmosphere at all. The only noise was from the private event upstairs (it was a Speed Dating night apparently). We didn't even stay for one drink as it felt pretty awkward being there. 

If you're looking to go here, I'd definitely recommend going on a Friday or Saturday.

results.name: Agenda
results.address: 3 Mincing Lane, London EC3R 7AA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Good place to start a night out in the city because of the happy hour. As of my last visit the happy hour includes all drinks at half price (5-8pm). Clientele includes a lot of fake tan and slick gel haircuts but it is the City after all! Toilets do include toilet guys/gals with the usual annoying proverbial one-liners so that brings the rating down at least one star!

I was refused entry by the doorman during happy hour for not being "dressed appropriately" and not looking "professional enough". (Dress shoes, black jeans and a long sleeve Henley). As I walked away a man walked right past him in converse shoes, jeans and a T-shirt without a word. When asked why him and not me he answered "I don't have to explain myself to you". That's how customers are treated? Keep your food and drinks. There are thousands of other places without prejudice at the door.

A standard city bar / meat market near Tower Hill that can be a bit male heavy, There is a happy hour early on and drinks prices are pretty good. The place can get pretty raucous and expect glass / drinks on the floor. The dancefloor is pretty good and plays standard chart and r&b. If you're after a dance Agenda is a great place to go to after you've been to some other bars first.

Thurs night is the best, Fridays are 2nd, Sats are active but much tamer than either TH or FR. Thurs is when all the girls from the offices nearby party hard and late - the place is slamming from half-past 5p to 11p. A band or DJ is usually playing on Thurs and there are often office parties spread throughout the place. Getting a drink is a major event - expect to stand at the bar for 5min or more - but its a way to meet people - who are generally very friendly. People spill-over into the covered courtyard, which makes it nice to be able to talk to your mates, and catch a smoke. There is a Italian restaurant across the courtyard, which is the Best place to get a drink - while the chaos is in full-swing at Agenda (but - the restaurant empties about 6ish and closes about 8p-9p depending on how busy they are.) The crowd is early 20s to early 30s, young professionals getting their "party on" before they spend time on the weekend in whatever area they commute from (outide of the financial district) and their favorite Local.
Do not go without your taste card. Expensive and food not that great. Poddy reccomends the sparkling water!

results.name: The Penthouse London
results.address: 1 Leicester Square, London WC2H 7NA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This is a another Leicester Square money pit, three floors of varied average DJs will be combined with exceptionally un interactive and rude staff. To its credit you will find people in there and a good 'mix' if not to date purely to watch as entertainment. Your money and time is best spent elsewhere, but it's worth a visit for the view and one beer

Great night out with my friends! Totally took advantage of the Happy Hour where cocktails were 2 for 1! And then we ventured down to the club when it opened at 10pm and danced the night away. Great West End venue with a beautiful view of London. Really friendly staff and we took lots of pictures! Will definitely be returning soon!

SO FREAKING SWEATY THERE IS NO COOL ROOM TO RELAX IN!!!!!!!!!!! the drinks were a rip off for what you got. THEY PLAYED TERRIBLE REMIXES OF TERRIBLE SONGS. the amount of smut i experienced in my brief visit there was terrible the overuse of terrible is to emphasise how you should avoid it hell. never let yourself inside it, oh and dont get me started on the stairs when im drunk i do not want to be going up and down flights and flights of stairs

WASTE OF TIME!... I went without a ticket they never let me in for my birthday, I went with a ticket (2 guys) on another night and they said I need a group of girls.... seriously ? why am I going to go clubbing with a girl for 1 and for 2 if i had a girl why would i go clubbing ? STUPID ideology, go next door instead... then the bouncer says its a famous place ? Ye right what celeb have you ever heard saying, im going penthouse... ruined my day out twice, if i go Leicester square again, I wouldn't even bother going in there

**Having read the other reviews on here, it seems like this bar treats its guest either good or bad depending on what RACE they belong too!**

Me and two of my friends were on a day-trip to London after their honeymoon, this was my treat to them.
We were first enticed and greeted (surely friendly) by the door staff who did a good job of promoting the Happy Hour - 2 for 1 cocktails.
When we got to the bar in the lift (7th floor) had a nice feel and great views
But we placed our order of cocktails and were forgotten. When I enquired at the bar, our drinks were made in haste.
When we got our drinks (even though we asked for it at the Terrace we got them on the sitting area) they tasted rank! water-downed and tasted more like flavoured and colored water.
When I complained about the quality, I was spoken down to and made to feel like I am some high school fool (this was by a hostess who should have been better fitted on a catwalk with her mouth shut rather than customer service). I know my cocktails and that wasnt what we were served. Another couple got Cosmopolitans that looked like Cosmo and had the sugar lining on the glass.
I was so disgusted not with the lateness of our order but by the wrong type of drink been serverd and the attitude of the hostess I complained to, that I turned all our drinks upside down so that the staff have more clean-up to do.
Not even a apology or a complementry voucher we got, 
Note to the bar - if you hire people on the basis of their looks make sure they have the people skills to match!

results.name: Piccadilly Institute
results.address: The London Pavillion, 1 Piccadilly Circus, London W1J 0DA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I booked a table for my girlfriends birthday and it was great. Bottle of vodka on the table and cocktails served in IV bags like a hospital... Very weird but cool! Spent half the night exploring as there are so many rooms which are all different.

Special thanks to the amazing security staff who managed to find my girlfriend's bag and return it with passport, phone and money still inside after she left it on a table!!

We will be back!

Started okay but the staff quickly turned the experience around. The club in itself is pretty average yet extremely pricey, won't be a lot of fun unless you have more money than you'd want to spend and an encounter with the club manager has assured absolutely zero chance of a return. Never come across a more aggravating and senseless man in my life.

Absolutely terrible club. Where do I start? The music is terrible. The bartender asked if I wanted ice with my Meantime pale ale! The club had a security guard going around forcing us to put our coats in the classroom rather than leaving them on unoccupied seats or in a corner. The security guard pushed my girlfriend when she wouldn't move her coat from an unused seat. Avoid at all costs. There's many better places nearby.

Ok, so if your in the west end and in need of a cheap cheerful colourful cocktail - this is your place. However don't expect to have your socks knocked of by any creative mixology. Its all brightly coloured juices, purées and sugar basically but heck at 2 4 1 until 9pm - whose complaining!? There are themed rooms and the place has various sounds coming from each. Its a bit of a mish mash of messy after work drinkers and tourists come 9.01pm.

Absolutely terrible, the air con was not working properly so it smelt like a gym. The staff were rude....1 girl was walking around with shots to sell but was more focused on dancing and enjoying herself so when she bumped into me and the drinks fell she demanded an apology. I refused as she was drinking more shots than she was selling. I ordered a bottle of JD to come to our table the girl said it was £150 but when I went to pay with my debt card she said I had to go to the bar if I had no cash. I walked 3 steps and it cost me £130 so she was blatantly ripping me off. I also tried to order a skittle bomb at the bar where there was a new bar maid who noticed it was not on the menu and asked another more senior staff member to price up the drinks so she could serve me. The more senior girl said if it was not on the menu she could not serve it. I walked to the bar around the corner ordered the same drink and they served me no problem. I went to the toilet and tipped the toilet attendant as you do. Later on I needed to go toilet again and this cheeky so and so demanded I pay more. At this point I told him what he could do with himself. When this place was on and on it wasn't amazingly fantastic but it was not to the point where I actually wanted to come home and write a review as to what a joke this place is. I had no problem with the music or the other guests. But there is something that seriously needs addressing in this place so now you have been warned.

results.name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel London - Hyde Park
results.address: 150 Bayswater Road, London W2 4RT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: DoubleTree by Hilton-London Hyde Park is perfect for sightseeing, because it is in the center of the city and has accessibility to the public transport. It is in only 10 minutes walking distance of Big Ben, Parliament, and Westminster Abbey. Cookies on arrival were so delicious and there was an extremely friendly receptionist (Sarah) when I checked in. There were great facilities in my room and free Wi-Fi was a fabulous bonus. The city cafe on the second floor had both wonderful food and view.

This hotel is okay. Unfortunately we were assigned to an accessible room, which normally would be okay but in this case, had a sink the size of one you'd normally find in a camper!
