The bed was as comfortable as possible, but filled up most of the room. The location is quiet and pretty, across from the park, but not that close to any action.

I visited a friend in London for four days, and once booked my room, I realized the hotel was renovated. I was fascinated by the atmosphere, my room shone with cleanliness. My friend was at work during the days and fortunately Miguel made my stay easy and memorable. He gave me excellent advice regarding places to visit, answered all my questions and assisted when I needed any help. One of the evenings I spent with my friend in The Brasserie & Bar in the hotel, cocktails were unique.

I tried to reach a guest...They don't have an operator...I wish you good luck as I couldn't speak with anyone ??? I prefer the Park Plaza facing the Parliament...That one is awesome, modern and very well located.
You're paying for the area, not really for the service (checkin is really slow) or amenities.

results.name: Chinawhite
results.address: 4 Winsley Street, London W1W 8HF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great club and vibes! Central London is the place to be on a weekend night or even in the mid of the week, when you feel like partying or just want some pure fun. The club may get too overcrowded and the prices too high, but if you want to be part of a sophisticated and very classy crowd, this is the right club!

I guess, whatever review I leave on here, regarding this high end club of Central London will be nothing new, especially regarding the ultra high prices however, but that is part of the entire night life experience after all. I had some sort of high expectations about Chinawhite and the décor did not disappoint me, nor the glamorous crowd and good tracks, so if an expensive and top-notch type of club is what you look for your night out, you will definitely love it!

We were a big and mixed group of friends and one of them, who is a member had our names on the guest list, so the entering was quite easy and for free, but if that was not the case, I would certainly not go to such a place, where prices are exorbitant and posey is the right word to describe them! Nothing against that, but I am just not from the people, who have money to blow and such clubs are all about that!

My first time going to Chinawhite was when a friend of mine introduced me to it, as he was celebrating his birthday in here and I felt so much in love with it!! I absolutely love it and the blasts I had here are second to none! I love the fact that you have to be dressed very posh and stylish when go there, but that is part of the clubbing experience, so what is better than be part of a posh crowd and dance on great music?!!! A Must go if you want to have a memorable night out!

A great place to spend an evening and enjoy the lovely music played to you by the ever experienced DJ's its a place to socialise with london's elete and feel elete yourself as the service is extensively catered.
The Drinks are to a cost as one would expect but well worth the experience.

results.name: funkybuddha
results.address: 15 Berkeley Street, London W1J 8DY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: One of the asian's gathered club with nice ong filled B52 coffee liquor and good music. Ladies go in for free before 11pm but make sure you get on guestlist. It is always packed.

Being regular clubbers in London I can honestly say that we had a totally fabulous night out at Official Funky Buddha that will be difficult to beat!. If you want to party in style and feel like a VIP this is the place to be.. you are treated like a valued customer by the club's staff and they all worked hard to ensure that our party had a fantastic time from the minute we entered the club to leaving in the small hours! They have a superb calendar of events and we will definitely be coming back soon as the DJ and club ambiance was wicked!!.

This is a place for adults to come and have fun. Dont bother turning up if you're drunk, too young or in a silly mood. You won't get in. Sophisticated and well heeled clientele are the order of the night. Expect to pay well for drink. Superb events and functions and definitely in the top class of Mayfair clubs. I love it.

Funky Buddha is a good club to go out and enjoy a Friday or Saturday night to unwind and partying all night. 
The atmosphere is good and very friendly staff. The entrance is sometimes free before 11am if you are on the guestlist. 
I also went through LuxGuestList and I spent a wonderful evening with drinks provided by sponsors. 
The atmosphere was hot and well selected guests.
Great venue, great staff and good service

results.name: The Big Chill House
results.address: 257-259 Pentonville Road, London N1 9NL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Popped in here yesterday for a payday work lunch with about 6 colleagues. The sun was out so we headed upstairs for large roof terrace which considering how lovely the day was, was quite quiet with only a few other people up there.
The staff were really friendly, and the decor is nice and contemporary and their are lots of corners and tucked away seating to make you feel you're not too crammed in, we sat on a large table with big bench seats which ws perfect for our size group.
The food was typical pub grub style, think burgers, fish finger sandwiches etc. Most of us had the delicious chorizo sandwiches served with sweet potato fries. and everything was pretty good quality and tastey. Most meals were around the £10 mark, we used a TasteCard which made our lunch even cheaper. 
Will definitely be back for more of the menu at some point soon. YUM

I wanted to love Big Chill House so much, but they sure so make it difficult. I had heard that they possessed a great rooftop terrace (fact) so I planned a party there. They wouldn't let me reserve terrace space but assured me that it wouldn't be busy. When I arrived the terrace was full to capacity with a queue out the door. With minimal seating, my friends and I were forced to stand in a traffic area where we continuously got harassed by security to move (problematic seeing as one of my friends was on crutches). Once the crowd thinned out we finally got seats, but by then the terrace had stopped serving drinks -- no drinks after 10pm. I would return to Big Chill again but only for a quick rooftop pint, and never again in a big group. Lesson learned!

Just popped in here for a quick drink with a friend as I was passing through Kings Cross, it is quite a stylish pub with a large downstairs area with lots of seats then a 1st floor Games Room with a fusball table in the middle and a roof terrace that looks over East London.

I wasn't massively impressed with the range of beers or the knowledge of the staff, particularly as they were advertising outside to say they sold a range of craft beers, yet when I asked for a big and hoppy IPA I was told that they didn't have anything like that and offered a can of lager!

I imagine on a sunny day in London, the roof terrace would be a great place to go for a group of people just looking to have a bit of a laugh but be prepared to empty your wallets quite quickly (although that could be because I'm an outsider to that there London place!)

Decent bar located near King's Cross. There's a small, but good rooftop where you can watch the game and grab drinks until 11pm when they shut her down. The downstairs is bustling, but is way crowded, so indulge at your own risk. They also play tunes on weekend evenings.

Food is really decent for a pub/club, and there's a good selection of drinks. The roof terrace is lovely in the summer too. But you pay through the nose for the nice decor and free WiFi in the cost of food and drink. This place is aimed at students - which is fine - but students with money.

results.name: Zoo Bar & Club
results.address: 13-17 Bear Street, Leicester Square, London WC2H 7AQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
The perfect place if you are wanting to party with mostly tourists to commercial pop and dance. In that mindset, a great bar/club and I've had some brilliant nights here (for the same but with a live band see Waxy O'Connors a few streets away).

If you want a more discerning dance music experience, try further afield. After all, Leicester Square is where those who don't know where the best London clubs are come to party.

I like the bar. The drinks are affordable. The people are open-minded and social there. 
I usually visit the bar from 5 to 9pm, because the Happy Hour can offer you good deals.

Our experience at Zoo Bar was fantastic form start to finish. The music was good, drinks were reasonably priced and staff were very friendly. There are many different areas to the club with lots of different music. When our friend became too drunk the staff were the most friendly and helpful I have ever experienced. They could not do enough to help and it made the entire evening much more enjoyable and pleasant. Delcio in particular was incredibly helpful and kind and we were all very grateful for his help. Would definitely recommend Zoo Bar to others.

I love this place - great venue, affordable prices and staff is polite. 
If you want to have an unforgettable evening, you are on the right place! Excellent pub and you can dance all night!

This is probably the first bar/club I went when I arrive to London because I wanted to meet people and make friends. 
It is actually full of foreigners and tourists. I didn't really enjoy the music. 
But the cocktails are really cheap during the happy hour and it is open everyday so this is kind of the place to go when everything else is closed.

results.name: The Nest
results.address: 36 Stoke Newington Road, Dalston, London N16 7XJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Great little dive bar with a good selection of drinks and impressive DJ line up!

Try the frozen cocktails - but always ask for an extra shot in them!

Very hot, very sweaty, if thats how you like your nights out this is the place for you. Great fun. Great music. Great crowd. Gets cramped and a bit starry eyed in the early hours. Standard stuff, £8 for a spirit mixer, about £3-4 pint. Bathrooms leave alot to be desired but hey ho - cant get all right!
Good venue for DJ nights, quite dark and dingy but its pretty big and opens till late. It is always really busy on weekends.

Hot, sweaty and a lot of fun. The Nest is a very unassuming club however they regularly have top nights on which probably explains why anyone with an advance ticket has to be in by half 11. If you miss the deadline then usually you'll have a long wait outside. Drinks aren't cheap but that's pretty standard these days. Well worth a visit

The Nest puts on some brilliant nights - live music and DJ sets, however it is super popular. If you can buy a ticket - do it. If you can get there early - do it. Otherwise prepare for a super long, slow moving queue. Like most Dalston clubs it's below ground so it's got a low ceiling, no windows and gets super hot! Last time I was there it seems that Essex had started to invade the normally hipster crowd, but still worth checking out.

results.name: Zigfrid von Underbelly
results.address: 11 Hoxton Square, London N1 6NU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Absurd rules and horrible service.
Why do I say this? The bouncers would not let me in unless I emptied my water bottle. I had no choice as some friends were already inside.
When I tried to order drinks the bar staff ignored me even though I asked them if they could serve me.
If you enjoy being treated badly then this is the place for you... if you are like the rest of the human race avoid it.

Nice bar, but the bar staff were pretty terrible. Two pints served with about an inch and a half of foam head. I politely asked for them to be topped up and the barmaid was in a huff for the rest of the night.

Nice decor.

Awful, rude and aggressive security staff. In London, you sort of get used to being treated like cattle, but what we experienced on Saturday night will ensure that we, or our friends, will never be back to Zigfrid von Underbelly. 

We were a bit slow moving from the main room towards the downstairs section, to which one of the bouncers reacted by shouting at us. He quickly got worked up to being physically aggressive towards my girlfriend and spilled her first-round drink over her head. This obviously didn’t go down well with me and we got promptly kicked out, along with our friends, after having just bought a £100 round. 

The bouncer continued shouting at us, in front of his supervisor (who did nothing, obviously) and guests walking in and out. Ease up on the ‘roids, dude.

Horrendous experience. Personal belongings were stolen by a staff member, when we confronted the manager/supervisor, they defended the staff member and told us to call the police. 
People working there are a waste of oxygen.

Feels out of the way, but is actually not too far from Old Street and Hoxton Overground. The venue has two floors. The lower one presents live music on a nightly basis, in a retro-style setting - the sound was good and it's a decent size stage for bands. The upper floor is huge, with an outdoor section and gothic decorations. A fun place.

results.name: Hilton London Kensington Hotel
results.address: 179-199 Holland Park Avenue, London W11 4UL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I stayed for 3 nights in September 2014. The room was very nice, the front desk friendly and generally a good value for the money. Room larger than most other similarly priced London hotels. Bed was very comfortable. Free Wifi only in the lobby was a bit inconvenient. A good location near Notting Hill, Hammersmith and Shepherds Bush. Nearby is a Westfield Mall with many restaurants. Bus service right outside the door. Taxis seemed to be available most times. Shepherd's Bush tube a short walk away. The lobby bar was okay and open late but drinking in a hotel bar in this city of great pubs is just senseless.

I am on my first night in this hotel. It is not up to Hilton standard. I visit the UK often and decided to give this location a shot. As a Hilton Diamond member I am surprised at the high ratings which promted me to book, so I feel obligated to write a review. 

The rooms are small, extremely tight where two people cannot comfortably move around. The shower is reminiscent of an RV, plastic bottom and extremely small as well. 

Our view overlooks a roof and all of the others that are staying. The 27 inch tv is docked to the walls with the wires hanging out with around 20 channels. 

The bar/lounge area has poor service. Expect to get up multiple times to place an order, check on your order and pick up your food. Pretty pricing for the quality as well, $70 for a pizza and burger. They also don't have to go boxes, so the busser wrapped my plate in plastic wrap.

Overall, for the price and location there are better options.
My wife booked this wonderful Hotel for a surprise for me...and what a surprise ..it was fabulous..from start to finish..we will be back.

An intruder with a torch came into my room at 3.45am. I called the front desk after chasing him away. There was nothing done to trace this individual who could have posed a serious danger to a single person, especially a women. The management have made no effort to find out what happened. No witnesses have been interviewed, so the threat is still out there.
The standard double rooms are dirty, tiny, too hot.
The whole hotel reeks of a 1970s shopping mall - stay away

BAAAAD BAAAD BAAD!! Avoid this hotel, we stayed here couple times and both times the services was bad, staff is very rude and not helpful at all. We had an issue with the payment during our stay this time and they said that they have not recieved the total payment, but the credit card has taken all the amount after we had to talk to the bank and appearantly they have taken the amount twice and when we knew that they retained the money without telling us that they were wrong. So we can't blam them. Avoid the lady in the reception she can't talk english well and she is very rude. Mr. Andrew promised us to help us the day after and never showed up after. Not a hilton service at all.

results.name: Walkabout
results.address: Temple Station, Temple Place, London WC2R 2PH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We went there to watch a rugby match, scheduled on the walkabout website and matchpint. They stopped the game for another one in the middle, without any reason and refused to go back to the rugby channel. Was a shame.

Going there almost every Thursday when they have karaoke. Really entertaining and a good way to cheat on the weekend and start one day earlier. Food is really good and offers also a great kangaroo burger, which I recommend everyone to try once in their life and drinks until 10pm are half price because in happy hour. On Mondays they hold a Spanish/Brazilian party which appears to be very popular, also among my friends, but I have never tried. Even just for a pint of beer for £2.50 (in happy hour), this place deserves 4 stars.

A bar that has made some good changes recently. It has been refurbished and has a nice colourful decor to the bar area. They have brought back happy hour during the week which ends at 7pm (2.50 a pint). Standard beers/spirits on offer. Average pub food. Worth booking in advance and reserving a table/sofa in the VIP area as its a great place to watch sport. They also have a huge projector screen. Toilets could do without the toilet guy and being slightly cleaner. The bouncers on the door ID everyone that comes through (yes even if you look ancient) so bring your credentials. The location is ideal as its bang in the middle of the City and Central so if you aren't sure where you want the evening to end you have a lot of options available with The City and Central being walking distance away.
Friendly atmosphere & ambience. Live entertainment & interesting selection of food & drinks.

Usually crowded and it is hard to get a drink. The queue is big but if you are in the mood to dance Latin music and Brazilian funk it is a good option. The public are composed by foreign students and tourists in general, very funny and lively.

results.name: Market Place Bar
results.address: 11-13 Market Place, London W1W 8AH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
My rule of thumb is that if somewhere it named a "bar" then food isn't its speciality. My thumb was very right on this occasion. (Not sure if it was my thumb on my left or right hand though.. anyway...) 

We came for lunch as a large group and they did their best to seat us, which I thought was great. Drinks arrived quickly and there's a decent selection available from the bar. Sadly the food was a massive disappointment. Four of us went for the steak and chips at £15 and we all agreed that it was a really bad quality steak. Being British - and very hungry - we carried on eating rather than complaining. Otherwise half our party would be without food. 

I hear this is an amazing bar - so maybe it's better to come for the drinks only?

I went to the Market Place for a quick drink at 2pm on the 23/12/2013 to escape the rain. 

I ordered a mint tea. After waiting over 10 minutes the tea finally arrived but it tasted extremely rubbery and metallic. I called over the manager to raise concern over the tea I was given, my friend also sharing concern over what I had been given to drink, noting the tainted smell and taste as well. The manager stated that she could not smell anything wrong. Before I could say anything else she very abruptly said "what exactly do you want? Another mint tea or not?". She then explained that if she were to offer me a replacement that it would "all taste the same". I once again stated that the tea tasted really bad and I politely declined her offer for a replacement, asked for her name and then left.

I was really surprised by the reaction of a manager of a food and drink outlet to not be concerned at all by the quality and safety of the goods being offered to customers and she did not seem to even think to investigate further a product that had been highlighted as horrible and had just been ingested by a member of the general public on the premises. 

I will not be going back and have never faced such horrible produce and service in London before.
Incredible cocktails, colourful charismatic staff, and cool music

Food is good but pricey, there are better steak places in London. Noise level may be annoying so take it as a bar not a business venue. Atmosphere feels like a nightclub! Cosy and informal seating, or a spacious dining room. We arrived at midday and it was fully booked for lunch. However, we were kindly offered a table who's next reservation wasn't for another hour. Very good food, excellent service.

A restaurant/bar upstairs & a basement style bar/club downstairs. If you are looking for a casual night whether it be after work or on a saturday evening, marketplace will be somewhere you can rely on to never let you down. The club tends to play hip hop on weekends and you can guarantee everyone will be on their feet & having a good time!

results.name: Proud Camden
results.address: The Horse Hospital, The Stables Market, Chalk Farm Road, London NW1 8AH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing dance floor! I went on halloween weekend and had a crazy time! very friendly people and different combinations of music that bring diverse backgrounds to the dance floor for a rich sexy amazing night out. they also have cheap drinks!

I really disliked my experience at Proud. The place is vastly overrated...just like Camden in general. The drinks are too expensive, smelly and the atmosphere isn't that brilliant. You can go somewhere else and have a better night.

Such a mismatched and weird venue, the main room looked like a living room... I really didn't enjoy myself and was treated with so much disrespect and excessive force by the outlook security for walking too slow... I will never go there again.

I really don't have much positive to say about this overhyped Camden venue.

Prices vary randomly - both entrance prices and drinks prices. The drinks are staggeringly expensive, unless you've paid for the benefit of one of their private "rooms" where you can enjoy such jollities as your very own pole for dancing on. 

I have been when there has been live music, but at the start of the night it is so quiet that there is no vibe or atmosphere, and when it gets crowded later, it's clear the partygoers are not music lovers, and the bands get ignored.

Although the outside space can be nice in the warmer months, this is really the only benefit I can see with what could be an amazing, unique venue.

It's a shame this place isn't better because the venue is unique but the drinks are incredibly expensive even by London standards and the pricing is not consistent (different bartenders were charging different amounts and prices went up as the night went on). This made it difficult to relax and have a good time. I went on a Friday - the live music was good but it was very quiet at the start of the night.

results.name: Raffles
results.address: 287 King's Road, London SW3 5EW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
A-mazinggggg club! I love Raffles for many different reasons, some being, excellent customer service, great staff, good location, comforting atmosphere and GOOD I MEAN GREATT MUSIC lol.
Last friday had really proved to me that this club really does care about their customers and keeping them satisfied. My friend was drunk out her head, whilst dancing, one of the security guys saw my friend drop, he immediately ran up to her, helped her get up, help walk her to one the seats and got her a cold drink to cool down. That was a really nice gesture, I'm thankful for staff like this, staff that do there job right. THANK YOU AGAIN!
Ridiculously priced drinks, pretentious, cliquey. Everyone partying their hearts out yet somehow hardly anyone is drinking... clearly some extensive skiing going on.
Very expensive
Very expensive, but quite fun for a night out!
Extortionate prices, low quality drinks.

results.name: Barrio Central
results.address: 6 Poland Street, London W1F 8PS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Barrio Central is a Brazilian-style tiki bar in the heart of Soho. This particular branch is over 2 floors but relatively small which makes it difficult to get a table, especially after work. The downstairs area has the most tiki style decors and a DJ comes in later during the evening to get the party going. Drinks are quite inventive with a couple of impressive flaming cocktails being mixed. Prices are average yet a bit overpriced for a chain. Nibbles deliver though with nachos platter providing a satisfying snack to go with cocktails. Overall, Barrio will deliver and provide a fun and unpretentious night.

Lousy place. Bartender, the chick with big round glasses was rude and arrogant. We were there during a happy hour, but no one at the bar explained that they had a different menu for HH drinks. When I pointed this out AFTER they charged me £10 for a mediocre cocktail, she showed me the board on the side, but it was dark and I could not read what was written on it even when it was pointed out to me. She did not try to remedy the situation or at least apologise. The place looked cheap and cheesy, toilets were filthy with no sign of any toilet paper ever living there and smelly. Cocktails not that great and expensive. 

It's been a while since I had such a bad experience. Was there first time and never, never, never again! London has so many great bars to offer.
Great bar for friday night and weekends. They are variety of cocktails option yet interesting interior decoration delight you and your friends for a great drinking session.

That colourful bar in the middle of Soho is quite spectacular. It looks like you are entering on a Caribbean island. At the beginning of the evening the atmosphere is relaxed. Many people working in the centre goes there to have some Nachos, Burritos and some cocktails. Later on, it becomes to a club where Latin music is played and the people start to dance salsa. It is an original place and food & drinks are really good.
Love this bar! Enjoyed cocktails here many of times! Great events and staff. Very relaxed and friendly place to go especially after a long day at work.

results.name: Salsa!
results.address: 96 Charing Cross Road, London WC2H 0JG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I've been there with my colleagues for the first time and we've had a crazy night. We danced all the time and had so much fun. Very friendly staff and nice drinks. I recommend this place to everyone who loves Latin music.

This is the best Latin bar in London ... Everyday has different events, from Best Latin DJs to great Latin bands time to time ... 

If you have a night out with friends and want to dance make sure you choose this place .... I love this place .... It was the 1st Latin bar in London I went to over 10 years ago.... Still running !!!!! Amazing !

Urgh... Whatever you do, don't "eat" here!

Ahh.. So if you're so inclined to believe that the plethora of tables and the rather fetching colourful, some may say playful, menus that contain various Mexican inspired food stuffs; in addition to the vacant, somewhat expressionless waiting staff constitutes what some may call a restaurant. You couldn't be more wrong.

I had the pleasure of attempting to dine here Sunday 12 October 2014 circa 6.30pm. There were maybe 4 tables with people sitting on them, and about 50% of these tables had people waiting for food. Considering that there are appx. 30-40 tables, based on performance, this appears to be the restaurant operating at full capacity, full steam ahead, flat out, and other such inspiring phrases.

The reason why i assume this to be true is the 45 minute wait for a starter that did not arrive. having enquired several times as to the status of the order, I was eventually told after an hour that it was 2 minutes away. At this point, the hour long wait for Gambas (or prawns) was too much and i decided to cancel my order.

Unfortunately, my dining partner at this point had been told that his main had not been ordered. He unlike me, still believed that he was in some kind of restaurant and reordered his main, completely unaware that we were on some sort of Star Trek holodeck, that I now assume had been taken over by Klingons, and they were using the venue to masquerade as a restaurant/cum salsa bar for some as of yet unexplained sinister evil reason.

In the meantime they brought us some complimentary water, and a couple dirty glasses with remnant’s of a previous citrus drink. Unsurprisingly we decided to pass up the beverage.

Unfortunately, after another 20 mins, he was told that his food had been cancelled, and they brought a bill which had NOT been requested for a 'chimichanger', whatever that is?! and a shot of vodka. 

We were then asked to give the table back as it was urgently needed to serve more hungry customers. At this point we decided to leave, and it’s a fair bet that neither of us will ever frequent this fine establishment again.

Salsa bar is a must on the London nights if you are a lover about Latin music. This club/bar/restaurant offers many options to its public. Firstly, you have the option to have a nice dinner there. The menu is based on different types of appetizers such as Spanish Tapas, Mexican Fajitas and grilled dishes. The drink menu is wide and offers a huge variety of cocktails. After that, Salsa classes are provided by a professional teacher. This is the perfect opportunity to join to a group and give your firsts step into Salsa. It is such a fun that even if you are not good at it you will be laughing. Later on, the dance floor becomes to a normal club with different types of music. On this club people kindly comes to you to ask to dance with them. Therefore, there are plenty of chances to meet new people. Smiles and laughs are guaranteed.

If you like Latin music, this place is the right one for you.
They play different sets, that are actually quite popular. Everyday you can go and try their tasty cocktails during the so called happy hours. 
My rating is lower, because sometimes Salsa is too crowded. And I can't hear my friends when they are speaking. Still, the purpose of every evening or night out is to have fun. And in this bar you are going to have fun, for sure!

results.name: Shaka Zulu
results.address: Stables Market, Chalk Farm Road, Camden, London NW1 8AB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Very reluctant to go because of bad reviews. Went for a birthday dinner and had an awesome time. The decor is insane! Staff were wonderfully professional. Food was tasty. Cocktails were overboard :) Only gripe was prices ...but you can't get everything for 99p ;)

It's not so much of a restaurant but rather a film set with all the props down to the last detail. It is different, I'll give it that. The menu has some interesting options, maybe a tad pricey, especially the wines. Staff were helpful but even though we'd booked in advance, we still had to wait for the table. It's more pleasing to the eyes than to other senses that restaurants strive to appeal to.

I went to Shaka Zulu last Friday for a meal and drinks with 4 friends. I was initially impressed by the decor which has Vegas-like extravagance. From there on, it was down hill.

Restaurant:

The food was very overpriced and poorly executed. The meats were not seasoned well and were over-cooked and chewy. Either because none of us enjoyed it particularly or because we had over-ordered we didn't end up finishing alot of it. The first bottle of wine we ordered was pretty bad. We told the waitress when one of us tasted it that we didn't like it, but she didn't seem to know what to do and just looked at us blankly. 

Service was generally slow. It took 25 minutes for our drink orders to arrive and when it did arrive, they arrived sporadically, so some people had their drinks and others did not. They forgot to give us a dessert we had ordered, but only afterwards did we realise that they still charged us £12 for it. The meal cost the 5 of us £560 and was memorable only for being disappointing: average, but expensive food and bad service.

Club:

Afterwards, we stayed for the club. The atmosphere was lively and they had a live drum player that added some additional charm. However, the night was once again let down by poor staff. I won't bother with all the annoying incidences that accumulated during the night, but I will give two that really annoyed me.

One of the bartenders at the 'Champagne Bar' seemed to be only serving girls. After waiting 15-20 minutes and seeing him serve any girl group that came over, I asked him why he was serving other people when he knew I should be next. He said (bizarrely candidly) "You know, ladies first. They're pretty girls...Come on, you'd do the same." 

When I went downstairs with the drink I had just bought, I spent a minute trying to re-find my friends by the escalators. A bouncer angrily came over and demanded that I either get on to the dance floor or go back upstairs. I told him that I just wanted to find my friends before I go onto the dance floor or I'll spill the four drinks I was holding. He said that he didn't care. I moved to the outskirts of the dancefloor (literally next to everyone dancing) when he came back over and said "Do you want me to throw you out? I said get ONTO the dancefloor". I naturally spilled a lot of it on my hands and shoes.

Summary:

This is indicative of the type of service at Shaka Zulu. Bouncers are angry, rude and dismissive. Bar staff are slow and/or unprofessional. Their prices will make you think that they're a premium establishment, but if you believe that, you'll believe Camden Town is actually Cape Town. I honestly could have bought a single plane ticket to South Africa for what I spent in Shaka Zulu. Don't waste your money.

Me and my gf went there for a dinner having a voucher. We have been placed on a huge table together with other two couples.

The menu was just a subset of the proper one, so forget fancy food like crocodile. We had something really similar to a Sunday Roast, food that you can find on almost any pub in London. Sides were not included on the main plate and they did cost us £3.95 each.

No toilet paper on the restroom at 7.30pm.

Overall the context is nice with its unique african style.

Do not go there with a Voucher, will be disappointing. Sincerely I don't understand why offer vouchers for just get food that you can have paying much less on other places.

After buying a Groupon voucher for Shaka Zulu (for mine and my boyfriends anniversary) without first reading the reviews, I was a little nervous as the reviews were poor. 

We turned up, were greeted welcomingly, and seated promptly. The decoration in this place is amazing! The service was very good, staff were welcoming and food was presented beautifully. We had the crocodile cigars which were really good, followed by the steak - which was cooked perfectly and melted in the mouth, and the chocolate tart after. 

All was great and we struggled to find fault. There was live African music performed throughout the restaurant which was great. The only fault we could have made was that we didn't have much of a break inbetween courses. 

I'd definitely recommend, we had a great evening.

results.name: Windsor Fenchurch
results.address: 2 New London Street, London EC3R 7NA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Been twice. Both times on a Saturday for the London Elvis club night. Although the entertainment is first class, the venue, staff and beer are all very very poor.

I met up with 6 friends and we love the Elvis monthly club when we can make it.

Having only two bar tenders on a night that has been booked out in advance seems like the pub knows you will stay all night because you are booked in and they will cut staffing cost without any care for the customers.

The staff in question have little or no customer service qualities. Waiting to be served is quite an ordeal,stools around the bar take up so much room that you find yourself standing in the middle of the dance floor waiting to be served.

I wont be going to another Elvis Saturday at the venue for these reasons. I think the management needs to have a good look at themselves in the mirror as they seem to think they can run a function night on 2 staff.

The beer, . The ale is of poor quality. Not only did each ale run out in quick succession, it was obvious that it was not kept well and not enough was ordered.
Ale drinking in this venue was very poor. I expected to try a pint of each of the 4 or 5 ales on tap but only 2 pints were of drinkable quality which quickly ran out.The other taps consisted of some kind of cloudy dark matter that I gave back to the barman and asked for a different drink.
Coke and lemonade ran out. I tried to order vodka and coke and was told they had ran out of all mixers. The bar woman had no personality and looked like she did not want to be there one bit. 

I don't know how it is thru the week, but I will never waste another minute of my time at the hands of these amateurs at the weekend again.

Came here with friends for a poker night but honestly we had so much fun that we couldn't keep poker faces. The atmosphere was lively, staff were helpful, and even though the ale wasn't first class, it still got us in the mood. I won the house that night, so who cares if the beer was a bit off.
So far, my experience here was good. I met up with a few of my friends and business mates and we enjoyed the drinks and their food.
great if youre waiting for a train, or trying to get some work done...

results.name: Fire
results.address: 39 Parry Street, London SW8, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Queuing for no reason. Security felt me up way too much and too close for that to be normal, and were a bit shirty. The bar staff too while serving super pricey drinks - this is Vauxhall not Mayfair!

Fire's maze of little rooms seemed to get smaller and smaller as the night wore on. Or, was I imagining it?

The outdoor area with decking was nice, and one of the bouncers was really helpful and made sure I went home in the direction of the tube station. 

Although, it is worth noting that this is not the best area at night. I saw a lot of unsavoury characters and a street fight involving a guitar of all things. Which would almost have been a Monty-Python style comedy, if one of the people hadn't almost got run-over.
Rude security and expensive drinks. The music was a mixture of Everything. Would have been great for my 16th birthday...

TERRIBLE CLUB. The people who run this club are doing an awful job. I went to see Annie Mac recently and the club was ridiculously full- DON'T SELL TOO MANY TICKETS IT RUINS THE EVENT! It's just plain greedy to sell so many tickets that the club is too crowded, and doesn't make it fun for the people paying to get in. You try and dance but every 3 seconds someone pushes past you to get through the heaving mass of bodies. Also, after already paying to get into the club you have to pay £2 just to hang your coat up, then another £1 if you forgot something in your pocket. This is not how clubs should work, poor show Fire.

I came on Friday night with a group of 5 people. First of all we came after 12 to make sure there is no more queue and indeed there was NO QUEUE. We had to wait more than 10 minutes WITHOUT any reason. So:
 
- tickets were already bought
- there was no queue outside
- it was COLD as hell
- we are good dressed, cultured and educated people
- and totally SOBER!
 
But the reception of the bouncer was horrible! I really don't understand how they can put such an impolite, rude and unprofessional bouncer in front of their club. He shouted at us, demonstrated his power without any reason.
 
After spending the night there, we left after a few hours. This mentioned bouncer opened the tiny metal gate after yelling 'THIS WAY' and after going out he said: 'and you my dear won't come back!' Ok, whatever the reason is why he said that, god knows his mood on that night. This is definitely UNACCEPTABLE.
 
You should really wonder why fire is not as full as other clubs and why good people avoid going there. I'm not talking about the tourists, but also about locals. I’m not saying bouncers are that much nicer in other clubs, but at least they don’t offend you.

Many thanks for your attention.

Me and a friend went for an 'Ergh' night a week ago. When we arrived the queue was horrendous and we decided to go grab a drink somewhere and give it chance to go down. Post drinks we came back to find that the queue had halfed in size and stood queueing for probably 15-20mins before we got in.

 There was a little confusion on how we'd managed to get into the club without tickets (as we had been put on the Skiddle ticket list) and the woman promptly tried to get us to go back outside. After a little thumb twiddling we were indeed greeted by the 'man with the clipboard' who gave us our wristbands and we were on our way.

Little did we know that inside we were to be met by a queue for the coats that was treble that of the one outside. We spent the next 30 maybe 45 minutes waiting to hand our coats in half expecting to see a lone monkey scratching his a**e behind the counter. When we got to the front there was actually a team of three people somehow managing to put away about 1 coat every 5 minutes. ABSOLUTELY INSANE!

Layout was a little strange to say the least, in order to get to rooms 2 & 3 you had to fight your way to the front of the main room. This room was packed out, so for this reason and mainly better tunes were being played in room 2 that's were we spent the duration of our night.

Ergh boys put on some quality sounds, but the sound system has a lot to be desired. Audio was all top end and barely any bass at all, through out the club. Crowd was friendly, only saw one incident of aggression at the beginning of the night.

A lot of people mention the door staff being rather unfriendly which i didn't have a problem with but once your in there they will treat you like your Pablo Escobar. Staring, and loitering around you on the dance floor (maybe i've just got one of those faces).

Great night, great music, great crowd, alright club.

results.name: Henry's Cafe Bar
results.address: 80 Piccadilly, London W1J 8HX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This is one of the worst eateries in the Capital.Appalling quality, barely edible rubbish. Avoid if you savour your palate. The positive reviews here must be made by the owners or staff.
Only been here for breakfast but it was just lovely! Nice and quiet, warm and cosy. The food was great, very reasonably priced and the service was heartfelt and fast. Definitely will be coming back.
Free toast. Breakfast until 12. Service is excellent. 10/10 would eat here again.

We had a wonderful lunch today and our waiter (a lovely Irish chap) was really attentive and simply great, full of smiles. My friend was with a young baby and he was so understanding of our needs and requirements. The food was delicious, the pork belly was finger licking good and we really enjoyed ourselves. Thank you so much for providing a child friendly environment to dine in which is extremely rare in Mayfair. Henry's is not a posh eaterie but it's friendly, welcoming and relaxed place where the food quality is good and still reasonable.

I've been here for drinks in the evening and the place gets rammed as it's central and near to a lot of offices but I guess its a big bar and very central, perfect spot to then go into the West End and Soho. Drinks are reasonable although a bit difficult to get served at peak time on a Friday evening when the offices have emptied.

The atmosphere is very appealing in Henry's. Not too loud not too quiet. The food was very good, I had some pasta with prawns. It is very well located for drinking before going on to one of many exclusive clubs and bars in the area. There is also a small section of outdoor seating for the smokers and it can be nice to sit outside on a warm evening. The staff are very good. I will always go here.

results.name: Club 49 Soho
results.address: 49 Greek Street, London W1D 4EG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Situated within the trendy and bustling district of Soho, Club49 is a stylish and thriving venue making it the perfect nightlife hotspot with great music and crowd. Went here for first time ever on 20th August 2014, The atmosphere was great as was the music.
Any guys visiting London u gotta seriously visit this Club49 .....

Held my birthday party here last Saturday. We had the VIP area with about 40 of us all together. It was the perfect size for our group and we had our own bar. The music was great and everyone had a fantastic time! Will be back!

While in London a few years ago my group was approached by a guy trying to get us into Club 49. I was the only tourist, as everyone else I was with lived in London. My buddy was familiar with the place so we decided to head there for a few drinks before hitting the clubs. I have read a lot of reviews on this place after my visit and I was surprised. My experience was a good one! We had a few drinks, chilled out and then hit a few other bars. The next night, which was my last I thought we would head back again. While there I bought a bottle of Champaign and they offered to put us in the VIP room. Was a very nice gesture so we went ahead and did that. They also brought over a huge group of girls (I was with 3 other guys) so that worked out well also! All in all, I never had a problem in the 2 times I went. I am headed back to London next summer and plan on hitting Club 49 a few nights during my stay. I am rather looking forward to it to be honest. Have those bottles ready!

The club is okay nothing special about it. I only went there because a friend of mine had his b-day party but i will definitely not come back to this place. The people at the door are not only rude but they want to charge you more than they are they suppose to. Regarding drinks they only sell you dbls which it is against the law as they cannot force people to drink more than they want to.

Please avoid this place if you want to have an enjoyable night out. !

We did not have food but still I am rating it as good. 
Service has been ratted poor only because of manager and one of the bouncers behaviour. 
I was in with my friends before 4 1/2 hours. Suddenly African looking bouncer come over and asked who has bought drink from out side. No buddy knew what he was talking about. Then he started pushing my friends and said move down this is a VIP area. It is only for VIP's. One of my friend decided to talk to manager. I personally asked manager a question why we are not allowed to sit in VIP. There was no answer from manager. Instead of solving problem manager got things violent. 

Manager had smile on his face in this critical situation instead of being serious. What me and my friend wanted from manager was an explanation. This incident bought down the whole experience of the place. 

Manager needs to talk to guest instead of bouncers and focus on his job. Manager needs to take control of the situation, know what is the actual situation and know what is the question guest is asking.

Soho is a very competitive location for bars. Bar could have made lot of money out of us. But instead manager got us all kicked out and we had to spend all our money in other bar.

I will never ever go back to this place.

results.name: Sway Bar
results.address: 61-65 Great Queens St, London WC2B 5BZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I came here for my Christmas party with a group of 17. We had booked for a 3 course meal with a prosecco reception. Overall, it was a great night! The service was fantastic and our waiter was very attentive. Drinks were normal London prices, however there was a happy hour till 7pm so we bought lots of lovely, cheap drinks early. The food was very tasty and noone complained. Afterwards, we moved to the club area and danced for many hours which was great fun and the DJ was happy to accommodate requests.

Like to thank Alex and staff for giving our friend a fantastic Hen night, even though the booking request from the Hen do company seemed to have got lost Alex and crew were fantastic when we arrived at the club on Saturday 18 October, brilliant food and great music will recommend this nightclub to anyone going to London for a good night out.

They sorted out the booking problem well before our friend arrived so she didnt know what had happened and even throw in some bubblex

Do not go there. Customers taken for granted. Cold hamburgers. Weak alcoholic cocktail jug (£19); complained to the person who made it, who tasted it but said it was fine and if you want it stronger you have to pay for another shot. Staff swooping in like eagles to collect your glass whether finished or not, no questions asked. Rude security in your face shouting 'hold your bag at all times'. Too many hen parties took over the only halfway decent room.

Given the mixed reviews here I think it's only fair to give praise where praise is due. I booked an area for my wife's 30th party last Saturday. After lots of back and forth with the booking staff, a daytime visit and an evening visit I finally decided to book a couple of tables in the Milk room, which was the more upmarket room and a bit more chilled than the main dance floor.

On the night everything ran like clockwork. The drinks I pre-ordered were well priced, chilled, and delivered to the table when asked. The sharing platters were much better than expected (sliders, mini fish and chips etc). The girls liked the music and spent their time between the Milk room (house/dance) and the adjoining room (R&B) but were less keen on the disco room which was a bit cheesier and seemed to be full of birthdays and hen parties. All rooms were lively and the choice of music makes it a good venue for groups.

The staff in the Milk room were excellent and both Andy (assistant manager?) and Maz (Manager?) checked in on us regularly to make sure all was ok. The bar staff were great too and the bar was pretty efficiently run which is not always the case in a central London club!

one piece of advice...take your ID. Most of our group were asked on the door despite being between 28-35 years old. It's not really a problem, and should be expected in most Central London clubs, but better safe than sorry.

We went out to SWAY for my husband's birthday party. Had an excellent night! Thanks for that ;-) We have reserved place in advance. Staff was really polite and helpful. We felt very welcome. The service works well and quickly. Fantastic place to spend Saturday!

results.name: Kanaloa
results.address: 18 Wine Office Court, Hill House, Shoe Lane, London EC4A 3BQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Worst Stuck Up security ever didnt allow me, 12 girls and 3 boys in because two of the girls looked 'intoxicated', urm its a nighclub people arent going to be fu****g sober, refused entry despite payiing more than 400 for a booth for a 21st party as no one got in i better get a full refund or ill be going back there

I think Kanaloa should very much be reserved for a Thursday is the new Saturday kinda crowd. 

I went on a Saturday and it was disappointingly empty. I would probably try it out on Thursday just to see but considering it's random location and pricey menu I'd rather just stump up for the real thing and head to Mahiki. Guaranteed goodness!

One word describes this place beautifully: tits. 

Would highly recommend.

Some of the music was OK but the evening was somewhat spoiled by the useless and annoying security. The big b***k f**k wouldn't let me sit down and the rest of them were inviting their friends into our private area.

Doormen were rude and aggresive. They dis not let us in because our female friends were already inside and said me and my mate could not go. We then waited for our other female friends and they still would not let us in because we got refused the first time. I missed my good friends 30th because of this.

results.name: Firecracker
results.address: 44A Horseferry Road, London SW1P 2AF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Just one time I had Chinese food delivery. The food was not good and then was cold grassy, Then you think wear that come from...??

But today I try Firecraker for the fist time. 

Well my food get here on time it's was still hot. 

I have to say is the best food delivery.. I 'll order again from them.

Very happy.
Yea this place is great and restored my faith in delivery food today. Always on time, always delicious. Set meals are great value.
Nice decor and the food was well prepared. The karaoke was better than lucky voiceas was the ordering system
Our takeaway ordered arrived 20 mins early and was well prepared. Great selection of Thai and Chinese food.

Oh my god. I can't stop going here. Amazing food. The bento boxes at lunch time for under £10 are the best deal and you get to try a little of different things. The Katsu chicken is worth a try and the inside out chicken wings are a personal favourite.

results.name: Proud Cabaret
results.address: 1 Mark Lane, London EC3R 7AH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I recently arranged a staff Christmas do here and both myself and my colleagues had a great time. The food and drinks were a good standard on the evening albeit the drinks notably expensive. After some awesome club music (such as Prodigy) towards the end of the burlesque it was a slight anti-climax to have the DJ afterwards play some slower tempo tracks (like motown etc) when he really should have kept the pace high. All in all a good night and worth the experience. The burlesque girls were spot on, especially the host!

If you want a special different night out with friends then this is a great idea. We went on a Saturday and it was superb, we all got a little vintage and dressed up. The staff were lovely in their skimpy outfits, the entertainment was brilliant, we had a booth and it was so much fun. The meal was great for the price and the booze wasn't too badly priced. I would definitely choose this if you wanted something a little different then just a meal out. It takes you back to the good ol' 40s/50s of dinner and a show. Brilliant.

I went there with my boyfriend a couple of weeks ago and we had such a nice evening! Yes, the food wasn't deluxe cuisine but if I want to dine really fancy, I go to a fancy restaurant... The meat and the dessert were very good though! 
The whole ambiente, together with the show, is just fantastic! The waitresses look all amazing and they work really hard to give you a nice evening. We enjoyed the show, had a good table close to the stage and I really loved how the decoration was so retro -chic! If you want to have a fun, nice night out then this is definitely something I'd recommend!

Shocking! Do not book by credit card and then pay in cash, here's why:

After some passable cabaret performances and OK-ish food, our party of 9 was ripped off by a Proud Cabaret waitress and their management. This absolutely beggars belief.

We booked on credit card (required) and then settled the bill in cash. However, 3 days later the credit card was charged for the full amount of roughly £450.

Enquiries made by our party organizer fell on deaf ears, to the extent that management eventually refused to take her calls. They refused to accept any responsibility and further implied that our friend was lying. Disgusting!

Have a look at other reviews on this page and I think you'll struggle to find many positives about Proud Cabaret. Clearly just another London rip-off.

Poor management kills businesses. Vote with your feet and wallets and don't bother going.

Not one to write reviews in general but was so disappointed with the experience that this is the first ever review I have written. Could not believe they had the audacity to seat us at a wonky table in the walkway and stated that it was the best view in the house until of course the occupants in the booths in front of us arrived! The service was friendly but very slow when they bothered to attend. Would like to mention the show but missed most of it due to bad seating. The worst part was they had the audacity to charge a service charge for the entire bad experience. I will not be returning.

results.name: Plan B
results.address: 418 Brixton Road, London SW9 7AY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Paid £20 into Theo Parrish last Saturday. There was a massive crowd - it was hard to hear the music, not possible to dance, and even standing still almost felt like a wrestling match. It was probably unsafe too. I went to the toilet - there were two cubicles for hundreds of people. the bouncer peered over the top to watch me. Regardless of what goes on in cubicle toilet cubicles, I think that this is objectionable behaviour. I left quite soon, relieved of my money and my mood.

One of the greats of Brixton, alongside Mass, Electric Social (Fridge), George IV (Tesco) and Jamm (Long live JAMM!). Often packed at the weekends and great place for pre Brixton Academy drinks. There's bass thumping music to suit all tastes that is played through the Funktion One soundsystem. You haven't heard music until surrounded on the dancefloor by an array of these! Having been on and off stage. Usually frequented by young brixtonites, hipsters, old school heads and those who want to experience real london clubs and music away from the west end and party in a back-in-the-day east london vibe. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place.

Plan B is unassuming from the outside, but venture in and you find a decent sized club, with a dance floor, seating, a downstairs and a smokers garden. They attract some great DJs so keep an eye on their listings, and it is often the after party venue for gigs at the O2 Academy Brixton (which is around the corner). Close to Brixton Tube and the main road with a multitude of bus routes, it's easy to get home, but as it has a late night license, you can also party until dawn.

Great funktion one soundsystem in quite a small venue. very close to Brixton tube/ bus stops so easy to get to/ from. Entry price was fair enough, incredible music, but two drinks cost £15, and the bar staff still weren't happy. Cool visuals on the walls quite Boiler Room-esque vibe. Overall a good club but horrific drink prices let it down.
Denigrating entrance. Music is OK.

results.name: Hilton London Wembley
results.address: Lakeside Way, Wembley, Middlesex HA9 0BU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Stayed her for my London trip last year while watching Wimbledon. It's not exactly located nearby central London, but it's very close to a tube station (that's what they call subway there). The hotel is directly next to the glorious Wembley stadium, and if you're lucky enough to have access to the executive lounge, you'll be able to see the view from above. As a soccer.. I mean.. football fan, I absolutely loved it. The staffs were courteous and helpful, and the room is super nice. I would definitely consider staying there again for my next London trip.
Great hotel and great staff. I unfortunately FORGOT my iPHONE in my room (Left the hotel yesterday morning) Room 706. Called the house keeping and am waiting for a call back.
Based on a one night stay, very clean and fresh, large comfortable rooms. Overall a pleasant experience.
Love this hotel. Amazing prices for the great stadium view and the executive rooms are so comfy. Great view from the executive lounge in the evenings and a TGI Fridays right next door!
Very poor Hilton! Why do advertise babysitting services on your website when in fact you do not offer them. FALSE ADVERTISING!

results.name: Barrio East
results.address: 141-143 Shoreditch High Street, London E1 6JE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
!!.A WORD OF CAUTION TO ALL CHEFS, BARRIO EAST IS NOT A CHEF FRIENDLY PLACE.!!

YOU WILL BE RIDICULED AND REFUSED ENTRY FOR YOUR COMPLETELY CLEAN BLACK AND WHITE TROUSERS 

I AM ALSO A CHEF AND WAS TOLD MY CLOTHS ARE 'SHITTY' 

AND DON'T SEEK ADVICE FROM THE DOOR STAFF

CHEF - So what is the dress code?

RUDE WOMAN ON DOOR - [rude voice] 'I suggest you go on the website'

CHEF - I just want to know what the dress code is..?

RWOD - I've already told you to go on the website

The Barrio East website needs to include a dress code section and the door staff need to be better briefed on what this is and how to deal with those who don't meet the dress code. 

OR JUST BE COOL

Footnotes:

I'd rollerbladed from Greenwich, was completely sober, had ID and three paying friends inside. If you are hell bent on enforcing an anti-chef policy please do it in a respectful manner: 

RWOD - 'Look at you, you're sitting at a bus stop'

CHEF - 'What's your point?'

RWOD - "My point is I'm here and you're there.' 

I'm sorry, after I did tell RWOD that her shaved head and Mohican wouldn't pass her own made up dress code, this was uncalled for and irrelevant. 

Yours sincerely,

Chef

Overcrowded and attracts a very basic crowd - think top 40 "hits", suits with their top buttons undone and copious amounts of River Island clothing. Nothing wrong with that of course, but there are plenty of different, interesting bars and restaurants in the area so seems to shame to end up here. Also a special shout out to the incredibly rude door staff.
Not the worst place, but far from the best.

Although this has the potential to be a good place and the cocktails are tasty and good value, at least during happy hour. The lack of service and the fact that they refused entry to several of my birthday guests despite that fact that we had booked a table means I can not recommend the venue for anyone planning an event. There were several groups in the same situation as ourselves on the night I visited. Even though I spoke to the manager and explained the situation he said there was nothing they could do to let our guests in, so we had no choice but to leave and try and find another venue at 10pm on a Saturday. Poor poor service.

Good atmosphere, music and drinks and a nice place to hang out on a weekend, that is, if you´re the right kind of person with the correct skin color. 
The bouncer refused to let two guys in because "they were not on the list". Neither were we, but had no trouble getting in. I´ve been regretting I went in without reacting to that obvious discrimination ever since.

Attracts too many out-of-towners on a crazy busy Friday or Saturday night to truly be my favourite in this area, but the decor here is very lovely and the quirky cocktails make a fun photo. The Jammy Dodger comes with an actual biscuit on top; fun for big groups or taking tourists.

results.name: The Chapel Bar
results.address: 29 Penton Street, London N1 9PX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Had a joint birthday party last weekend. Great venue. Brilliant staff! Great communication. Had the pleasure of dealing with Blair Luke Danny and Alex! No mix ups at all. Everyone loved the venue. Bar staff were great too. Highly recommended. Will definitely use again!

I had my 50th birthday here.... it was perfect. The size was exactly right, the staff were so fantastic and I felt really looked after. Everybody had an amazing time and raved about the food. I would highly recommend this as a venue.

I had my birthday party here recently. It is a fantastic venue for up to 180 people - music system is great (supplied my own DJ's), management were really helpful and we had a fantastic night. Finger food was overpriced in my opinion. A great night thanks!

Great Venue! We had our wedding party at the Chapel bar. Brilliant home cooked food, huge bar variety and the best service possible, somehow they even made sure the weather was great on the day too! highly recommended for any occasion!

We had the reception for our Civil Partnership at the Chapel bar.
We had a fantastic BBQ on the sunny terrace. The staff were friendly and attentive from the planning of our event and throughout the day.
It was all we hoped for and more.
Highly recommend.

results.name: East Village Club
results.address: 89 Great Eastern Street, London EC2A 3HX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Very good place to hang out and hear good reggae music.

Last night (3/4/11) I went down to East Village to witness a rare dj set from one of my favourite artists, Erykah Badu. The first dodgy thing to happen was the cloakroom attendants attempt to place my coat on the same hanger as my friends but charge us for 2 (why charge for two if it's on one hanger: so she can pocket half the money). This didn't bother me until we realised that while trying to buy a drink at the bar she had given a fake £10 note to my mate. This was returned with no apology. This actually shadows in comparison to what happened next. 

Throughout the night I had spent most of my time standing at the back enjoying the music. As a working DJ myself I like to see what other pieces of tech DJ's use. So I meandered my way to the front to have a look. I found myself standing next to an all dancing and rapping bouncer who seemed more like a member of the crowd than security. The next thing I feel to my dismay is the securities fat fingers jabbing me (4-5 times in quick concession) in the back, these actually felt more like a punches with the amount of force he put into them. So I then turn around to hear him say, "Move outta the way, your blocking the girls view." I in turn say, "no. Where do you expect me to go. If move anywhere I won't be able to see and I'll just be blocking somebody elses view."(I feel he was just angry as I was standing between him and the girls) He then says,"ok we'll see." So he calls security who then come and tell me I have to leave. So I say, "for what?" He then drags me through the middle of the dance floor. I then try and stop him as I dont want to be dragged through the the crowd like I've done something wrong as this can only tarnish a reputation. Then another two security grab me. One grabs my legs and another gets me in a head lock, not the restraining type but the type that flattens your throat and stops air being breathed. I then find myself outside, where my wishes to speak with the manager to complain about the incident were met by dead ears.
Nothing like this has happened to me before I am a peaceful and loving human being who frequents the dance floor and decks on the scene around London and have never been treated with such disrespect. What a humiliating and Embarrassing night. East Village is DEFINITELY a club I will not be visiting again.
Went 2 see the stafford brothers and the incompetent staff had no idea where they were playing so i missed it! So gutted. Really really disappointed. Its an aussie band the doesnt come 2 uk often.

Hole! Tiny space with one of the poorest sound systems in London. It is only PR has got this place to where it is. Don't be fooled or sucked in. It has no business hosting club nights and is basically a wine bar with a train station sound system. 70's style security (put them in penguin suits and you'll think you were at the local under 21's club up north). Avoid, Avoid, Avoid you have been warned.

results.name: Boyds Brasserie Bar & Lounge
results.address: 8 Northumberland Avenue, London WC2N 5BY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Excellent! The exuberant surroundings, and the delicious food fitted in perfectly. Our waiter did a fantastic job recommending a silky margaux that complemented the Chateubriant we shared, beautifully. The maitre D kept a close eye on the restaurant and told us the amazing story behind such beautiful setting, adding value to our experience I have enjoyed it so much that I can't wait to go back and try the lobster. And it didn't end there, we stayed for a cocktail after dinner and Maria, our host, amused us with her great personality. Overall a 10/10. Will definitely return.
Shares facilities with a Club Quarters Hotel. Food and service are OK. Loads of places in this area serve the same segment but provide much better value.

I went for valentines day 2013. 
It was wonderful. The food was perfect and so was the service! Small place so I don't think you can go with out a reservation. 
Beautiful restaurant. 
My bill came to just under £100 for two. That is including a bottle of rose.
Had a fantastic meal, quite late in the evening and they had been busy to I can excuse the bit of mess and the chaotic service. Food was great and atmosphere better.
Amazing ambience! I love this place, it's looks it's food. They make the best beef in town!

results.name: Amber
results.address: Citypoint, 1 Ropemaker Street, London EC2Y 9AW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Insanely strict door policy, couldn't get in for a friend's booked birthday at 7pm because I didn't have ID on me, despite being suited and booted (I'm well over 25). Apparently if you don't have ID, even if you are the person who booked an event and are clearly the correct age, you will not get into this bar (direct quote from the bouncers). Don't bother with this place if you have to organise a big group to get in, because you know someone will forget something and there aren't any exceptions on the door.

Quite a large basement city bar and a total meatmarket, can be good fun if you're in the mood for that. Has three main rooms and also a bookable vip type area, one of the rooms has a light up dancefloor with girls of roller skates. Half price drinks happy hour untill 8pm makes it worth a visit.

Surprisingly big underground wine bar / nightclub for city boys. Main attraction are the scantily clad roller disco girls on the 80s dancefloor area I think. Otherwise fairly typical bar for moorgate.
Door policy gets enforced from 7:30, so be sure to wear appropriate attire, including the shade of your skin.

Recent refurb and change of name (from Digress to Amber) has resulted in a personality transplant for this bar.. It has gone from dirty downstairs venue to smartly finished (except the 80's disco floor). Unfortunately, this means they think they have become some sort of exclusive, highly sought after venue. Let's not forget it's still Digress and its still a depressing place to grab a drink after work. 

There are now bouncers roaming around the place looking for people to intimidate and offend for inexplicable and unnecessary reasons. Incidentally, don't dare to think you could possibly put your bag on the side by the booths, the bouncer will storm over and strong arm you into putting it in the cloakroom, because it is making the place untidy. However, the scantily clad 80's disco roller skating girls (I know what you're hoping and no they can't get away with it because they aren't attractive) that look absurd aren't having the same effect?! 

The absurdly loud music means that it's ideal if you want to have that awkward conversation with a colleague whereby you've no idea what they've just said and you nod and smile.. It feels like it's 2am when really it's just turned 6pm, in that it's far too loud, drunken, scummy and yet still pretentious - and quite frankly you're tired and bored of it.

This place is horrendous. Overpriced. Pretentious without substance. Dingy underground bar, probably only acceptable if you and your friends lack any taste. 

Enjoy!

results.name: The Clapham Grand
results.address: 21-25, London SW11 1TT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I love The Clapham Grand! Its a fun, dance like you just don't care night out. Drinks are reasonable, there is a huge flashing dancefloor and the music is a great mix of 80s, 90s and newer stuff. Whats not to like???

£10 entry on a Saturday night. Not a big deal for me but maybe for others so just putting it out there. Double spirit and mixer is about £8. 

A younger crowd generally, effectively, a student population. Drunk white guys spewing on the dance floor and stumbling around. Barefoot wasted girls, skanks, chavs, the list goes on. Music is okay I guess.

Bouncers are thugs that either take their jobs too seriously, or just want to start fights, for the most part. When I asked the 'bouncer' in the smokers' area who the head doorman was (to complain), he wouldn't tell me.

Bar staff were slow but friendly.

DO NOT GO HERE! Yes the music may be fun and cheesy and drinks cheap but the bouncers are thugs. They go round picking fights with innocent people. They kicked my boyfriend out of the club and physically hurt him for no reason other than because they wanted to and could. STAY AWAY!!

Went to the Clapham Grand last Saturday, even for London this place is a rip off. 10 pounds on the door (after a 20 min queue) and when we got inside we were informed the only beer available were 300ml bottles for which we were charged the princely sum of 4 quid. Needless to say this left a bad taste before we even sampled, further fouled by the endless queue to use toilets the size of a shoe box filled with shouty knuckledraggers and the slowest bar staff on planet earth. 
This place could be really good, the venue itself is unique and run the right way could really be something special. As it is, it is an experience to be avoided unless your idea of fun involves gentle extortion and masochism.

The Grand is younger student club for young professionals. It offers chart music and a very relaxed atmosphere. T shirt, Jeans and trainers is a common style, so don't be afraid to turn up casual. Open till 3, and it's still busy till the end. Must see if you are looking for a night where you can relax, drink and meet like minded people.

results.name: Boujis
results.address: 43 Thurloe Street, London SW7 2LQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Love how posh this club is. Always a great night here. We had our table bookings via London Night Guide for my friends birthday.They gave her a great birthday deal.

Good vibes and great music! Memorable nights are being made here, at least for me and my girlfriends! The club is very sexy and sophisticated and offers a sweet escape from the day’s casualties into one more posh world of luxury!

Good vibes and great music! Memorable nights are being made here, at least for me and my girlfriends! The club is very sexy and sophisticated and offers a sweet escape from the day’s casualties into one more posh world of luxury!

Massively overrated and overhyped. Expensive even for Central London standards, pretty uninspiring once you get in, and they take themselves so seriously it's hard not to be put off. Wouldn't go again, and would recommend any number of places before this. Even if you're the celebrity-chasing type, there are many better venues in London than Boujis.

This club is full with beautiful gals, who seemed quite happy and ready to mingle with the crowd, not act like they are too good to be dancing or meeting new people. I love the music too as it is a mix of hip hop and house!

results.name: Core Bar
results.address: Aldermary House, 10-15 Queen Street, London EC4N 1TX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Got invited by a friend who was really excited to get launch night tickets for the Core Bar. But unfortunately we were very disappointed when we arrived, it was not very busy and we just walked in – so no point in having the said tickets. Drinks are very expensive in here and not that great, but they have done outstanding work with the decor, upstairs is small, but once you make your way to the downstairs bit – its massive – with two separate bars located at the bottom will make for speedy service. If you want decent cocktails I would suggest going somewhere else, but for a quick drink after work this place will suffice.

This bar has revamped itself from when it was known as 'apt.' Quite a good hangout spot after work for drinks. Be prepared to book in advance if you want a table as most of them were reserved when we arrived around 5:30pm.
Love the vibe. Good music. Friendly staff

Definitely a busy city bar, very loud and hectic and not a place for talking. Not a negative, but you have to understand what you want - quiet place to talk to mates? This isn't it. 

Had a table booked so we got that quickly thanks to the helpful hosts. Good decor, dark like most bar/clubs and music was commercial chart stuff tilting towards R n B. 

Good place.
Great food and drinks at a reasonable price for the location. The dance floor was cranking and it invited a good range of friendly people

results.name: EGG
results.address: 200 York Way, London N7 9AX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
All in all, if you are into the electronic music scene this is a "must-go-to" club. All though prices are high, the crowd and music make up for it. (click more to read on)

Unless you hate the genres; House, Deep-House, Techno, Electro and Dance - please disregard the other reviews "hating" on the music and crowd

The music is the closest one can get to underground before you get to "word of mouth" gigs and such. All the music in its rooms are quite original, and many of the tracks - though taken from existing tracks have been uniquely changed, modified to each individual DJ - as they should be. And as for the crowd, well I have been going regularly for over 5 months and never once found myself upset or in and argument with the people there. In honesty they are all friendly and after a good time. 

Admittedly the door price is quite high, but you must take into consideration that all of the revenue generated by the entrance is divided between the DJs.
Unlike a normal club playing pop music and such, visiting a club like this is like going to a concert, none of the music is the same and in most situations the music we are dancing to is being mixed on the spot. Therefore it is understandable that the only way Egg makes its revenue is through its sale of beverages and food. (that's right - they have a mini cantine)

The security are of course going to search and pat you down. But which club wouldn't? This club is in the centre of London and welcomes some of the biggest underground DJs in the UK. It would be an error in their judgement to not search people should they be trying to bring in weapons or drugs.

I wouldn't say the staff are rude, but when you're standing at one of the bars alongside a host of 50 other people, I can imagine it gets quite stressful.

If there is anything wrong with the club I would say the lack of a good air-con, the very expensive price of drinks that are really do not hold much value. ie £5-6 for a can of red label. Red Label is terrible, i could by that else were for less than a quid. again £3-4 for a bottle of water - bit extortionate (thought they have a jug of water at every bar)

Short version: expensive and boring (click "More" for longer version)

I went there on a Saturday evening, it was far from being packed. My friends and I showed up at 11 PM but could not seem to get in until 11.30. The staff wasn't particularly welcoming, body search is systematic.

Entrance price is £25, drinks are very expensive (£10 for a double vodka and Red Bull, £5.50 for a can of Red Stripe, £4 for a simple bottle of water).

The music is very repetitive and gets boring. While the club stays open until the morning, we just left out of boredom.
travel down from middlesbrough a few times just for this night club easy best club in england

Tues 22nd July 2014
About a month ago I went to Fabric. I'm quite new to the house scene but have been told that Egg is quite up there in terms of house clubs, so was super excited to go. I was told there was a student guestlist, which offered cheaper tickets prices, and so emailed Kelly Nichols the Student Liaison Officer and asked her to put mine and my friend's name on the guestlist.
