She emailed me back saying we were on the guestlist and as long as we got there before 1am it'd cost us £8 to get in. We got to Egg at 12.45am and were told that tix were £20 each and there was no student guestlist. Upon showing the lady at the tills my emails from Kelly she said we could pay £15 to come in but there wasn't a student guestlist on Tuesdays and we wouldn't be able to get in for less as there was a top (more like unknown) DJ playing.
I wouldn't have minded paying extra if I hadn't been told otherwise and if the club was popping but the club looked dead, and there was hardly anyone in there.
Search wise- We were pat searched and made to go through a metal detector. I had a packet of chewing gum confiscated from me! 
All in all not a pleasant night for me. Next time I think I'll just go to Fabric tbh! 
FYI not everyone is on alcohol, as upon leaving the club me and my friend were approached by a guy selling balloons and crystals outside, so if alcohol is not your drug of choice, then I'm sure you'll find something that is!

Went there Saturday 19 July 2014 with 4 friends to check that place and when we were queing to enter one person was checking the ID's and after seeing the Romanian Driving Licence and Romanian ID to the 3 friends of mine in the front he told them "You have been refused entry, there is the way out" 

How come they have been refused entry after only checking their Romanian valid ID's? Because we are Romanians we haven't been let in?Our money are not good there? Without checking us or our bags or wallets?! This is discrimination and racism!! But all the british drug dealers I have seen before inside are allowed!

results.name: Euston Tap
results.address: 190 Euston Road, London NW1 2EF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A true London gem. It would be a crime (or at least a minor peccadillo) not to visit this establishment when in the King's Cross area (or, indeed, anywhere in London). They offer a great selection of beer. The premises are notoriously (and endearingly) pokey, so if you are visiting the Euston Tap with a large entourage (e.g. the cast and crew of 'Cats') be prepared for a bit of a squeeze (and be careful not to spill anyone's drink..it would be a shame as the beer is very good).

The best place in london to taste good beers from everywhere in the world, perhaps on a tie with the Draft House pubs, but they are more expensive.

Apart from that, this place has many flaws, it is small, often crowded, often not very clean, not very comfortable (although the room upstairs is OK) and there is no food of any kind (except perhaps crisps and that kind of snacks). The staff is nice and helpful, though, and the crowd is really not unpleasant people. Go there for beer.

Great little bar near Euston station with a huge selection of ciders, ales and beers. Staff are very knowledgable and can help you find the thing for you. Cool setting in an old Victorian building - plenty of space to sit inside and out, weather permitting.
Waiting for a train and it's sunny... Best place to go In Euston, inside is a little small but outside drinking selection isn't half bad

Cool location in an old guard tower. Impressive selection of beers and ciders (across the street). The space itself is kind of awkwardly shaped, with talk ceilings and not a lot of space to spread out.

results.name: Nordic Bar
results.address: 25 Newman Street, London W1T 1PN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This place is a little battered but youthful and the drinks are great. Alcoholic snow cones with muddled blueberries and the Scandipolitan were particular faves, the wheel of shots lowering the tone. Packed to the gills with scandinavians, it has a sports focus, showing most games featuring Denmark, Sweden etc so it can get quite loud. In between/after this though the music was a 90's- early 00's smorgasboard of delights.

If you like to eat in the Dark, as it is mostly in the Northland of Europe, then this is the place, make sure you finish before 9:30pm (the food) as the place gets busy. Food was OK, and there are plenty of Scandinavian / Finnish beers you can try. my favorite however is spin the wheel, where there are about 20 Nordic shots, almost all based on some sort of Vodka, its a great way to either start your night or end it :) just make sure you have a plastic bag handy or there's a clear exit to back. Some I did like very much. What's great about this place, is the fact that if you know someone from the Iced-lands of north, then on some days, the cocktails are almost 1/3 of the price. Now who can say no to that. So find a Nordic friend and head on down there. Oh!! one more thing.. the music is a bit on the loud side.
Great little Scandinavian place off Tottenham Court Road. They also have the prettiest Finnish bartender I have ever laid eyes upon.

If there is a place in Fitzrovia where better cocktails are served I want to know because I haven’t been at such a cocktail paradise like this before. It’s a little bit expensive but if you still wondering why then read again the first sentence.
Every time I’m here I start with some shots and then continue with the cocktails … that’s how one perfect night out at Nordic Bar looks like.

At least the prices feels really Nordic! Especially when they overcharged us five pounds for 2 ciders, and when this was pointed out they said that the cheaper "happy hour" price was only for one specific taste of Kopparbergs, and unfortunately they had run out of this specific taste.. It was on their happy hour menu, so one could expect them to inform about this before charging me £12 pounds.

Then the food, we had been promised a 20% discount, which they failed to give us. When I asked if I could get those four quid as a discount for a bottle of wine they rejected it and instead offered me a beer. I don't drink beer, and decided not to drink anything else either at Nordic bar.

The meatballs tasted like meatballs, the Kopparbergs ciders tasted like Kopparbergs cider.. ..so just get it somewhere, anywhere, but here.. The service is somewhere between ridiculous and non-existing.

And on top of this the waiter totally ignored my friend when he was trying to order his food, and it got to the point of us laughing at him when he leaned forward to try to order and she just totally snubbed him off.

We're only talking £9, so I'm hoping that in the end my negative review will have cost them around that sum..

results.name: The Lexington
results.address: 96-98 Pentonville Road, London N1 9JB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We ended up leaving after the owner walked into a chair at our table then started swearing at us for no apparent reason. After launching one barrage of abuse she then came back a second time and started throwing our bags and coats on the floor and swearing at us again. Unbelievably rude and aggressive, people who treat their customers like that don't deserve to have a successful business, I feel sorry for the poor staff who have to work with her and won't be going back.

The owner is the rudest publican I've ever met, she pretty much squared up to me as she launched a torrent of abuse when she nearly fell over a chair sat next to our table. It's her pub, she put the chair there. Aside from that the clash of music as the band upstairs competes with the jukebox isn't great. Best avoided, I definitely wouldn't go back
Cool bar with awesome deco downstairs and music venue with amazing sound quality upstairs. I really like the atmosphere there. You wont know any song they play but still will like them!

Huge one room bar with leather sofas and outdoor benches, nice to drop by for one of their enormous whisky and bourbon selection of a quiet afternoon or bustling and crowded for their many evening events. Upstairs usually has some sort of live music on and you can often get tickets on the door or just pop up to see if it takes your fancy. The cocktails made with slush puppy mixers are delicious.

3 stars for the pub, 4 stars for the upstairs music venue, which is spacious and well equipped. They have a decent line-up of bands coming up and the sound quality is excellent. Downstairs could do with some more chairs, some more bar staff and keeping to the promise on their website of not having to "shout to hear yourself think" - we had to go outside because the music was painfully loud. Decent food, decent prices - worth a visit on a quiet night.

results.name: Roadhouse
results.address: The Market At Covent Garden, 35 The Piazza, London WC2E 8BE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Went there last night for birthday drinks. The drinks are good, and have London prices, the music gets very loud as the evening goes on, making it impossible to have a conversation from about 22:00 onwards.
The deal breaker is though that several people who had Nachos in our group were troubled with digestive issues the very same night and next day. I can't tell what's causing it, and I won't go back again to find out.
Bouncers offered me drugs. Drink prices high. lead bouncer kicked my colleague out for spilling a drink. Avoid this place if possible.

We were shoved in the corner with a sloping ceiling which was really clostrapgobic. The tables were so close together that u couldnt move with out attacking someone on table behind you. Also therr was paper covering the tables so it felt like a kids party.
I asked for a long island ice tea which was appalling so decided to pic something else and that was even worse. The food was mediocre at its very best. Awful place will not be going back in anyway shape or form. AVOID THIS PLACE!

Racist staff but descent food. They clearly have a problem serving food and drinks to people of black ethnicity with white people. Their idea of a party table was paper table covers and rude staff not all but the staff serving us. My friend who was mixed race had to wait for her drinks and food after we did and we was overcharged by £65. When questioning this we were confronted by the female manager in a grey suit that told us we needed to move to the bar area 10 minutes after receiving our mains to make space for another party. The bar area was a small round table with no chairs. My mixed raced friend that I can only describe as victimized left because of this experience but this is 2014 this should not happen! By far the worst restaurant and experience in Covent Garden and never in my lifetime have I witnesses anything like it.

The people on the door at the Roadhouse are awful! When we went we had to deal with Egbert and Victoria and everything with them was a battle. Especially with Victoria - she was just flat out rude. Drinks in the bar are watered down. There are definitely better places to go without the hassle of rude door staff.

results.name: Madame Jojo's
results.address: 8-10 Brewer Street, London W1F 0SE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Could not recommend the Sunday night Kitten Club enough. Laughing all the way through, great dancers and overal some of the most entertaining burlesque I have seen in a while. Can't wait to go back. But get there early to get a good seat. Don't let the fact it is a school night put you off. As a final plas, the wine is pretty reasonable.

I went there with my girlfriend tonight and nothing was good. It may sound weird but: stage was poor, clothing were poor, lightswere poor. Basically, you go to Soho, take 3 random guys with cheap wigs, take them to a flat somewhere with a 5£ Ikea light, and you will have the same show.

Everything was poor , there was no food available inside (no crisps, no peanuts), the microphone was loud and kept making weird noises.

You should never waste yourmoney there (even if I booked it half price on Lastminute, I am still disappointed)

If you're looking for some great cheesy fun in Soho, this is *the* place to go. We came for a cabaret night with Drag Queens, and I couldn't have asked for more! From the costumes to the talent, getting the audience to interact and the fun and glamour of it all, Madame Jojo's is a great experience.
Amazing shows and sexy ladies! Love it!!
awsome place....sunday cabatey plus funky after party ... the dancers ate amazing

results.name: Mary Janes
results.address: 124-127 Minories, London EC3N 1NT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
We went on a Wednesday and it was dead! But ... the place itself was really nice, the drinks deals were great and after about 3 rounds of 2 cocktails each we went on to Wine as it was Winesday! 

Brilliant fun had by all! Definitely after work drinks place. I can imagine this place is slammed on a Friday. 

A short walk from Tower Hill station.

This is the perfect hang out on a Friday night, when you've finished work for the weekend and want to let loose but still be able to hear the person next to you. 

The interior is nicely done, elaborate with chandeliers and the odd velvet splash. The bar is always busy but luckily there's an upstairs and downstairs bar so you're never waiting too long for a drink. 

There's usually a DJ on a Friday night who generally plays chart music with the odd old school classic RnB song. There is of course a small dance floor which is usually packed full of people but there's always room for one more.

This is a good place to meet friends for a couple of drinks, its reasonably priced and a good start to a Friday night.
Fantastic! You should definitely visit! It’s fresh, it’s fun for the whole company! And the food is very good and the beer never ends.

a rare late night venue in Aldgate/Tower Hill, this bar seems set up to cater for city workers after a quick drink before home, yet attracts a much more diverse crowd than that.

Free entry regardless of the time makes it a handy stop on the way home or before heading out elsewhere. The cocktails are great and the bar staff are very friendly.

DJs spin a mix of the old and new; in short a great place to party!

Meat Market. The times i've popped in, its always been quick packed it's where east end boys and west end girls meet!. two floors the upper floor is more roomy with a bar area and booths and tables to sit down eat and drink, downstairs a dance area and just so packed you can hardly move or think. Still, I enjoyed the energy its' a frentic and busy place and actually a quite good crowd.

results.name: Maddox Club
results.address: 3-5 Mill Street, London W1S 2AU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Maddox is by far the most fun and glamorous night that Mayfair has to offer and the only venue in London that I'd be willing to queue to get into. ;-) Full of the most interesting people in London and has been since day one. If you can get in, you are in for a treat!!

One of the guys I had a crush on and who loves being in exclusive and fancy clubs, finally invites me here for a party, he was part of in the VIP!! I guess, partially because of that, I had the best party ever in London! The clientele was really stylish and of good quality and I am highly recommend it!

What I love about this club is the great mix of house/ dance and hip-hop they play, which adds up for the enjoyable atmosphere and post crowd! It is not coincidence that this is one of the most renowned members clubs in London. Yes, it is not easy to be admitted and you must look in your best or no entrance is being granted, but at the end, is not it all that exclusivity is all about?!

I have been to clubbing all around the UK, but worst experience was with Maddox Club London. As we reached early so asked by bouncer to came back 11PM and need to stand in the queue. I was on the guest list and waited for more than half and an hour in the queue as we were two male friends so in the end not allowed to enter. It's not because we were not allowed to enter, but the lady was extremely rude on the door. Just because we haven't got the bloody membership so they have no right to insult other people. My point is that why at the first place they put us on the guest list, and even the bouncer didn't inform us that male without women are not allowed to enter as we were clearly made aware of our situation.

I don’t know how to describe my experience in Maddox, as if you are not on the guest list, like I was not, the first time I went and go after 11 pm, you may need to wait on the line, which personally annoys me a lot! The club is very crowded on the Saturdays and dancing on the aisles, between the tables, is also another thing that may be not that pleasant if you are not with a big group of friends and just get smashed and do not care about the rest! I love the music though..so I am definitely going to visit it again, real soon and see what happens this time.

results.name: Stringfellow's Angels Soho
results.address: 201-203 Wardour Street, London W1F 8ZH, United Kingdom

results.name: Whisky Mist
results.address: 35 Hertford Street, Mayfair, London W1J 7SD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This is my placeeee!!! This is the best night out experience one may ever have in London and I am highly recommending it to anyone to try to have it at least once! It is totally worth if you want to be part of a posh and exclusive crowd, great beats and tunes of the popular music, you can dance to all night long!!

If you are looking for a celebrity infused place, exclusively posh and stylish, with some great décor and tunes! This London club is definitely what a fancy club is and the crowd quality proves it! Dress to impress applies in full effect!!
Such a good night out! Lindsay Lohan, P Diddy and Chris Eubank all in one night... Loved it!

This is my placeeee!!! This is the best night out experience one may ever have in London and I am highly recommending it to anyone to try to have it at least once! It is totally worth if you want to be part of a posh and exclusive crowd, great beats and tunes of the popular music, you can dance to all night long!!!

Overhyped and overpriced. Whiskey mist prides itself as one of the more exclusive clubs in London. It certainly has a price tag to match. For a Thursday night out it was £20 cover charge for guys to get in but girls go free before 11. Due to the number of people you bring it may be more economical to get a table at these clubs. For a table you get a number of "chalices". These consist of a large quantity of fruit juice with long straws and sparklers served in a very large vase. Designed for 10 people to share you can empty out a little someone more potent too. It is an expensive night out but if you're not doing it too often and have money to burn then it's worth it.

results.name: Strawberry Moons
results.address: 15 Heddon Street, London W1B 4BF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I had a great time here. I went on a Hen night and there were lots of other hen parties too, so it was definitely the place to be. Music was great - fun, some cheesy, all recognisable hits. Drinks were pricey but that's the area for you. I thought it was a great little club but the dance floor is too small. Good location for getting night buses or cabs home.
Nice bar for early evening drinks. Happy hour is very good value for money, and the seating outside is great in summer. I think the interior needs a little TLC to bring it up to date.
Always enjoy a night out here. Dance floor is a little bit 'cosy' as many reviewers have said.

Its just OK. Average venue, average small dance floor. Not really a proper sound system, more of a pub feel. But we had fun because on Saturday everywhere else was too busy with drunks. Music was anything-- like from retro to more recent but the DJ did not seem more than a mac playing a random playlist, no real consistency. Odd place, not in a nice way.
Nice music, commercial and fun. Maybe some won't like the high affluence of tourists, and the capacity is not too high, but still, it's a nice and fun place for a night out in central London.

results.name: Rhythm Factory
results.address: 16-18 Whitechapel Road, London E1 1EW, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Club was far too hot, no air conditioning and made it unbearable which was a pity as the music in the second room was playing some great tech house. Don't get me wrong, I love a sweaty club, but it's a joke if they can' sort any ventilation.
Food is hit and miss, and the atmosphere is gritty. Bar man is really nice and always has a chat. Drinks are really cheap.

ok, I aint a young man no more nor muffin neither, sodium and bass is all a bit much for me. But its open until 5am usually busy, rarely any trouble.

Hello Toni
Great club experience.
Absolutely vile place

results.name: Embargo 59
results.address: 533B King's Road, London SW10 0TZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A very rude male manager. Was shocked. Won't be going here with friends again. A very judgemental and prejudice venue. And I didn't feel welcome at all. Unfortunately, by the end of the night, I left for home feeling quite upset.

EMBARGO 59 MIGHT BE THE MOST RACIST PLACE I HAVE COME ACROSS IN THE UK..TWO OF THE GUYS ON THE DOOR EVEN SAID TO US "JUST WARNING YOU GUYS THAT THIS IS A RACIST ESTABLISHMENT"...I AM KIND OF SCARRED FOR LIFE FROM MY EXPERIENCE TRYING TO GET INTO THIS CLUB. BTW I AM A YOUNG WORKING PROFESSIONAL LIVING IN CHELSEA.. SO I WOULD EXPECT TO BE ABLE TO GET INTO A LOCAL CLUB ON A WEEKEND EVENING AFTER EVEN RECEIVING A RESERVATION CONFIRMATION. 

IF YOU ARE NOT WHITE... MAYBE MAKE SURE THAT MAJORITY OF YOUR GROUP IS WHITE..... I HAVENT TRIED THAT BUT I WOULD EXPECT THEY WOULD HAVE TO COME UP WITH A PRETTY GOOD REASON TO DENY YOU ENTRY.

IF YOU ARE WHITE... I WOULD SUGGEST YOU BOYCOTT THIS PLACE IF THIS ISSUE IS IMPORTANT TO YOU.

AS FOR ME I WOULD NOT BE GOING THERE AGAIN AND I HAVE BECOME A MEMBER AT ANOTHER CLUB AROUND THE CORNER TO PREVENT THE SORT OF EXPERIENCE I HAD AT EMBARGO59. WHAT I EXPERIENCED THERE IS COMPARABLE TO LIFE IN PARTS OF THE U.S BEFORE THE CIVIL RIGHTS MOVEMENT AND THIS IS 2013 WHEN THINGS ARE SUPOSSED TO HAVE CHANGED. WELL IT IS FAR FROM THE CASE WITH THE PEOPLE WHO RUN THIS CLUB.

THE CLUB IS OWNED BY ECLECTIC BARS. THEY OWN SOME VERY GOOD CLUBS AROUND THE COUNTRY. THEIR AUDIENCE FOR EMBARGO59 AS DESCRIBED ON THEIR WEBSITE IS BELOW 
Audience: Affluent, Sophisticated, Discerning

SO FROM THEIR POINT OF VIEW, IF YOU ARE NOT WHITE THEN YOU ARE NOT ANY OF THE ABOVE.

EMBARGO59 IS RACIST AND I DONT WANT TO GO INTO THAT MUCH DETAIL ON HERE BUT IT IS A LITTLE BIT UNFAIR IF YOU CANNOT GET INTO A CLUB BECAUSE OF THE COLOUR OF YOUR SKIN.

I DISCUSSED THIS WITH A FEW COLLEAGUES THE OTHER DAY AND THEY EXPLAINED THAT CLUBS LIKE THESE ARE BRANDS, AND TO KEEP ATTRACTING THE TYPE OF PEOPLE THEY TARGET (Affluent, Sophisticated, Discerning), THEY WOULD NEED TO MAKE THE VENUE SUITABLE, HENCE AS FEW NON-WHITES IF POSSIBLE OR NON AT ALL.

I HAD NO INTENTION OF WRITING A REVIEW BUT IT HAS BEEN BUGGING ME OVER THE LAST FEW WEEKS SINCE THIS HAPPENED. I KNOW THE CLUB MARKETING PEOPLE WOULD PROBABLY COME BACK WITH SOME SORT OF PATRONISING MESSAGE BUT THIS WILL LIVE WITH ME AND MY FRIENDS FOREVER. I CANT CHANGE YOUR BELIEFS, I WAS BORN THE WAY I AM AND THIS IS NOT MY BATTLE TO FIGHT. 

THANK YOU FOR READING THIS.

Went there on a Thursday night with a male friend. Of course I was the best looking guy there. There was not a lot of people there. The dance floor was mostly crowded with guys dressed in button down shirts. 

They have a nice terrace there. A lot of co-workers were out with their bosses on a Thursday night. Is that common in England?
ace

Well what can I say, i went to the opening of the new Embargo 59 last night and it is TOTALLY STUNNING!!! The refurb that has been done is gorgeous, the drinks delicious and the staff particularly good looking!! The new outside terrace is amazing too... cant wait to go back! xx

results.name: Jewel Covent Garden
results.address: 29-30 Maiden Lane, London WC2E 7JS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: This an amazing pub with great athmosphere, staff are super fun and helpful, they have great deals in the evening as happy hour as well having different rooms for different tastes. They are greatly generous when you book a table.

Awful experience from an establishment run by awful people. 

I had booked a table for 4 early on Friday morning for the same evening. Arrived on time to be told from the man on the door where to go (not being shown the table or anything). When I found the table myself, it was more like a small stool, with 3 small chairs around it. This was a table booked for food and drink! You could barely fit one plate on it. We then had to search ourselves for another chair. 

We weren't told how anything worked, how my £25 deposit was to be used, and it took approximately 20 minutes to order food when we were told what to do (after having to continuously fetch someone and we were just directed to our tiny table, nothing more). When ordering food the woman at the bar had to ask her supervisor to take the order because she did not know how to order the food. Above all, I had a 50% off card which was not accepted despite this being an establishment part of the deal and despite the woman who I booked with on the phone confirming the 50% card (Gourmet Society) and that there were no problems with that. 

The food THEN took approximately 30 minutes for some very small and overpriced burger platters, only after the wrong food was brought to our table 5 minutes before. Another chair had to be brought over the put the rest of our food on it also! 

All in all, extremely rude, unhelpful staff and management who had a) no idea what they were doing and b) no idea how to deliver good customer service. At the end I had to ask where my £25 deposit went, because there was no breakdown of food on the bill, just a final price, and no mention of it. Again, this was time consuming as the rest of the experience at the Jewel. 

I urge people not to go here, but to instead try one of the other bars or restaurants in Covent Garden. The atmosphere in the Jewel wasn't nice, the music was also too loud. 

AWFUL EXPERIENCE! AVOID THIS PLACE!

Nice looking cocktail bar with music that you can also dance a bit to. Mixed crowd , average music , but not bad at all , all time classics remixed mainly ,disco POP etc, but not much of the new rihana style hits . Well served and presented (cool deco), but not out of the league , but well , what do you expect , you are in covent garden Hehe

This place looks good but is let down by poor service, inexperienced staff, burnt (and overpriced) food - steer clear of the sharing platters, they're tiny! There was also a general hospital smell throughout the place. Shame. It looks promising but you'll have more fun and better food and drink over the road at the Porterhouse.
Insects/dead fly in drink. Bar maid seemed unapologetic and didn't care. Left and went to B@1 just round the corner...also in Covent garden. 2 for 1 cocktails. Photos included of dead fly. Enjoy!

results.name: Cirque le Soir
results.address: 15-21 Ganton Street, London W1F 9BN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
One of the most wanted & prestigious clubs in London and it has proven to me why!
Entertainment is absolutely unique!!! Absolutely recommended if you want to explore London nightlife!

Make sure you dress properly if you want to make a chance to enter.

My friend booked a table at Club Cirque le Soir on Friday 17th October. One member of the group arrived at 11pm, and was told the table was available but she had to return with the card holder who made the table booking. Once the card holder returned we were told that there were no tables available and we would be provided with a refund. We then asked if we could just pay the £20 fee on the door and go in as regular guests, but we were told it was at the clubs discretion who they let in. Throughout this whole period, other people were arriving and were allowed access into the club, and one group of European were even given a table. I thought to myself, they just told us there were no tables available. I then started to realise we were not allowed in because we were black. I could not believe the blatant racism that was taking place. Our group consisted of three black girls and one mixed race girl, who were well dressed and well spoken. We are all professional women and were dressed far smarter than some of the other non-black people they allowed in. To add insult to injury, as we all proceeded to leave, the mixed race girl was called back and told only she would be allowed entry. So the moral of the story is that this is a racist club that exists in the heart of London. This club are promoting the likes of P. Diddy, Jay-Z and Kanye West attending their events yet they do not like Black people. After reading a few other reviews I see my group of friends were not the only black people subjected to this treatment. Absolutely disgraceful!

Terrible staff, they wouldnt let my friend in because they arbitrarily decided he was "too drunk" after only a beer. They pump up attendence through line management, and you'd better bring girls to get in. Fun once you're in, but not worth the hassle.

2014 and i'm shocked!!! A friend from the US came over for vacation, we wanted to show her the best of London. We had been to the Cirque Le Soir Dubai and was totally blown away.... So imagine my horror when,my girlfriend and I and 6 other female friends were politely told, we wasn't allowed entry, because the owner was there that night, and he doesn't like black people!!! "My jaw literarily hit the floor" the fact I was being told this by a mixed race gentleman on the door, was a little bemusing..... was he listening to what he was saying? I was shocked but not surprised, i don't go out in central London any more. I had to restrain our non black friends, they were totally angered at what they were hearing. 3 mixed race girls 2 europeans and 1 arab? and i still couldn't get in.... I laughed it off, imagine if I took my friends Loooool... Ive never had to beg someone to take my money, so we spent our hard earned money at Zebranos opposite LOL, your loss. We had a great night out, Can't recommend Zebranos highly enough, great food great company. they have there priorities right, they're only interested in the colour of my money.

The ladies on the door are the most evil women to exist!! EVER! It wasn't the first time i had been queuing a good hour and a half to then be turfed because I look 'too young'!! So I called earlier in the day and asked how to confirm my entry, they said they no longer take guest lists! So I thought wonderful, shall be fine getting in! NO! get to the front she asks what guest list are you on, (luckily we had made friends with a promotor and she told us to quote her name and we'll be fine) The woman on the door was SOOOO RUDE full of ATTITUDE, a horrible tone! 'who's jasmine? I don't know no jasmine theres no guest list for jasmine! its a no tonight!' Fine, I still accepted that we weren't allowed in, but I wanted to ask the women at the door what do i have to do to avoid this happening AGAIN! The bouncer man would not let me talk to the woman and just ask such a simple question that could be easily answered with 'come on a week day' or what ever reason it is! BUT NO THESE RUDE WOMEN and BOUNCERS (Who actually pushed me, because I was trying to get the womans attention!!!) AND to top it off, I finally got a womans attention to ask her what do i have to do for next time to get in, she literally walked away from me mid sentence when she realised I wasn't asking her how much is it to buy a table!! Horrible Horrible Horrible women with NO MANNERS at all!! You can still talk to people with a bit of respect and courtesy! Specially when you know you are ruining a night they have been looking forward to for a whileeee!

results.name: McQUEEN
results.address: 55-60 Tabernacle Street, London EC2A 4AA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Very disappointing restaurant experience. The staff give the impression that they clearly have better things to do than show us to our table, take our orders and make sure we are ok with drinks and so on. The actual food was OK – far from amazing, but I have definitely had worse elsewhere. Who knows... maybe this is the way Steve McQueen liked to dine.

Each table is made up of couches and normal chairs. The couches are quite low making it slightly uncomfortable to eat. If you must go to McQueen prop yourself up with a few pillows and you should be ok

On another note: the front bar has a great vibe!
Top place: great atmosphere, nice food and layout, reasonable priced, good space to dance and let loose. Definitely recommended.

When you’re in the mood to go out, get dressed up and see where the night takes you, McQueen in Shoreditch is a good bet. It’s an all-in-one east London spot with an eclectic crowd that pretends nothing and welcomes everyone... To read more, why not click through to the Twenty Something London website.

Very sophisticated place.
Great cocktails, great vibe, good club downstairs if you feel like a boogie.
A platter to share was a bit small and quite pricey though.

Please be warned that the McQueens webpage is a totally misrepresentation of what is presented when you arrive! None of the décor you see on their page exists.

Absolute disappointment – even the bouncers found it hard to control the terrible drunken/ loutish behaviour of the most uncouth people I had the displeasure to meet. For a venue to command such extortionate rates I expected a better standard of service. E.g. £500.00for a table with a minimum spend of £500.00 on drinks – for that you would expect your table to be cordoned off??? You certainly do not expect to find several obnoxious and quite volatile men slumped across your appointed and pre-paid area with spilled drinks everywhere!!! 

They even tried to charge us an additional £10.00 entry fee when this was never stipulated upon securing be booking. 

McQueens club area is a total rip off and I urge you to steer clear… nothing but trouble and unnecessary drama.

results.name: Stringfellows Covent Garden
results.address: 19 Upper St Martin's Lane, London WC2H 9EF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Great steaks, beautiful dancers, It was like an adult Disneyworld.
A sophisticated evening out.
I always hit Stringfellows when I’m in London. Just love the decadence of the place. The girls are stunning.

Drinks pricey. The door staff can be unnecessarily intimidating but i suppose they have to make a certain impression. The girls are nice, some are a bit too pushy to dance for you, but occasionally there are very nice girls who will just have a chat with you whilst they're taking a break. It's ok as somewhere central to go, but probably best to try others too.
Worst experience ever. I was wearing a polo and was told I didn't meet dress code because it was formal attire only. do not recommend thoa club to anyone
It feels like its costing you money to breath in there!!

results.name: The Bedford
results.address: 77 Bedford Hill, London SW12 9HD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great venue for music and a good drink. We filmed their recently, and were thoroughly helped by the kind staff and fully enjoyed the facilities after work. Great chips and a good selection of taps. For music and comedy they herald a globe-esque theatre with balcony and round auditorium.

Get yourself to the Banana Cabaret comedy nights they hold here on Friday and Saturday - really great, good value comedy. If you're lucky you get some familiar faces too which is always a bonus. More of a place for the events (hence the rating) as otherwise this is a pretty big standard pub and, although popular, there's not too much to shout about. The drinks are OK but food isn't the best and there are nicer placers in the area for that.

This place is enormous. I went last night for a ceilidh in the upstairs hall, but there was also a comedy club on, and a theatre , as well as the pub. Doors kept opening off rooms into more small rooms with little bars in, some open and some not.

Nice atmosphere, reasonably priced drinks and friendly staff. There is always something happening here, whether it's live music, comedy or burlesque! They also have a good food menu and do a great roast!

An epic pub - more cultural centre of Balham.
Comedy nights, folk festivals, beer festivals. Amazing food and drinks.
If you live in South London and haven't been to the Bedford yet, hold your head in shame.

results.name: House of Wolf
results.address: 181 Upper Street, London N1 1RQ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Randomly went in on a Friday evening, because I saw the Happy Hour sign out side. The cocktails we're delicious and the venue itself surprised me pleasantly! Ended up having a random night out as the DJ started later on and me and my friends had a dance! Would definitely go again
Delious cocktails and the guy behind the bar took the time to recommend ones based on our own drinking tastes

Uh Oh. Hands down, one of the worst nights out I've had in London. Ever. Aside from the lovely, trendy ambiance, there is literally nothing good about House of Wolf. Conceptually it's a cool idea - a converted mansion, with each floor having it's own unique decor, flare and theme. However it's practically impossible to get a table, even with a reservation. The service is abysmal - our barman was really drunk and made cocktails (£12 cocktails at that) that were literally unpalatable. It took nearly an hour to have our drinks delivered and then another hour to pay for them. By midnight they were trying to clear out the place. A horrific evening. Just don't go.

Guessing I missed the boat on this place being cool. Guys outside offering "free shots" vouchers is always the first sign. Drinks are overpriced, isn't really much atmosphere, pretty lame music, bar tenders more interested in grabbing the cash from your hand rather than making your drinks. Don't waste your time.
This place is horrific. The door staff are so rude for no reason, it smells of toilets and the music is awful. Save yourself.

results.name: The Enterprise
results.address: 2 Haverstock Hill, Camden, London NW3 2BL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Played a gig here recently, everything ok apart from the short little boss downstairs. The little balding man attempted to evict us off the public walkway outside as we were eating pizza, therefore we had to eat it in the road. 

He also threatened us by saying we would not be allowed to play if we don't bend over and do what he demands. With many explicit comments aimed at us in the process. 

We took the effort to play this venue, fans came down. Quite frankly if he stopped us from playing less money would be put behind his bar.

To further this, a charity worker collecting money for a childrens charity was rudely evicted off the premises by the boss. The boss handled this event extremely badly, successfully making a massive scene about it, and made himself a fool at the same time! 

The boss needs to re-evaluate his professional and personal conduct, communication skills and clean up his language as well! I would not recommend this place to anyone at all.

Thumping and rocking pub. Not a place for a quiet night out. Great music and great place to watch Arsenal. Food looks okay but this place is really for pints. In the winter a roaring fire in the back corner is prime.
They have Duff Beer and a 70 year old asian lady that spins hip hop until 3 am inside a metal cage - what else do you really need?

Far from tackling their jobs at warp speed, the staff at The Enterprise will seemingly avoid serving you if they can possibly help it. I thought it was just me and my un-hip anorak that was getting the cold shoulder, but several people to whom I mentioned the establishment volunteered the same opinion. Shame, because the pub plays decent music and has an unpretentious atmosphere aside from that. 

Obviously it's overpriced and the urinals drip all night until visiting the lavatory requires aquaplaning, but this is Camden Town we're talking about.

Disappointing - I used to love the Enterprise but, dropping in for a quick drink recently, the music was way too loud, given that it was 6pm and only ten people were in, the staff were dismissive and the drinks weren't very good. No interesting beer, no cocktails, no decent spirits, and not much atmosphere.

results.name: Ain't Nothin But Blues Bar
results.address: 20 Kingly Street, London W1B 5PZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I’ve read a lot of accolades from so many happy Yelpers who love this place. So I decided to check whether all this fame is well deserved. It’s definitely not the best Soho bar but it’s in the top 5, I think. I was mainly attracted by the live music. The atmosphere was not bad, too.
A Soho institution. No room to breathe, cramped, difficult to order when it gets busy, all surfaces are sticky but boy does it have character. It's London. Charming place.

Rude bouncer at the door tonight 14th of sept who claims the bar closes at 11pm and wouldn't let people in. I was looking forward to the live music and was denied entry for no reason. He simply said the bar is closing when I can still hear music from outside. Just checked the website and closing time is at 1am. Very disappointed.

Very crowded and overpriced venue that has excellent live music. A wonderful place to catch up with acquaintances you don't want to speak to, but are obligated to socially hang out with. I discovered this place because one of my best friends from the US of A wanted a taste of what blues in London sounded like. I would recommend staying away during the weekends though - the entry criteria in itself is a rip-off.
Love, love, love. Down to earth. Great music.

results.name: The DollHouse
results.address: 7-8 Bishopsgate Churchyard, London EC2M 3TJ, United Kingdom

results.name: Purl
results.address: 50-54 Blandford Street, London W1U 7HX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing speak-easy style cocktail bar. Have to bear in mind that you'll not necessarily get your standard cocktails as the guys here do their own version and own concoction's, but these are amazing and well worth a try. The liquid Dinner is a must try! Definitely a place to try if you like bespoke cocktails !!!

Purl is a busy and stylish subterranean cocktail bar with a nice atmosphere in quiet and beautiful Marylebone. Its knowledgeable bartenders offer great drinks recommendations and make sure you will get to know new drinks that match your taste.

When I was looking for a suitable bar for a first date, I thought this would be the perfect opportunity to finally check out Purl in Marylebone. I was lucky, I walked in in the early evening to book two places for later - and surprisingly they still had two spots by the bar. But you should really book a few days in advance, as it seems to be busy most of the time. And I guess, since Chiltern Firehouse became quite popular recently, Purl might be even busier than it already was before.

As it goes, I spent a good half an hour waiting, which was fine, because sitting at the bar, you can chat to the bartenders and also just watch them do their thing - always fascinating. 

After starting off with a white wine, I soon moved over to cocktails. I looked through the menu, and then asked the bartender for recommendendations - after specifying a few basics (gin!), he came up with some suggestions. 

The first cocktail was not too complicated, but very fresh and delicious. The second or third then was a more advanced drink. It came in two parts that I had to mix together myself. A brilliant idea, but my tipsy, clumsy self managed to break the glass in the mixing process, so that one did not go down too well. However, the embarrassment was manageable and overall, we really had a nice evening with excellent cocktails at Purl. 

If you enjoy tasty cocktails in a relaxed, dimly lit environment mixed by experts, Purl is definitely a place for you.

Pretty poor. Visited last night for my girlfriend's birthday, she ordered a cocktail with sparkling wine in which was flat as a pancake. When questioned they said it was home made so not very fizzy, and were generally a bit..... Ordered something else which was £11 and the size of the cocktail was tiny, which was a theme with all drinks we had. No issues spending that much on a cocktail if it has a good portion of booze in, and when compared to somewhere like Nightjar the value for money here is definitely lacking. Also ordered sausage rolls which were ice cold in the middle. Generally not a positive experience from a drink, food or customer experience point of view.
Great cocktails. My friends and I had so much fun and enjoyed the amazing drinks. Pleasant atmosphere and good service. We plan to visit it again.

I think we can summarise the experience with one word: AMAZING.

You have to book the place in advance and at the entrance they immediately allocate you to their beautiful seats. The furniture/interior design is outstanding, which contributes to make the atmosphere great. Cocktails are great as well, all presented and served in a perfect way. Besides, we went on Wednesday and there was live Jazz music that was the icing on the cake.
Seriously, if you are looking for a great cocktail experience in London, you can't miss this place!

results.name: XOYO
results.address: 32-37 Cowper Street, London EC2A 4AP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Really good for small gigs. The decor is awesome. Room is cozy, so you get very involved to the show. Drinks are overpriced.
Two story venue will a brilliant atmosphere. Will not find anything better in London. Highly recommend it for both a night out with friends, or an intimate gig

Saw Jacob Banks here in Jan '14 and what a fantastic little venue. Really small so able to get up close with the acts yet still sounds really good too. Didn't stay after the gig but the atmosphere was great and I imagine would be a fantastic club night also. Only wish I'd discovered it when I was a little younger!

Bit hard to find but worth it. 

Having randomly won a competition to see Mt. Wolf here, it was a bit hard to find, only because it isn't somewhere I expected a gig venue to be.

When you get in, there's a long bar upstairs and a cloakroom to use, once the gig starts, it will be downstairs with another big bar to get served at.

The good thing about the venue is how it is a long venue, so quite easy to see the stage and see the band you've come to see, there is also a seating (maybe) and raised standing (definitely) area at the back so can still see further back.

I don't remember it being too expensive and the fact it is a 5 minute walk to Old Street was ideal.
Cracking vibes. The 2 Bears on point as ever.. mixed with Jarvis Cocker dropping blinders in room 2, banging atmosphere to boot - until next time XOYO!

results.name: The Star of Kings
results.address: 126 York Way, London N1 0AX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Went for a couple of drinks before dinner (somewhere else). So I can't comment on the food but I can comment on the drinks and the staff. The former were badly kept and incredibly expensive (scrumpy that tasted like cheap apple juice at £4.20 a pint) and the latter were aloof to the point of incredible rudeness. An unpleasant experience all round. Avoid.

Their Sunday roast's delicious. Picked up a friend near the new Central Saint Martin's building in Kings Cross, we went and had a few pints there and ordered the roast. We played their awesome "Addams Family" pinball machine just beside a real size fake Rhino's head. Great ales.

Odd place. Full of students and lots of Americans for some reason. A lot going on though with a club, a gig AND a comedy night all happening at the same time when we were there. If you're undecided about a Friday night out, this place may just about cover everything
Nice place for a pub lunch or after work beer.
Nice chilled out place to have a drink

results.name: Project London
results.address: 78 Wells Street, London W1T 3QL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Awful
I would not recommend this place to anyone. 
Bad music
Overpriced
Bad service
Horrendous Place.
if you love night-life it's one of the best club to go i enjoyed a lot of there
Awesome place!

results.name: Royal Dragon Karaoke Restaurant
results.address: 30 Gerrard Street, London W1D 6JS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We went there during the Olympics and the food there was overpriced and the service was crap.
My favourite Chinese restaurant there ever was. The sweet and sour chicken is unbelievably good, and the staff are always really nice. Top class.

The food was not bad, but the service was terrible. The brought one dish right way, and the rest had to wait over an hour for the food even after asking several times about the delay. Not coming here again.
The best chinese I have ever eat!very friendly staff. I will certainly visit again!
My go to restaurant whenever I am craving Chinese food. I have been there several times and the food has always been fantastic (their crispy fragrant duck is delicious).

results.name: Forge
results.address: 24 Cornhill, London EC3V 3ND, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Naively booked this venue for an works evening Christmas meal and regretted every minute of it. The service was truly shocking. Despite booking over two weeks in advance no drinks area was reserved and then waited a further hour and a half for our table to become free. Food was not much better - tasted like it had stood around for a while (like our party!). The staff while pleasant enough were inexperienced and seemed to lack any organisational ability. Just to top the evening off there was no cask ale available. 

Within yards of the Forge's location there are much better venues that offer much better service, have better food (and can serve a decent pint) and would recommend giving this venue a miss.

Held a Christmas party here yesterday and we really enjoyed ourselves. The venue is pretty and the staff are friendly and helpful. One of our party had had too much to drink but Forge dealt with the situation very delicately and I very much appreciated that. I must say after reading these comments we were a multicultural group and were treated the same as any other person in the building

FORGE.......Worst bar in central London. Do not enter as the pricing is totally over priced as I ordered a dark & stormy. But due to the lack of choices on the menu the staffs decided to charge us £10 for the rum (gosling) and £3.25 for the ginger beer. What a lot of crap the manager explained the reason for the pricing is that the drink I order was not on the menu therefore they are charging whatever they want. Complete utter ripoff and should be renamed as Conned instead! Good luck to your extra dosh that you have conned from your customers but I will not be recommending my friends or returning to this over priced boring crap joint.

Do not go. Simple as. I've been to and been let into a lot of pretentious bars before but this is rubbish. What's the point of a guest list? Also it would be great if you could define smart casual. Wearing shoes. Smart jeans (dark) polo shirt, also smart and blazer is considered smart casual. Be clear on your website and to your (potential) customers before they get there.

This bar has changed dramatically and looks great! It doesn't feel like you are in the City! The menu has plenty of choice and is good value. I would recommend the pineapple Crème Brulee for desert! I went on a Tuesday and by 9pm they had changed the music to what you would expect in a city bar not a restaurant. Luckily we had finished our meal by then!

results.name: The Shadow Lounge
results.address: 5 Brewer Street, London W1F 0RF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This supposedly plush GAY members club that boasts to be one of the best in London has the worst management and door policy. 

It shut down for remodeling without any information or notice to its members and then re-opened (May 28, 2014) after almost 2 months only to turn down entry to existing members. As a member one has to pay over £300 per year for entry but one can be denied entrance by the doormen anytime. Last night (Friday, May 30, 2014) the club refused entry to members claiming it to be a celebrity only night.

Their website provides no details about the entry policy. The phone is only an answering machine where one can leave a message. The best the members can do is - go to the club and try their luck to be allowed entry. 

I wonder what the club is charging for? Is it to entertain women and celebrities at the expense of its paying gay member? 

The least the management can do is to send out emails to its member telling them when they are not allowed entry, for what reason, and how they are going to be compensated for it. 

The membership is valid for 1 year. There is no information about any compensation for the time it was shut. 

I hope the owners of the club wake up soon.... otherwise they will lose the remaining members too.
A good night out albeit a little pricey.
Beats galore

results.name: Retro Bar
results.address: 2 George Court, London WC2N 6HH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
For me, this is the friendliest gay bar in London. I find the main hub in Soho can be a bit of a challenging experience, especially for someone as femme as myself. Here, I have always felt welcome and comfortable!

Tucked away down a side street off the strand, it is often nicely quiet, especially for an afternoon drink. The draft beers are cheap for central London, and there is even a (small) wine selection if you fancy something fancier.

My only issue is the toilets up the steep steps, but that's only because they become a slight challenge once you've had one or two. The upstairs bar is usually closed during the day, then open for private hire or themed events in the evenings. The downstairs bar is quite small, but cosy, and a great array of posters and memorabilia on the walls. I approve of the music choices too!

Friendly, easy on the wallet, good company. What's not to love!

Tip: There are two bartenders, one upstairs and one downstairs, so definitely pop between them in case there's a wait.

Lovely little gay joint, and the outside alleyway is usually sheltered enough from wind to be a good hangout.

Drink prices are about average.

The staff are friendly enough and drinks are rather well priced (for Central London anyway!) Probably not much of interest to young clubbers, but nice for chatting and listening to cool music. The Saturday night DJs are pretty cool
A great bar hidden away in the heart of London. Great place to meet up with friends and catch up over a drink, nice chilled atmosphere and they play awesome music!
Unpretentious, down-to-earth bar. Friendly atmosphere and nicer clientèle than other gay bars around London. Being hidden away it tends to feel a little too quiet, but good for one or two after work.

results.name: Gate
results.address: 87 Notting Hill Gate, London W11 3JZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I absolutely love The Gate! I have always received value and top quality service for my money here. I really like the idea of serving burgers and quality "fast food" with unique cocktails. They just complete each other so much. Try the watermelon mojito with the smokey burger! Don't miss the crispy French Fries and the homemade coleslaw.

Visited the Gate with a group of girlfriends on Friday and had an absolute ball! Night started with great 2 for 1 cocktails (And we could choose any 2 that we liked despite what another review I read on here claimed) and continued with some amazing platters of nibbles that went down a treat. The venue itself is like a little old school basement bar and restaurant (charming, friendly and unassuming) but what made the night was that the whole thing turns into a proper dancing club till the early hours of the morning. All and all a great and fun night out and will be back soon.

I had dinner at the Gate last night, we were served quickly and food was yummy!
I would highly recommend smokey burger with applewood cheddar, macaroni&cheese and coleslaw, simply delicious!
The bar has dozens of cocktails to choose from and Watermelon Mojito is amazing!

Service wasn't very sharp; wasn't acknowledge upon entering, setting a table for two took longer than needed, menus weren't in good condition. However acceptable.

The online menu doesn't match the inhouse menu . I ordered Chilli & Garlic Chicken breast with pickled cucumber which was nice, but very greasy. The after effects were very unpleasant. Horid smelling burps and awful stomach pains later. Enough to earn any date a kick in the shins.

The Mojitos were very nice, could do with a bigger glass. :D

Didn't really stay busy, that is until the DJ started his set. Which wasn't very good in my opinion. There'd be a song that really got you going, but it would often follow up with a soft track that would just bring the dance to a halt.

I did like that it was small and not too packed out that you'd struggled to get a drink or get to the toilet. A nice place to chill and have a laugh. If you're looking for a place with exceptional service and good music, you might want to look elsewhere.

i would go there only once. They have happy hours for cocktails only, but you have to order the same cocktail (2 for 1), this kind of tactic is done at small clubs/cocktail bars in Camden. I did not expect it from an expensive (compared to camden) place to have this tactic. I asked the bar staff and they told me that it is because during busy time, it is easy for them and I showed them the empty place with only 5-8 people and they did not have any answer. Food was okay, the music was just okay. You have to be drunk to enjoy it as it is not loud enough to be proper club (eventhough they are club) and not good choice. Crowd was just so so .. only good thing, it was not busy, so you can actually dance, if you want to. Or just site on the side and talk.. Not sure if I will go there again.. might go..

results.name: DSTRKT London
results.address: 9 Rupert Street, London W1D 6DG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: It is horrendous!!, was looking forward for a bling night, trust me would of had more fun at waxys occoners round the corner, full of hookers , money grabbing girls. It easier to enter Israels Parliament then to dstrkt , by the time you get in u are pissed off and tired. Prices for get it , only drug dealers and celebrity's can a afford it . If you want a bling night, buy a ticket to dubai for a weekend and you will come back with some change compare to this place . Thankfully i was with a bunch of amazing friends and we had a laugh which costed us a fortune.

I LOVE DSTRKT, it's my favourite place in London. Please can you release a cd of the music, its the only place I know in London where I love every single song they play. The staff are always friendly and never horrible and more than anything I feel really safe inside. Long Live DSTRKT x

Had the best Saturday night !!! Never been before, was recommended by a friend of my brother who works in the city and is a regular. He told us to eat before we went to the club and glad we did.
The food was amazing and we had a really nice waiter. Went to the club and danced all night, we met a great group and joined them. Now we are going back next month with our new friends too !

Queue outside was crazy. It took us forever to get inside but once we were inside the club, it was amazing! We contacted the guys from London Night Guide for our guestlist and they were really nice. My girls and I had a great night.

Door staff are so unhelpful, we were on guest list and had a table, however we were not let in because it was getting too busy, bearing in mind we got there at 10.30 and queued for 20 minutes, they only thought to tell us this when we got to the front of the queue. At tho point they told us to stand on the other side of the road which was just embarrassing and then told us we looked too young, we were a group of 7 girls aged 18-19 which is ridiculous, seems like they changed their excuse every 5 seconds. Also while we were queuing one of the staff told us there was a camera watching us in the queue so to stand there in silence pretty much, or we wouldn't get in. They make you feel very small and stupid, like a disobedient child. We ended up leaving there and went to Cafe de Paris around the corner instead and had an amazing night in there, would never bother going to DSTRKT again, they are judgemental, rude and treated me and my friends like idiots.

results.name: Novikov Restaurant & Bar
results.address: 50A Berkeley Street, London W1J 8HA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I visited Novikov a few weeks ago with a friend of mine to celebrate my birthday. We had made a booking a few days ago because it was a restaurant suggested by friends and having visited Rextail the week prior, I expected to have a delightful experience. Before I start, I will say the food was delicious, despite the portions being absolutely tiny and not quite enough to fill a grown man.

On arriving, we were taken to a seat with our coats still on; no one had offered to take our coats to the cloakroom and I actually had to ask if the restaurant even had a cloakroom. 

Secondly, I would like to mention that when we were booking, we mentioned that we had specific dietary requirements and the person on the phone assured us that they requirements would be met. On arriving, we decided to double check just to be sure and this time, we were told that our dietary requirements could not be catered to, essentially restricting us to two meat options on the entire menu.

Anyway, we did decide to go ahead and order what we could, despite having thoughts of walking out at that point. The waitress who was serving us seemed extremely grumpy and did not seem like someone who wanted to be at the job. 

There were tiny details as well that were ignored. For example, upon arriving, no one took the effort to pull the chairs out or place the napkin in place or even smile. Throughout the entire meal, we had to fill our glasses ourselves and when the jug was empty, no one came to refill it. The one point we were asked if the meal was okay was once we had finished everything and the waitress arrived to take the meal away. I understand a lot of these details are tiny, but for a restaurant in Mayfair, the bar is set extremely high and the prices we pay for the food and service need to be justified too.

On finishing our meal, although my friend mentioned during the reservation that the meal is for a birthday, there was no sign of the staff knowing anything about this.

It was an extremely disappointing experience for me and it is such a letdown for a birthday experience and on the way back, my friend who was treating me felt extremely embarrassed having taken me to what she proclaimed was one of the worst restaurant experiences in her life.

On e-mailing the manager with a complaint, after one e-mail, she has also not bothered to reply back, which shows that on principle, this is not a restaurant worth visiting.

The food is seriously overpriced in the Italian room. The staff is nice and pleasant, but they are not keeping up with the amount of orders and it took us about 1 hour to get our food ordered, luckily we were not in a rush. Seemed to me that the place tries to re-create some of the "posh" Moscow places (tough bouncers at the entrance instead of a smiling hostess), where everyone looks at what you are dressed into, etc. The place just looked surreal to me. The prices bite. The food is worth perhaps 1/2 of the price. Some dishes were cold when served, some too salty. The pasta tasted like it was cooked awhile ago. Some of the seafood dishes were nice and simple. The bread and the drinks were top class. Some of the Russian public reminded me with their attitude of the times when I was myself working in some top class Moscow restaurants as a student, and I certainly did not want to see this kind of attitude in London when I brought my business partners for a dinner. Reminded me Moscow 15 years ago, where the only important thing is the size of your wallet.

What a joke of a restaurant. Only bases its prices on the location with no added value for the customer in its food quality or service. 

Service was appalling! The staff were lovely but were so overworked that they couldn't keep up with the demands of the customers. Also, they hardly understood English, which delayed food times, orders came out incorrect and they struggled to deal with all the commotion. A restaurant to demand the prices it does in Mayfair, should provide each table area with a designated waiter and food staff to ensure they are given the excellent service they are paying for. We were served by more than 10 different staff members - this says it all.

Food was okay but not worth the price. My fellow diner and I ordered pasta off menu. Seafood Pasta so no biggy you would think! Considering their most expensive pasta on the menu was spaghetti and clams at £26, it was hard to swallow the bill when we saw our dish was priced at £52.50, yes £52.50!!!! Double the price, which equated to 3 prawns and a crayfish or two. What was even more disappointing though, when we queried the price, was that the general manager made no appearance to justify the cost, even though his waitress admitted making a mistake by not giving us a price at the point of order. The manager insisted though, via his waitress, that the price would stay because the price of the pasta, even though I made the point that he would lose a customer....really??!!

Would not recommend at all.

Very expensive, very chic, superb food, excellent attentive service and I believe value for money. 
Very cosmopolitan clientele.

The ambiance is really fun, totally unpretentious, every table seemed to be enjoying themselves, the music was lively along with the chitter chatter and the club-lounge downstairs is amazing.

If you fancy a dressed up evening, a little romance or simply a upmarket meal - this is a fantastic place to visit. If you don't mind spending a lot for diner and drinks, and you like being surrounded by bling, crystals and silicon then you will love it.
For the Asian. Toro sashimis were good, rolls were all right, what's good is that they have little rice wrapped around.

results.name: Opal
results.address: Hungerford House, Victoria Embankment, London WC2N 6PA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Dear Opal, 

I've been here many times over the last few years but only recently had a very bad experience.

I booked a party here for my boyfriends bday under his name. Got in fine, enjoyed my drink and then went outside for a smoke, leaving my jacket with wallet, ID and phone inside the club with my boyfriend and all our friends.

After wanting to come back in after my smoke the bouncers refused me entry back in the club claiming I had never entered in the first place, I said I had organized a private event for my boyfriends birthday and that the manager could confirm that this was true. The bouncer made some snide remark about how the manager wouldn't let gays in anyway and proceeded to tell me to piss off and that if I had got in then I would have a stamp.I refused to budge stating I had been in and my jacket was still inside, justifying why I was wearing a whole suit without the jacket. I was told I was a liar and that people like me weren't wanted inside. I felt very intimidated and could sense the bouncers wanting to provoke me into doing something. When another of my friends arrived for the party asking why I was stuck outside the bouncers also refused him entry because he was associated with myself and accused me of wanting to incite more trouble. It wasn't until my boyfriend came out looking for me that I was able to claim my jacket, the bouncers proceeded to speak with the manager in front of us saying we had been causing trouble claiming we had been making homophobic comments against the bouncers even though we were the homosexuals! We all got kicked out/asked to leave by the manager and told we weren't welcome here anymore and not to come back again. This all happened before 9pm too.

I've always enjoyed opal but the bouncers have ruined the entire experience for me. the lack of compassion, the surplus of arrogance and aggression. communication between bouncers and management was nonexistent. Be careful here, the bouncers are more interested in creating trouble than keeping order. I'm still waiting for an apology from management about the whole incident. Avoid like the plague, stick to fire and heaven clubs.

I had a great time here last weekend. The door, reception, security and bar staff were very welcoming, professional and pleasant. It was great on the dance floor, the DJ was playing all my favourites, each time I went to leave the dance floor another favourite was played. FAB!

Wednesdays have a great Karaoke Night with fantastic hosts, they keep me up dancing all night even though there were singers belting out tunes, I'll Def be back every Wednesday - the only late night venue by the pier

I went to the Opal bar for a friends birthday this weekend. All tables had already been reserved so there was nowhere to stand but at the bar. As you can imagine this became impractical as the evening progressed and the bar became more crowded.

It took a huge amount of time to get served which I could understand if this were a particularly busy bar, however when I arrived and it was still quite empty there seemed to be staff standing around ignoring people waiting to buy a drink.

Opal bar has one redeeming factor that is half price drinks before 9pm. But when you consider that a pint of beer will cost you at least £5 after 9pm, I can see why the place emptied out so quickly after the drinks offer had finished.

I was also appalled at the behaviour of staff when my sister's coat was stolen from the bar. My question is, is it normal policy to eject a girl into the rain when she becomes distraught over the theft of her coat? The manager on duty at the time refused to help out at all and wouldn't even check over CCTV footage to see whether it was actually stolen or whether it had just been misplaced. 

Overall I'd have to say my experience of the Opal Bar was pretty awful and I certainly won't be spending my money there again. Based on the behaviour of the staff I have also informed all of my friends and acquaintances that they should find better places to part with their money.
Great place for a quick drink.... They have a fabulous promotion.... 5 until 8 each day half price drinks

results.name: Freedom Bar Soho
results.address: National House, 60-66 Wardour Street, London W1F 0TA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Awesome place, music is amazing. Got absolutely hammered 2 weeks back and danced like insane!

We were greeted (or not) by the most rude person on the door I have ever met. She just stared at us as if we had come here for anything else and then asked 'WHAT'? whilst looking us up and down. After asking if we could come in for a drink she asked if we were on the guest list (we weren't- but just wanted a drink) and eventually and very reluctantly let us in. 

Horrible staff- won't go back.

People tend to think of this place as a weekend party location. I use it during the week for after work drinks! Cocktail happy hour 2-4-1! They do one of the best Pornstar Martinis! 

Fun atmosphere, staff always helpful, useful to book a table, and you get waitered service. Nice!

Downstairs can turn into a bit of a meat market on a weekend when the students are in, but all the same, music is cheesy and there is usually a bit of eye candy wandering around offering shots... what's not to like?!!
Fun, lively atmosphere downstairs with good dance music. Drinks are expensive but that would be expected from the location.

Good happy hour with really reasonably priced drinks for the location. On week days they tend to have a deal where you can get a pint for £2. Annoyingly it tends to be quite busy upstairs and so there usually aren't any seats (and downstairs is often closed off). Downstairs is a nice place for gigs and quite roomy.

results.name: Mare Moto
results.address: 562 King's Road, London SW6 2DZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
The food here is delicious - classic Italian cooking as a Brit would recognise. Portions are HUGE and the prices are reasonable. The staff have always been great on my numerous visits with lots of banter. It attracts a Chelsea set, but given the area that's what you should be expecting. The downstairs club is interesting... Avoid at all costs if you want to avoid aspiring Made in Chelsea extras. However, with the right company, a few drinks and the letting go of any pretentiousness, a really fun night can be had!

A great choice for dinner with friends when you're not sure if you want to go "out out" or just "out" - you can decide whether downstairs is for you over dessert. (Worth noting that they do catering as well)
Friendly staff, delicious food and great cocktails! Will need to go back and check out the club

This lovely little Italian place was recommended to me by a couple of friends and I decided to follow their advice and went on a dinner here with my wife. I could say by her smile that she enjoyed every part of our evening - we dined in peace and had the pleasure to taste some fine Italian pasta and pizza.

I booked a table for 20 people in Mare Moto on a Saturday night. I emailed the manager a few times and he told me that there was a £400 min spend on the table. I thought it was a bit steep but agreed. Only on the night was it revealed to me that the table cost £400 and it came with two bottles of either vodka or champagne. This was not at all what I had agreed with the manager. When I asked him via email if anything was included with the table I wasn't told that there was. The manager was really rude to me and didn't seem to want to take the £400 I was willing to pay in there. He was adamant that all the big clubs charge £600-£1000 for a table and I was lucky to get one for £400 with two bottles of something. In the end he said to his bar manager 'do whatever makes her happy' and was very dismissive of me. I'd go back there, but don't bother trying to book anything. Bar staff were nice and friendly though.

Disappointing food for the price, overcrowded and shocking customer service; never experienced anything so poor having dined and frequented many of London's restaurants and bars. The only thing I can honestly say I liked was the music, but the rude management and dangerously overcrowded environment heavily detracted from this making it an overall terrible experience!

results.name: Yates's
results.address: 269-271 Station Road, London, Harrow HA1 2TB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Not so bad in day but weekend evenings full of twats acting like, well, twats....

Went there during the day which is probably the best time to go judging by the reviews... bar staff were incredibly friendly, drinks offers were fantastic, food was great. Will be going again - during the day no doubt.
Really bad service form the staff last night. Very slow, slower than usual. I had to wait almost an hour to get served. No joke!

Attracts all the illiterate, obnoxious scum of harrow and surrounding areas ... try walking by that place with an attractive woman and watch the uneducated gorillas in queue outside say stupid things .. And the doormen just stand there like morons watching this kind of behaviour ... amazing ..

results.name: Bunga Bunga
results.address: 37 Battersea Bridge Road, Battersea, London SW11 3BA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Atmosphere was kitsch and over the top in a good way, wait staff were great and attentive, food was rather good, you do feel rushed to finish by times however we knew ahead of time how long we had so that was fine. 

Then comes the Karaoke and entertainment portion of the evening, my wife and I were very excited for Karaoke as we've sung at clubs all over, but the "DJ" was extremely rude and warned my wife he would cut her off if her performance wasn't good enough, if he allowed her to sing at all!? This really goes against the spirit of Karaoke and kinda ruined the night for us as we were mainly going to have a night out and have a light night of singing etc. Needless to say we won't be going back, and if you like Karaoke this isn't the place to do that, go find a small pub with a real Karaoke setup and real people.

Really disappointing. Very unattentive staff, it wasn't a busy night & not once did the staff check if the food was ok or if we needed more drinks - we had to ask every time to place drinks orders and it felt like hard work! The pizza is not good value, toppings used sparingly & small for the price. Luckily I was in great company, but I would not recommend this place at all.

Booked in advance and still had to be content with the early 7pm sitting for this novelty, themed restaurant, decked out in Italian memorabilia, with props adorning all wall space. The house wine was awful and was served luke warm in carafes - it had to go back and was replaced by more that was only slightly cooler. Expensive sharing cocktails are also available complete with sparklers and giant straws. If you are going you are probably safest sticking with pizza which is nothing more than average, but preferable to the tiny portion of main you may get otherwise. Throughout the night the waiting staff break into choreographed dance routines to loud music. Funny the first time was wears a bit thin. Towards the end of the meal you felt under pressure to give up table for the next sitting. Entertainment around the bar takes the form of a seriously bad singer who claimed to do 'covers of pop songs and takes requests', yet knew none of the songs we asked for which were far from out of the ordinary. The night descends into karaoke upstairs until 2am.

Fantastic! I went to Bunga Bunga with my friends last night and it was awesome! The staff was friendly and we had great talk with them. There was plenty of beer for our table and the food was good. And, of course, we sang…and sang...undisturbed. Great place!

I have been here both for the weekend brunch and on a weekday evening for dinner and drinks - both are very different experiences. If you want good (but not amazing) Italian food and cocktails in a laid back, kitschy vibe then visit Monday - Thursday. It's a good, lively night out. However, if you are more focused on the booze and a crazy weekend, book in for brunch! At £35 a head, that covers all your food (again, not the best food) and all your prosecco for 2.5 hours. Prosecco. On tap. For 2.5 hours. That alone is worth more than the £35 cover charge! Everyone gets very drunk, very quickly and the karaoke and dancing are hilarious. A great choice for a birthday party as it takes the fuss out of splitting bills and having to organise a place to dance after dinner.

Bottom line: If loud music and drunk people before 5pm is your idea of hell - avoid this place. However, if you are looking for a raucous and very fun day out - Bunga Bunga brunch is hard to beat. (Side note - use the cloakroom, belonging do tend to go missing if left in the restaurant area when everyone is dancing)

results.name: Browns
results.address: 1 Hackney Road, London E2 7NX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Ok for a basic joint
Great
Задължително посещение!!!

results.name: The Bar With No Name
results.address: 69 Colebrooke Row, London N1 8AA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Cokctails were all gross (and thats not good for a cocktail bar).
We were 3 friends and the 3 cocktails were all bad.
Better go to experimental cocktail club or some other one in soho
