It's a little bit cramped here, but don't let that put you off. 

The cocktails really are imaginative, and made with elegance. Staff are incredibly helpful, and take the time to describe the drinks on offer.

A great place for a date, away from the often trashy weekend Upper Street.
Book a table before you go! But you might be lucky and they seat you on their stairs. Really cosy place off the High Street

It is the best cocktail bar here in London. The drinks are very versatile and relaxing. They also offer a classy and romantic wine. Really delicious but a bit pricey but surely satisfying. It is truly a cool bar with lovely and alive music.
I'm always impressed by a funky new flavour

results.name: Hilton London Croydon
results.address: 101 Waddon Way, Purley Way, Croydon, Greater London CR9 4HH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Hotel is situated in a nice remote location, with some eateries nearby.
The lobby and bar area is pleasant with modern decor.
The rooms were of a good size however, the beds were squeaky, the lcd TV sound was appalling and the toilet seat was a cheap plastic seat.
Breakfast was good and tasty.

Spent one night and must say that the hotel was very comfortable. Checked in easy and the staff were friendly. The decor was a little bit dated but generally looking good. Had a king size bed in a spacious and clean room. The breakfast was good with a big selection of items. If I have a chance I would stay again.
Loved this hotel, modern, friendly, great service and super food. Would highly recommend to anyone.

My best friend Ted and I wanted an accommodation which was at a convenient spot, not far away from London. This hotel was the best decision - the train was close and we had no trouble with directions. Ted was very happy because he took his dog Randy with us - the hotel allows pets which was a relief. Very friendly staff.

The hotel was easy to find and near to the train station. Large and comfortable rooms. The bed was creaky. The staff were friendly and efficient in sorting a couple of issues for us. Excellent food in the restaurant. Wasn't even expensive.

results.name: Verve
results.address: 1 Upper St Martin's Lane, London WC2H 9NY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great bar with amazing music and full of good deals ... Had two staff parties there already ! Recommend it.

Decent price for cocktails in happy hour as they are half price so work out around £3.50 each but generally quite an expensive bar and nothing special. Good place for a few drinks before heading to a club.

I went there to celebrate my birthday with my colleagues from work. It is located in central London close to Leicester Square. They offer free entry before 11pm. The club has a good size and it is distributed in different areas with different types of music. They offer the possibility to prepare private venues such as hen parties or birthday packages. Personally, when I went there the club area was too crowded except from that it is a good place to meet with friends in central london.

For a bar in a really touristy part of London I thought the place in general wasn't that bad. Drinks were fairly pricey (£4.40 for a bottle of peroni) but I would expect to pay that, the barstaff were quite nice and the music was pretty good. What really annoyed me was one of the bouncers. A few of us were waiting patiently to get our coats back and a bouncer just came along and started pushing people around. The guy was a complete idiot on a massive power trip.

Recently went here for a private event. Quite dark downstairs and the layout doesn't seem to flow too well. Fairly good selection of beers though and ended up being a pretty good night. Not sure I'd go back.

results.name: Oceana
results.address: 127 The Parade, Watford, Hertforshire WD17 1NA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
NIGHTMARE!... I went on my birthday, booked a table with 4 bottles pre paid and enterance pre paid... We go there and they refuse to let us in as "we were a large male group"; we did book a table like come on !? 

Then next day i check on insta to see if it was a good night, then i see 3-4 groups of males showing their table and drinks off.. come on what is the logic of refusing customers... 

Never again, I really wanted to go and see it as my bro went there in his days but I would never go there or watford for raving again, they think they are some mayfair club asking everyone to be suited and booted... we go there to party not sit down and watch people dance

I spent 200 pounds in my timberland boots,to be safe while i'm riding and also look reasonably good and they just didn't let me get in. 

DON'T SUPPORT DISCRIMINATION. 

Go to someplace else.

Immensely disappointing. Having read these reviews below, it is sad to say that they are very true. The door staff, security and 'mangers' are condescending, rude and have a lack of customer care. They were painfully unhelpful and ruthless. I arranged a minibus from East London for my friends, weeks leading up to Saturday 1st February my friends and myself had contacted their head office and checked the website FAQs regarding purchasing tickets and dress code, this was a well-planned night out and all the boxes were ticked. My male friends, with pre paid tickets and adhering to the dress code on the website which states ‘fairly relaxed dress code’ but ‘we don’t allow things like sportswear or anything you’d throw on to go to the gym or for a run’ were refused entry because there footwear. They were wearing Creative Recreations, Ralph Lauren and Prada. People were seen entering with battered Converse, Nike Blazers and Hierarchies. Having challenged the ‘manager’ Lee about his decision to not allow my friends in because of their non-gym running shoes, he told us all to wait until he could deal with us. It also seemed that people who had pre paid tickets were getting the most hassle for their footwear. Lee and Elliot (door staff) continued to repeat that the club needed standards and insisted that this dress code was clear but nowhere does is it state on the ticket or website that the footwear they had on was unacceptable or that Converse and Vans were ok. Once we got in, an hour and 30mins later, I was shocked to find queues for the other rooms. Which meant your experience was concentrated to one room, so no value for money going to a large club. I waited at the bar for nearly 10/15mins and was then told no card, there were no signs to say cash only. Time wasted, the night was emotionally exhausting and a huge let down, would not recommend this for a friends big night out as there is no guarantee you will all get in. Three of my party did not get in, and ended up getting a cab all the way back to East London which cost them £70. They were wearing Prada and Ralph Lauren (non gym wear). My friend changed into a pair of old once white converse and was let in, where were the standards there? There is no consistency, clarity or professionalism which is really unacceptable from a club that professes high standards.

I booked for me and my gf to go down Oceana on NYE. I was expecting it to be a very nice evening and a great way to end the year 2013. But no, soon as we got to the entrance, the front staff refused entry straight away. They said my shoes were classified as boot (Timberlands) and they were not allowed in. I was furious as people wearing similar shoes were allowed in but they didn't allow me and my Gf.. What made me even more angry that one of the staff actually said to me and I quote ''If you go out and buy £6 Converse trainers I would let you in but not with those boots''. They really do need to sort something out. Paid £27 each for tickets and a cab drive there and back £40 (nearly hundred £s even before we even got in the club). No where in the tickets it says that classic timberland boots are not allowed. Could have made it a bit more clearer.. I have a feeling they were only letting certain groups of people in and not everyone. Even if you paid £££s you will be very lucky to get in the club.. 

I have actually been to that club wearing the same shoes couple of months back and they allowed me then so now I don't know what had happened.. 

Was reading a lot of reviews on Google, most people also agreed that it will be hard to get in even when you have done the right things (bought tickets in advance and wearing proper clothes) but I thought it would never happen to me. Guess I was wrong.. 

One NYE night out ruined thanks to Oceana.

They won't let you in! If you are wearing crag hopper trousers, which are legit and are not for chavs then they won't let you into their chav festival. Very unhappy had to watch all my friends go in and then waste a few hours walking around Watford for them to finish. 

I wouldn't recommend going there are much better night clubs in the Watford area that don't discriminate anywhere near as much.

results.name: Sugar Hut Village
results.address: 93-95 High Street, Brentwood CM14 4RR, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
The Sugar Hut is alright i guess!
Music is great but the upstairs venue is tiny (Gemma Collins from TOWIE charging to the bar like a rhino doesn't help haha) and the drinks are very expensive!
Go there to experience it, but it's not brilliant

Awesome bartender! Nicest person I've met in the UK. Only really good cup of tea I've had in the UK. Dancing was a blast. Of course the music was too loud and the song selection very poor but still a fun time. Like virtually all clubs the dance floor is tiny so very few people can dance. The dance floor filled up fast and you can't *really* dance after about 10:30 pm but that first hour is good.

The courtyard is a nice place to cool off and actually chat with someone. Forget talking in the dance area the music is so loud it is literally impossible to do anything more than read lips.

the sugar hut ruined my 18th! the staff were rude.. the floor was so dirty and slipery that i slipped over and lost my phone. 
The staff were not helpful and as for the dj.. what kind of dj doesn't have a microphone? 
This was ment to be my first night out clubbing and i wanted to go to the sugar hut as i heard it was good. Waist of money and time.
I will not be going there again.
BRING BACK THE WHITEHART FOR PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN BRENTWOOD. WHAT DO U THINK MICK THE BOSS. DONT YOU EVER READ YOUR REVIEWS MICK? OPEN UP THE COURTYARD IN THE DAYTIME. ?

Sugar Hut is awsome in everyway, there are a lot of comments regarding cost and how expensive drinks are.. this is a place where its classy and this means you pay for what you get, its the same as everything in life. If you disagree and think its far to expensive then go to a weatherspoons with no atmosphire or music you will have a ace night there for around £12.
Ive been to Sugar Hut about 8-10 times and now i know a fair few of its staff who are all ace.
You are always likely to someone famous as its a classy sort of place, not like weatherspoons.
My comments are: Sugar Hut is 100% worth a look and belive me you wont be disapointed.

results.name: Foundation Bar
results.address: 5 Langley Street, London WC2H 9JA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Recently had my sisters 21st here (45 attendees). Fantastic night, great drinks incredible food and one amazing party planner. I would highly recommend this venue for small or big parties. Great value for money I will be returning for sure. what a great night!!!

*only recommendation is that it could play a more diverse range of music, however the house mixed with commercial music was great!

Booked a table of 10, had a little section to ourselves. I went on a friday night, and it didnt really turn into a great night to party, but to start the night off, it was an awesome place. Great cocktails in jam jars, and logs for seats... Really enjoyed our time here.

It was the worst night out you could imagine, we were put on a table that was to small for our party, when we requested a table next to the dance floor. The table was too small. Spend £250 for cheap alcohol that was over priced, horrible cold food that wasn't enough for a party of 9 and bad attitude from the staff when trying to tell them and ask how it can be resolved. 
Would not recommend this club/bar to anyone.
Cool grungy underground bar. Only let down by poorly-trained bar staff who, at an empty bar and standing directly in front of you, take literally minutes to welcome or even acknowledge your presence.

COME HERE FOR HAPPY HOUR EVERYDAY 5-7:30pm! A wonderful atmosphere and with the 50% off ALL drinks and sharing platters this place is very affordable. The cocktails are wonderful especially the sharing cocktails which come served in wonderful tea pots and jam jars! If you are looking for somewhere to spend a couple of hours after work this is a great centrally located place.

results.name: Hilton Dartford Bridge Hotel
results.address: Masthead Close, Crossways Business Park, Dartford DA2 6QF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Really big family room. Nice big beds. Good breakfast. Pool was fun with the kids, but it's a bit deep. Bit frustrating to pay £4 for parking then get delayed leaving by a broken parking barrier. Fantastic service though.

Stayed for three nights. Great location - near Bluewater and Lakeside. The hotel was clean with large and comfortable rooms but a little bit outdated. Nice spa and pool - never too busy and well maintained. The food in the restaurant was delicious. The staff - so kind and friendly. Overall nice stay and great service.
Lovely big room with sofa. Large nice bathroom. And most importantly of all. ..Costa Coffee down stairs.
Nice place with good location. Our room was a great size with comfortable beds. No traffic noise from outside. Spotless swimming pool and sauna. Staff was so warm and friendly.

My partner and I recently spent the weekend here and we loved it right away. We felt very welcomed and thought that the hotel was lovely. A very kind Indian man greeted us before he even had a chance to walk over to reception on our first night with smiles and enthusiasm. The next morning was a different story as we went back to reception and had to pretty much get the attention of the British woman who seemed as if she was ready to finish her shift and couldn't be bothered, making me automatically feel like we had overstayed our welcome. The restaurant staff, I cannot fault. They were so friendly and receptive to any questions I'd wish we only went to them for anything rather than reception. As for the bar staff, I would say was poor. She didn't seem to want to serve us in the first place and then when we asked for ice she seemed to be annoyed. We came back again the second night for more ice and she gave us a kind of "oh you again" attitude. We stayed in a double room which was very nice. Our first night we ate in the restaurant there and the food was delicious. The deal we had included breakfast buffet which is just your regular full-english breakfast. Overall the hotel was lovely and I would recommend it to others. Just make sure not to ask the bar staff for anything... or maybe just ice! ;-)

results.name: Yum Cha Silks & Spice
results.address: 27-28 Chalk Farm Road, London NW1 8AG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
This place is TERRIBLE (this is the first time I have felt the need to leave a review on anything, ever!)

1) The food is disgusting (half price Dim Sung on Mon - Weds), and we didn't eat a quarter of what we ordered. My girlfriend and I were then up half the night and still feel ill today.

2) the waiting staff made us move tables twice (and were rude about it). 

3) Cheap nasty wine sold for £5 a glass, and then compulsory service charge added to the bill. 

DO NOT GO HERE. It used to be good, now it's awful.

My friends and I were craving dim sum so we decided to take advantage of the 50% off from 5.30pm every Monday to Wednesday - we weren't disappointed. The food was good and the service quick, although the staff were not too friendly. The interior is a little too dim and the decor not to my taste, but the food (and prices) made up for it. Will definitely be back for more half-priced dim sum!

A few friends and I booked one of the karaoke rooms on a Saturday night. It was very good value, considering we only had to spend £100 between us, and with drinks and a few dim sum dishes that was all too easy.

The karaoke machine was a little old-fashioned, but that only enhanced the experience for us.

It was also great having a private room and being brought delicious food and drinks. I felt like a member of an organised crime syndicate, but less feared by the waiting staff.
Love it! Amazing food choice and pricing, love karaoke rooms and song choice. They do update it!

This place was really amazing! There is usually a long line but the wait goes quickly because all of the staff’s moves so fast and the turnoverare pretty quick. The dumplings are so delicious and fresh, I could not get enough. The red sauce they put on the table is good on everything and do not be afraid to ask for more. The prices are also quite affordable. And if you are not sure what to order from the menu try the dim-sum, which is served all day. The place is really great and relaxing with a comfortable living room seating, outdoor patio deck, and lots of comfortable chairs to seat on. I will surely back for more.

results.name: 229 The Venue
results.address: 229 Great Portland Street, London W1W 5PN, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Great music venue air conditioned with wooden floor perfect for salsa. Salsa fusion is held here twice a month. There is a small bar that is always full but the staff are friendly. All in all this venue seems to generate a great party atmosphere every time I go there.
Saw Bad manners! Lip up fatty!
Bol tu rytmus a ja som otom ani nevedel doo pi..cii

results.name: The Shaftesbury
results.address: 39-45 Shaftesbury Avenue, London W1D 6LA, United Kingdom

results.name: Club Aquarium
results.address: 256-260 Old Street, London EC1V 9DD,, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Bouncers very rude. Came with my friends from Luton. We discovered this place was open late with some blokes from Scotland. On entry they turned me away, the only black guy of the group. Could see they were actively turning away black guys. My friends from luton who were about to get in stopped and complained in which the bouncers went on to shout at them, push them out, and flash lights at us to disorientate us. They were 5’4 ladies not aggressive blokes that was not needed.

I had a fantastic time at Club Aquarium, a very well run club that has has many orginal aspects to it. I thought that the idea of having a swimming pool in a night club was great idea. The drinks were cheap and there were great deals on cocktails and entry. The engergy in the club was electric. The security staff are well orgainsed and did their job accordingly. I recommend this night club to everyone. It's a must visit venue.

A few friends and I came to this place relatively late in the night only to be met by rude and unreasonable bouncers, overpriced admission and drinks. 

Inside the place is very dated (looks like it hasn't been refurbished since the early 90s). This gives it an awful atmosphere and despite it being very late in the night, it was completely dead. The fact that it was so old and tatty made it seem the huge prices for drinks and admission were absolutely ridiculous.

However, this was NOT the the worst part. A few of us decided to walk out of the club for a bit of fresh air. On doing this, the bouncer said we weren't allowed back in; we had paid £12 entry literally ten minutes before! One of my other friends then also came out to talk to us and was actually in the parameters of the club. The bouncer then grabbed him and man-handled him out of the perimeter where he wasn't allowed back in either (he had only stood there for 30 seconds)! We felt like we had been CONNED; being denied access for simply stepping out the club is insane. I then started asking him why he wasn't letting us back in, (especially when there wasn't anyone inside anyway) his only reply was to rudely sigh, tut, and then turn his back and walk into the club's doorway. He clearly couldn't give me a good reason, we had not been rowdy or done anything wrong (it would have been impossible having been in there for a mere ten minutes!), we had simply stepped out of the club. Then as we walked away, in frustration I said to him this was "the worst club ever", he told me to "f**k off you s**t" - terrible, awful, and appalling standard of professionalism. 

In summary, AVOID Aquarium like the plague; tacky nightclub, rude and unreasonable bouncers and overpriced drinks and admission. Don't make the same mistake we did and throw your money into this hole for only fifteen minutes worth of entry! It is easily the worst nightclub I have ever had the misfortune of going to.

Such a great club. My experience there was so much fun and was made even better by everyone else in the club being there to enjoy themselves and to have fun. Brilliant atmosphere inside and is reassured by the staff being friendly and doing their jobs correctly.
Hello, i am one man, wat live for music, if you need a special sessions contact-me my Facebook is calin zvetozar and one of soundcloud is speedtouch more details, on Facebook..

results.name: The Coppid Beech
results.address: John Nike Way, Binfield, Bracknell, Berkshire RG12 8TF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Good location for legoland, Thorpe park, chessington,Windsor and Corel reef. Rooms are good if some of the furniture is showing ware. Breakfast is excellent, evening meals are above average but a little pricey. Pool and gym are clean and functional. If you have three children the suit is a good option.

After reading a few reviews on this page I was a bit concerned at what would be on offer at Coppid Beach Hotel (Bracknell). We found the hotel offered everything you could want.

Based only two minutes from the M4 but far enough away that it didnt feel like a service station hotel. The hotel offers extremely good service and amazing facilities. The leisure facilities are very good (good sized pool, sauna etc) but they always say the little things are the best. The two stand out extras for me was free soft drinks in the mini bar in the room and Sky Sports 1,2 and 3 in the rooms!!! 

Breakfast was very good but we recommend eating out (nice little Indian down the road) as prices a little much for dinner at the hotel.

The reviews on here seem to be mixed but my experience was that this hotel offers elegance, facilities and extras for a very good price (£69.00 a night!)
Overpriced food,uninspiring menu,dull atmosphere.staff friendly though!.decided to eat here as it has an AA rosette..left very disappointed!.

I stayed at the Coppid Beech several times on business trips. The rooms were ok, not spectacular and not really bad, but the hotel seems a bit old and a makeover wouldn't hurt. If you're hungry at night - go somewhere else to eat. Breakfast is just slightly better.

results.name: Ku Bar
results.address: 30, Lisle St, London WC2H 7BA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
I originally came to this venue because I misunderstood what the venue was offering. I thought the Ku Klub was one of the local gatherings for a secret society of which I am part of. However, I was disappointed when other attendees were not donning the same white clothes and robe as myself. I was forced to ask the rather awkward question of 'are you sacred of foreign intrusion' and to my dismay most people were not. Nevertheless, I persisted seeing as the name of the bar was so closely aligned to that of my society and ended up having a great time. I met some lovely new friends and will be coming back in the future. Bar staff were friendly and very welcoming. Only reason its not five starts is due to the initial confusion.
Kevin (With a brand new positive outlook on life!) - Obama 2016!
The friendliest and most attractive bar staff. Clientele includes millionaire wives who are allowed to flirt there. Lager always tastes good there. Join their loyalty card and get drink specials.

Warning they will steal your money if they think youre drunk. Short medium middle aged built guy about 5'6" collects cover money, he is a thief, give him exact change or else he will claim you only gave him a smaller denomination. He is usually shirtless and wears just suspenders. It is always a horrible feeling when you are robbed and there is nothing you can do about it. Bring 5 pound bills only. The place is really small and crowded with many straight girls. The music is top 40. My night was ruined by the thief.
Awesome night here, full of good people. A wonderful experience overall! Nice cocktails!

Pricey drinks, and expect not to get served unless you are intentionally rude to get what you want if you're not a guy (or don't look enough like one to warrant their attention).
Ruby Tuesdays is an okay night but if you're androgynous/ do not fit their criteria of 'female looking', expect to have to deal with the rude security guard in order to get in. 
Got bored, left.

results.name: Source Below
results.address: 11 Lower John Street, London W1F 9TY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: The best karaoke ever! We sang with my friends all night! There was a huge song list to choose from which was awesome. And they all were different styles which was also good. Otherwise, the atmosphere is cozy and pleasant and it’s not expensive.

What a night, what a perfect way to celebrate my 27th. Had the best time ever. Great venue, bar staff good fun, helpful and very friendly. Song list good. Computer for songs very easy to use. Only problem was the night went far to quickly. Thanks so much would defo recommend you.

Source Below is by all means my favorite karaoke bar. There is the longest list of possible songs to sing and the quality of sound is great. Furthermore, the people working there are friendly and honest and even when you go only with one friend, they make you feel like you are hanging with a whole company.

I think those people who put 5 stars on here must work for the club because it is TOTALLY not like it is in the pictures.

I wanted a karaoke venue for my leaving drinks and booked it through a booking company who stated it was their 'Flagship' location. They should not send people here (read review by octavia - 100% accurate - add the air conditioning wasn't working to the list as well)

I honestly believe that they don't want customers because their attitude absolutely stinks trying to close things down early when they had no following booking and the place was still full with my guests - (Hello???? We call that making money!) And the sign for the club is so tiny and hidden so none of my guests could find it properly!!!

All I would like to say to the people who work there and the owner - SORT IT OUT!

Hi! I am New York comic Lewis Schaffer and do my "Lewis Schaffer is Free until Famous" comedy show at the Source Below every Tuesday and Wednesday. I can understand the feelings of the reviewers here. The Source has changed alot in the past year. It has been substantially redone with new loos, new lights and a fixed-up bar. Most people who come on down think the place is sweet and intimate - not what you would expect at all from the outside (If you can find it - black door near corner). It is almost like a New York club in the middle of Soho. Please book a Karaoke party here, and during the week, come down and have a laugh with me. My show's been recommended by Time Out, The Times, The Guardian, and The Independent. For real!

results.name: Tiger Tiger Croydon
results.address: 16 High Street, Croydon, Surrey CR0 1GT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Urine on toilet floor. Food took an age to arrive and was over-priced. Packed with tossers , clowns and scrubbers.
Not for the daytime crowd. The staff was sullen, the toilets reeked, there was no beer on tap and the food was mediocre and over priced for the quality/quantity.

tiger tiger is a cool club, it has three rooms that all play different types of music such as rnb, house and pop, i went on a student night which cost me £5 but usually it cost £10 on a normal night. On a student night the queue was quite long i waited at least 20/30 minutes to get in
Pricey and a little tacky. Cheerful enough though.

Terrible place to eat or dance or any thing for that matter, i quite agree with the other reviews no R&B not even charts ones rude managers very racist approach when confronted the are very patronising !! i had an awful time in this venue NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL!!

results.name: Chino Latino Bar and Restaurant, London
results.address: Park Plaza Riverbank, 18 Albert Embankment, London SE1 7TJ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We had a great experience at Chino Latino. This restaurant might seem a bit pricey but you surely get what you pay for. The service was excellent: our wonderful waiter Gabriel was always available, willing to give us recommendation & make sure we had everything we needed. The cocktails were delicious and the food excellent, tasty and well presented. We enjoyed our night a lot and would recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Delicious! It was a bit pricey, but totally worth it. My husband and I stayed at the Park Plaza Riverbank and decided to eat there two nights in a row. My absolute favorite place to eat!

Chino Latino was spot on with every dish we had the past couple nights. As well their staff did a tremendous job providing world class service, ( Molly and Baeta). I would fully recommend the seafood as it is fresh and has it's own flare! A place that you will want to come back to over and over again.

We go here for lunch when we have something to celebrate at work, sadly there aren't enough of them as I could eat here every week. The food is modern Japanese with some influences from other parts of Asia. All the food is beautifully presented and the restaurant itself has a modern decor. The lunch menu is has lots of choice with various sushi, dim-sum type offerings, salads, tempura, bento boxes and 5-6 main dishes. I love the wild mushroom sushi, oh and the crab and scallop mushroom soup dumplings are delicious. For the main I always take a Bento box, last time it was the vegetarian one and the Bahn Trang rice paper rolls were amazing. I've never yet made it to dessert but they look good. 

It's not a cheap lunch but it's a very delicious one and probably the best you'll get along this stretch of Albert Embankment.

It was an absolutely beautiful location. They had plenty of very polite staff, but they left our drinks unattended several times, which could have been solved by leaving the bottles on the table. We were sort of expecting mexican and chinese food, but it was actually just oriental tapas with sushi, fish, tofu, dim sum and more. The dishes were works of art. Seriously well presented, but as can be expected with such glamour, really small portions. I would say the quality of food was okay: good, but not great. Also, their menu was in Papyrus. That font alone would take down my rating a whole star. This is a good restaurant to go to if you are in the mood for feeling fabulous, spending some money, and not eating a whole lot. I'd say 3, maybe 4 stars.

results.name: Bodo's Schloss
results.address: 2A Kensington High Street, London W8 4PT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: First of all this is in Chelsea area so they look you up and down at the door and if you don't fit in the typical sw3 crowd they send you over to pay the entry fee otherwise if you look like your #madeinChelsea u get in for free. We were directed to pay but my friend just swanned straight to the bar and I pretended I didn't know any better. The crowd really aren't any better looking. Music not memorable. Quick service at the bar but otherwise it's not that great. A lot of male patrons go dressed like the staff and will try and dance with you - thanks but no thanks! Ughh!

Very disappointing. The food was luke warm and bland. We left very quickly after eating due to the rudeness of the manager, even the serving staff were apologising for his behaviour. The fact that it was the only German restaurant in London we could get a booking with at last minute notice should have sounded alarm bells... so many better options around

To keep it short, if Bodo's Schloss was in the Oxford dictionary...it would be an alternative word for "OVERRATED!"

The employees has more attitude than a spoiled little 11 year old brat. Yelling at customers to pay for entrance then to be told to hurrying up and enter the club and not to stand waiting for the rest of the group. *neglected as a child much?

To top it off, the drinks menu is way overpriced and nothing special at all. Beware, you will be served nothing but ice at £13 a pop.

Overall the location is perfect, Bodo's Schloss-theme is cheap and tacky, especially when the female workers have to wear the Austrians outfit from Poundland...I would be extremely anal too if I have to wear the outfits for a living while showing hideous cellulite. 

Not really attractive darling!

An enjoyable evening. Nosh was surprisingly good - particularly soup and goulasch. Staff were very friendly. Yes the dance floor got v crowded, but what do you expect on a saturday night in south Ken and everyone was very matey.

Lovely venue when you first arrive, but it all goes downhill from there. Tend to agree with all the other negative reviews about this place. It's clear that the place is focused solely on making money. Set menu of £28 was way overpriced, and the food was average. Drinks were equally as expensive and the staff are unfriendly and rude. 
We were all crammed onto one long table, and once we finished our meal (we were rushed into finishing 3 courses in about an hour and a half), they told us we had to move to the bar, where there was no space to stand. They then ushered in the next group of unsuspecting souls who will no doubt have received the same terrible service and dead average food.
15% service charge was also extortionate. When I queried the service charge, I was told that " yes it is optional for you, but if you don't pay it, someone else at your table will have to". Also, it probably shouldn't be called 'service' charge when clearly there wasn't any proper service.
The place has such potential, but I won't be going back any time soon and wouldn't recommend it.

results.name: Molton House
results.address: 43 South Molton Street, London W1K 5RS, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Give this one a miss!! We went here on a whim as my friend had a taste-card(half price) and it was near by the oxford street shops. The interior decoration of this place is just plain bizarre! Everywhere was dimly lit with padded walls and incredibly kitsch snake skin furniture. The strangest was a display of feathered lamp shades hanging from the centre of the ceiling illuminated by bright blue lights.... why?! The strangely patterned wall paper on the stairs and odd perfume smell that lingered everywhere (over powering smell put me of my food) gave the place a brothel-esque vibe!
I could have forgiven all of this if the food was good, however it was a disappointment. The sea bass was nice I will give them that, the lamb was bland and on top of stringy spinach with an odd taste. It was also accompanied by a limp looking dried out salad that would have looked sad in a bargain sandwich bought in a petrol station at 3am. For these kind of prices this should be fine dining and it was a LONG way from what I consider fine dining!
The worst offence though was the waiter pulling a fast one on us with the wine. We ordered a £30 bottle of pinot grigio, he then brought a bottle of pinot grigio to the table saying "I should tell you we have a much better wine than the one you have chosen it is a little more expensive" and we said "No thank you we would like the wine we ordered" he replied "you want this one?" making no indication it was actualy the more expencive one and we said "yes". The bill came and the wine was £38. We complained and he said, "I told you the wine was more!" -How deceptive and underhanded! We resentfully paid not wanting a fuss and both left feeling cheated and angry. Thank god we were only paying half price! The full bill was arond £120. If I had been forced to pay that for this experiance I would have cried myself to sleep! I'm certainly not going back and I advise you miss it out unless your curiosity to see colourfully lit lampshade displays over-powers you.

Tried eating there for lunch two weeks ago. Ordered Caesar Salad, hoping it will be commensurate with the price and interior décor. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed. The salad leaves were old, some where yellow or even worse, similar to when you leave it in your fridge for a while :) Chicken had bones and ligaments in it! :) 
If you like the extremes, that's the place to check out! :) 
When I've mentioned that to the waitress, she politely conveyed the message to the cook, however that was the extent of her assistance. 
Overall looks like a fairly small place.

I can't comment on the food, atmosphere or value, but the service seems pretty poor, having tried for several hours to make a booking and no one answers the phone or replies to an email. Clearly you have to present yourself at the door to book, which seems a bit backwards.

results.name: Hilton London Heathrow Airport Terminal 5
results.address: Poyle Road, Colnbrook SL3 0FF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Misleading advertisement, at best.

No pool. (Hydrothermal pool forbidden to kids)
Not actually in terminal 5. Expensive shuttle at infrequent times.

We had booked on British Airways recommendation, based on the airport being in-terminal and having a pool. It had neither and the response to complaints, from the hotel staff, was cold.
Too far away, expensive taxis. Nice new hotel, but nothing there to do, boring even for an airport hotel.

Hilton Terminal 5 is the most comfortable, clean and newly build hotel at the Heathrow Airport. The furnishings and decor, both in public areas and bedrooms, are refined. Unexplainable is that the hotel is under the runway at Heathrow airport, no more than a mile or so from Terminal 5, and yet, you cannot hear the planes at all. Another amazing thing about the hotel is that small but very lovely spa with its super treatment area, pool, sauna, steam room and mud chamber.

I didn't expect how nice this hotel would be, as I had assumed that all airport hotels had to be hideous. My room was well decorated and well insulated against passing aircraft. It was outstanding that despite being directly in line with one of the runways, you cannot hear anything. Another thing that impressed me a lot and it was a pleasant surprise to me was the wireless internet throughout. This was welcomed, as my trip was for business and constant connection to the Internet was my urgent. I wasn't charged extra for something found free virtually everywhere and it was wonderful.

My husband discovered free 30 minute parking in the Hilton parking lot at Heathrow - we unloaded our international luggage, and I stayed for a last English pot of tea with my one year old - taking advantage of the Costa Coffee counter in the beautiful lobby - while my husband returned our rental car via shuttles and such.

Server Joanna made my day with excellent service and attention.
About to take an international flight with a one year old, she not only brought my pot of tea but some biscuits and a cup for my kid to play with. Another hotel manager hooked him up with some wheatabix, which he devoured.

Once my husband had returned the car, we then took a walk with our luggage through the tunnel connecting the hotel to airport terminal 5 to go through airport security for our overnight flight. Next time I will get a cart before going through the tunnel!! 

All in all, I could not have asked for a nicer way to end our UK vacation than to sit for an hour in their light, airy lobby with a spot of tea and kind waitstaff. Thank you Hilton for that gift. I will remember it.

results.name: Juno
results.address: 134 - 135 Shoreditch High St, London E1 6JE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Decent happy hour, great social space, friendly and informed bar staff. Juno has it covered. The kitchen has just has a make over and though I didn't eat the food rolling out looked top notch and browsing the menu I will be back to sample some of the items. Location is good and a great place to meet for a few drinks or a night out. Caters for both at different times of the evening. Also hosts art on the walls for sale from various artists. Well worth a visit.

A great place to have some drink with friends on a Sunday afternoon ... Nice atmosphere and some good offers on the cocktails. 
When I visited this pub a DJ was playing some chill out music, I don't know if they do this regularly, but was a very nice surprise to me. 

To resume, this is a nice local pub that I highly recommend to visit with some friends or even to celebrate a birthday.
Pretty relaxed. Decent cocktails. Comfy sofas. Not sure what what more I'm asking for from a Liverpool St joint on a Saturday afternoon!

I enjoy the street art on the walls here and the vibe is pretty good.
The music was mostly good on the Friday night I went, but had a few curve balls thrown in there.

Downstairs there was an event of some kind setting up. Upstairs we could have all done without the feedback that they produced when setting up.

Good venue for Friday night drinks and if you get there early Friday night food too. It's only a small place.

In the cool area of Shoreditch. 

Good priced drinks especially the offers. 

They do good snack food, just what you need when afterwork drinks has turned into more. 

The toilets could be nicer but I got a free Britney perfume so can't complain. A good stop off in a bar crawl.

results.name: Lockside Lounge
results.address: 75-89 Upper Walkway, Camden Lock Place, London NW1 8AF, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Just showing some love to Lockside lounge and the "Dem Dayz" crew. It gets packed, the atmosphere is electric and the DJ plays great tunes all night. Highly recommended.

Fantastic little bar in the heart of camden, great food and cocktails, there's one night in particular called Dem Dayz which is fantastic and plays tune after tune after tune, impossible not to have a great night! Highly recommended!
Best bar in North London. Great food in the day, great for after work drinks and amazing dj's on weekends

A good drinking option in Camden if you want to be near the canal. There is a long terrace overlooking the market below, as well as plenty of seating inside too. Food better than average for this kind of bar. Never had a problem with the staff. They do have some crazy nights here though, for example - drag burlesque springs to mind.
Amazing venue! Great service and a great vibe! A good place in Camden to socialise. Staff are really helpful and the drinks are a delight! Very impressed!

results.name: Karaoke Box Smithfield
results.address: 12 Smithfield Street, London EC1A 9LA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I loved it. We went there for a birthday party and it was awesome. The drinks are cheap and they have an endless list of songs to sing. Very friendly staff!

The best karaoke bar in town! There were many songs to choose from, the mic was professional and the sound was very good. The scene and the setting were pleasant and comfortable. I really liked that place and will go again.

Would give it 0 stars if I could. I know kareoke places are pricy but when you get totally ignored by the staff! One of bar ladys was told by a collegue to serve me so she shrugged laughed and walked off!! Couldn't believe it!

I came here with a group of work colleagues soon after this venue was relaunched and I must say that I'm very impressed! Unlike most karaoke venues, which tend to be a bit grotty, this is a modern and spacious cocktail bar, surrounded by private and very modern karaoke rooms with flatscreen TVs, leather sofas etc. When we couldn't bear the idea of stopping singing, we were able to call our (very friendly) waitress with the push of a button!

We drank cocktails with a Japanese twist - mine was called 'Blushing Geisha's Kiss! and I was also pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food there, which I had not even realised they sold. My stone-baked pizza was really yummy, as was the tempura and sake that my Japanese friend convinced me to try - it certainly added to the experience. When she spoke to the staff, they told her that there were over 30,000 Japanese songs available as well as the thousands of songs in English. I'd go back there in a heartbeat!

Overly expensive with rude and unhelpful staff. 

The speakers in the booth were distorting and couldn't handle any bass, making all but the quietly song bearable. 

If this wasn't enough I felt very unwell and had to leave early. Feeling unwell and being a non-drinker I bought some water from them to take with me but they wouldn't let me leave without it, snatching it from me aggressively despite me saying it was only water. 

I would definitely not recommend this place!

results.name: Arcadia
results.address: 51-53 Southwark Street, London SE1 1RU, United Kingdom

results.name: Reflex
results.address: 17 Watling Street, London EC4M 9BB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
“Some-times …I feel I have to… (boom boom)… get away…” Softcell can predict how you will feel about this late night club. Reflex is a tacky hole in the wall and you will either love it or hate it because of this fact. Tucked away in the City it seems a little out of place but for a bar that’s stuck in a time warp I suppose any place is as good as another. 

Walking downstairs the neon and 80’s paraphernalia hits you right away and they do do their best to retain all of the 80’s glory. The patrons are a wide mix of ages, you are just as likely to be crooning ‘don’t stop believing’ next to an 18 year old who only knows the Glee version as a 50 year old who looks a bit bewildered to be out at 2am. This mix makes for a very interesting night! 

All in all if you want to croon away to 80’s tracks and wear trainers into a club – this is probably the best and only place to do it. My only complaints are : The cocktails are disgusting. They are really, really not good. Stick to mixers or wine! 

You may call me a purist… but I’m not the only one… because why in an 80’s bar does the DJ play music from the 70’s and 90’s? There is such a wealth of music from that decade, why do you need to dip into others? If you have a theme, stick to it! 

For a tack-tastic night out – Reflex is going to be your jam. However, please make note there is next to no signal in the club so if you want to pre-book a taxi you will have to go outside before you intend to leave and then come back up. The taxi people outside will absolutely rip your off so pre-book and save your pennies.

Good 80s music, but that's where it ends.
I guess what made this so terrible was the atmosphere, the people who come here aren't interested in the 80s atmosphere, music or anything else, mostly just drunk wallies.

I had no problem with the bouncers, or the airport style security check whilst entering, they were just fine. But I generally see it as a bad sign when a venue has to have five beefy bouncers patrol the place looking out for fights and drugs.

There must be better places in London for the real 80s enthusiasts.

Got escorted out last night because as I had just be dancing to a Jackson medley of 80s classics, the bouncer deemed I was drunk as I seeked a breather from the bar. Apart from that, a good bar that is a lot of fun if you go with a good group of people! No specials on drinks which was disappointing
Was there last week. Okay night although I wondered what 80s the DJ was remembering....no MJ?? Please STOP cleaning the dance-floor when people are dancing and get rid of that mop. It stinks!!
Well what can I say... There just aren't enough of these places about! Been twice now and had a great night both times. Outstanding!

results.name: Zebrano Bars
results.address: 14-16 Ganton Street, London W1F 7BT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I popped in after work for a quick drink. Never again. With the selection Soho has and Kingsly Court nextdoor dont bother. Place was not busy but the service was muddled and the bartender had (literally) no idea what she was doing. I asked for a cosmo and directed her through the ingredients. Not only that but didnt even get a smile for the effort.Never again

Zebrano's was just what we were looking for! Great location (just off Carnaby Street), outside seating, lovely atmosphere, but most importantly exceptionally friendly and professional service and especially good food. Zebrano's also provided a wide selection of drinks and were more than accommodating amending their menu to cater for our personal taste.

Also have to say that Nathaniel who looked after us was exceptional. Thanks Zebrano.

Dom the Owner was superb as was both his bars. 5 of us had been to a formal Awards evening at the Hilton Park lane and we fancied something a little less formal although we were dressed in our bibs and tuckers.
We thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and the hospitality of the staff through to closing time which did seem to rush up on us even though it was 0300hrs.
Dietmar
Friendly waiters, splendid food and atmosphere, lovely music will definitely be back!

I like the music and the style of this club in Ganton street (Carnaby area). I've been there for a cocktail after work, then again during some language exchange events (that are hold on Wednesdays with happy hour until 10pm) and then again clubbing. Really enjoyed this place! At the ground floor you can have lunch or dinner, prices are not too friendly though.

results.name: SamarQand Restaurant and Bar
results.address: 18 Thayer Street, London W1U 3JY, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Amazing ! I had a blessed time here with all my best friends

We decided to celebrate a birthday of my boyfriend at Samarqand. We called and asked if they can accommodate a large group of 20 ppl. They confirmed they can. However, when we arrived we were assigned one waiter who was not quite experienced to host a large group. He arrived numerous times with drinks and did not remember the name of them and had to come back and forth from the bar to us to remember the name of the drinks. As for the food, the big disappointment was timing. Half of the orders arrived 30-40 min late! Half of the crowd was eating and the other half was waiting. It is unacceptable. And no one had any extra requests regarding their orders, very straight forward, and still the orders were mixed up! We had to chase the waiter and ask him several times to bring in the cake (that we brought to the restaurant). Again with a big delay, the cake arrived. When our guests asked for tea, they were served dirty cups which we had to return to the kitchen and ask to clean. 
Overall. customer service was very poor, we would say it was absent. We were quite disappointed with the way the guests are treated here taking into consideration the restaurant was notified 1 week in advance about a large group of people for the night. Unprofessional staff.
Food and drinks were good, compliments to the chef and bartender. 
Interior was very nice.

I went to Samarqand with two of my friends and we all agreed that the service was amazing. Waitress was lovely and attentive and no one rushed us out offering desert menu or the bill. The food was very good however I am not a fan of lamb. Portions are quite small for the price but it's worth it. 
Samarqand is a nice place to catch up with friends. Will definitely come back.
delicious food excellent

Tatsy cusine, great fun, and importantly helpful service. The asian cuisine has been finely executed, there is soo much to do in their private rooms, play games on their Playstation, or karaoke. Would definitely visit again, great bang for your buck.

results.name: blagclub Notting Hill Gate
results.address: 68 Notting Hill Gate, London W11 3HT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I was looking for a venue to hire for my 30th birthday which was chilled out and cosy with a nice atmosphere, a bit like inviting friends round for cocktails but with your very own barman, DJ and security man - and in an easy-to-get-to central location. And that's exactly what I got! Everybody there, especially Per and Dan, were extremely friendly and helpful with requirements such as mics and stands, which put my mind at ease leading up to the night. All my guests had a great night in a relaxed atmosphere. And the margaritas are amazing. Thanks for helping to make my 30th go with a bang!
We had such a great time! The place is great, the staff is great, we'll be back!

results.name: Simmons Bar | King's Cross
results.address: 32 Caledonian Road, London N1 9DT, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Building looked great interesting decor and had a great atmosphere. However huge let down went there for a birthday we booked the table for 20...three small tables with about 7 chairs provided...not what was requested... staff said we would have been warned about not having all the chairs but we were not warned and who reserves a table for 20 people and only expects 7 chairs! Not happy!

Tiny cocktail bar that becomes impossible to move in as the evening draws on. The cocktails are tasty but pricey- served in teapots and cups and saucers etc. The decor is that of a vintage lounge, with some entertaining wallpaper and mismatched chairs. Loud music and babble makes it difficult to have a conversation.

Simmons, run by duo Elliot and Nick, is the late night affordable drinking spot to go to when in Kings Cross. Open till 3am on Fridays and Saturdays, in addition to sociable opening hours, it’s the quirky retro furniture, including Elliot’s favourite ice-cream chandelier and school desks, together with classic cocktails that make this place special...

Head over to the Twenty Something London website to read more about Simmons, and a host of other incredible independent businesses across London, and start falling in love with a London we don't want to lose...!!

Vibrant, buzzing place for a cocktail after work. It features a vintage decor with interesting details, mismatched chairs and a kind of bric-a-brac feel throughout you'd see in the backyard of an Americana memorabilia collector. But it's interesting and cocktails are delicious.
Great bar. Located just around the corner from Kings Cross. Excellent value during happy hour. Buzzing on Friday and Saturday.

results.name: Archangel
results.address: 13 Kensington High Street, London W8 5NP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: I came here for a friend's 22nd birthday and I must say I was pleasantly surprised by how informal (in a good way) the bar is, given that it is based in an area which is dominated by expensive and exclusive night clubs. The drinks were well priced and it didn't cost anything to get in. Moreover, with the dance area being based downstairs it means that if you don't want to dance you don't have to! You can therefore get the best of both worlds, with a relaxed bar upstairs and a dj downstairs.

service and food - terrible, possible the worst place i've ever eaten. My despite how quite the place was it took an hour and a half for our food to arrive (one persons food never actually came). A friend of mine ordered the hot club sandwich, which arrive with no bacon. After informing the waitress and giving her back a sandwich, a small bowl of bacon (with out a sandwich) was brought to the table. When he asked for an actually sandwich his previous and now cold bacon-less sandwich was returned to him. Whilst he was eating the 2nd half of his cold sandwich he found a large hair. When he complained, he was told that as he had eaten most of it when he found the hair, he still had to pay. No manager was available to speak to about this shambles. " others ordered a cheese burger, which arrive with no cheese. This was then taken back and returned with cheese, however the actually burger and chips were very cold at this point. No compensation was offered what-so-ever and very little apology was offered. Terrible.

If you're short for time NEVER go here for lunch. We waited 1H 30mins for a burger, thats right a burger!! 
To make it worse they added a 12.5% service charge for late cold food.

just ordered a club sandwich waited an hour for it to turn up sans bacon so sent it back, they took my sandwich back to the kitchen but sent up 2 pieces of bacon for me to add to my own (now cold) sandwich. i then found a hair as i was finishing the sandwich... staff were not helpful at all and said all they could do was let me have a free (flat) diet coke.
Pub con un ambiente inolvidable ,camareros súper majos .... Perfecto para cumpleaños y fiestas con amigos .

results.name: PRYZM
results.address: 154-156 Clarence Street, Kingston upon Thames KT1 1QP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A joke of a club. £9 entry, waited a over 20 mins at a bar to be told they didn't have any cups... House room is only for over 21s. One of the rooms has decent songs and good lighting but the other plays soul destroying songs. Worst of all the whole place smelt vaguely like a sewer/eggs.

From these reviews I doubt I'll ever be visiting any of these places up Kingston. Without talking too much, people we have the power to stop all these bad experiences and reception at these venues. Without our MONEY, these places will eventually shut down or management changed. I've seen that process happen time and time again. Club's owned by a foreigner and manager's under pressure to make money by all means else! Or a group of DONS run these venues so whether it's that Barcadia or Oceana the money still goes to the same person.

We are the FANS and without US there's NO, I repeat, no SALES. You worship all these footballers who don't give a **** about you and yet! Who's made them rich?! YOU!!! Let's raise people's awareness, students should be informed, as well as people who throw money around. Let's start a Facebook campaign, add your friends and tell them not to go to that club, bar or restaurant. Who wants to go out with mates and get beaten up by illiterates? I can't imagine being smashed up by thugs in front of my GF or sister!!!!! Or disrespected in front of my friends or colleagues by someone who's feeling inferior ushering me into their workplace. Let's not sit around until it happens to you before you DO something. It's our money we spend. Thanks.

I was there for a club night with my work mates, and it was an excellent night all round!

There were different floors/rooms for different music, and it was all good music. The atmosphere was great as well, with friendly staff and friendly people as well.

Once upon a time, this place used to be good. But now it isnt. The carpet is forever sticky, the drinks are quite expensive now and the music is just so generic. Save your money and go elsewhere if you have the chance to!
Loved it

results.name: Blueberry Bar
results.address: 2-4 Paul Street, London, Shoreditch EC2A 4JH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: We were playing ping pong and the ball bounced behind the bar. I went to get it - it would have been fair enough if the guy had asked me politely not to go behind the bar. But he pretty much yelled at and treated me like shit. When he overheard me complaining about this he called me over to have a go and insisted he was being 'stern' rather than rude (as if I were a six year old), and threatened to kick me out. I think it was the manager, which is a shame because his staff and the general get-up was fine.

Blueberry bar is a cracking good place for food, drinks and so much more. Hosting a variety of events and nights from open-mic one of the best I've ever been to in London, with a really chilled out vibe, electro swing nights and a whole host of different things going on. Friendly Staff

Was here for a team night out recently. An area had been reserved for us along with a table tennis table. We had a beer pong tournament (great fun!) and lots of drinks to go with it. The place itself is well located in the city and was extremely busy for a Thursday night. It has several table tennis tables which sets it apart from normal bars. Didn't try any food here so can't comment on that (we opted for a nearby fish and chip shop instead). Not a bad place to chill out after work with colleagues.

To be fair, the staff here have been wonderful, however a terribly generic selection of beers (lager or lager), a blaring soundsystem trying to out compete the people yelling to make themselves heard, bland food and utterly vulgar advertising screens in the bathroom (captive audience indeed) make this a place I'll be glad never to go into again!

The pictures on the website are a little bit misleading/clever as it's a little bit rough around the edges which the pics don't really show. Aside from that the food is pretty average and reasonably priced. Looks like a lot of people go here just for beer-pong with their mates - not sure if you have to book the tables, but i'd imagine so! The staff were very friendly and chatty...

results.name: The Renaissance Rooms
results.address: Miles Street, London SW8 1RZ, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Ok, on the one side, rollerskating is fun and this place COULD (one day under new management) be quite cool. BUT... 6 friends and I went there on Saturday night, we got in at 12:40, expecting to rollerskate for about one hour. We had booked tickets (actually 9 tickets as two friends couldn't make it - I thought I could negotiate something here but it became quite clear quite early that this place is not in the client business). We had the most exasperating experience ever. Turns out, you can't come for a bit of skating you have already paid for if you arrive after 12.15... What?!
Yes - because you see, that's a burden on the people working there (no, I mean really NO other reason) :There was about 30 ppl in there, and 15 of them were staff. Pretty much all of them were patronizing.
1/ the guy at the door was unimpressed and patronizing, also talked to me like I was insane showing up at such a late hour on a Saturday night (the doors open at 8pm but I wouldn't stay more than an hour anyway, gets a bit repetitive, so yeah, I must be totally out of my mind thinking I can just come in for an hour of rollerskating more than an hour prior to you closing)
2/ the bouncer asked for my passport to check which country I was from, which I showed to him on the cover, to which he said..."that not really telling me anything", and proceeded to analyse all my visas. Now I'm sure my being in Cambodia this year is totally relevant my amazingness on skates - so fair enough, it's so much fun to play immigration at a bar.
2/ the manager, who I talked to to try and get us in had such a busy night (HAHAHA) that he waved at the guy to let us in, which they all questioned once he was gone - it took us 10 min waiting to get in from that point - there was 7 staff looking at us and no clients.
3/ I had to talk to 5 people to let us in and got a lot of shit from the girl at the coat check because she had to go find coins to reimburse me 1 pound (out of the 10 I had just given her for all of our coats, all at once... i don't know how to be helpful anymore)
4/ the bar was closed
5/ You've wronged the floor by kissing it... If you fall (which you can do, if you're not good at roller skating, the good news is someone will be here within 0.5 seconds... but will look at you like you just committed a criminal offense (to be clear - none of us were drunk - I just fell like 3 times because I'm not good on skates)
6/ the hand-piece equipment was sweaty and stinky (like, seriously)
7/ They treat you like children : you can't stop on the side for more that 1 second - that's fair enough, and makes sense... but you also get told off like a child for leaning your ass on the side of the table while watching other people skate "because do you sit on the table at home"? - I sh. you not. We're all over 30.

So all in all, if you wan't to skate, try your hardest to find somewhere else to go

Roller Disco Club with a 70s vibe and lots of pink. Good place for a night fun out with friends. Laughters are guaranteed. They have two different areas, one for the "professional" skaters and one that is more designed for beginners. Also, there is always a hand to help if you fall (which will happen most likely). However staff was not as helpful as I had expected with beginners, especially outside the rolling areas. The lounge area is also quite nice and a good place to enjoy a drink while you get the view from the rollerblading rink.

As a child, I went to a roller disco every week. Fast forward 20 years and the thought of roller skating is a bit more daunting. However, I went with it, went along to a roller disco and had an absolute ball! Within moment of being on the skates, memory kicked in and I was off! An excellent venue, with two different areas playing a variety of music, helpful staff on hand to pick you up you fall over, and lots and lots of laughter. I can't recommend it enough.

Whether you’re a hardcore skater or want some fun clubbing on wheels rather than feet, the folks at Roller Disco in Vauxhall have got something special to offer. A quirky and alternative suggestion for an off-the-beaten-track group night out. It’s got two big skating rooms; the back plays familiar hip-hop and RnB while the front is home to 60s, 70s, 80s and 90s classics...

Read more about The Renaissance Rooms and venture further into London's quirky independent businesses on Twenty Something London's website!

Amazing venue. Definately hooked! The coolest dig for skating kats!
Can't wait to go again! Only downside were the staff working behind the skate rental section - no assertion or smile and seemed fed up.

But other than that, don't let that put you off cause it only takes two seconds to pick up your skates...it's nice and cheap...on fridays it's from 8pm-2am. The professionals are hypnotising to watch and the drinks are competitively priced.
Everybody's laughing and dancing away. What more could you want?

Just GO! (You know you want to!)

results.name: Eight Moorgate
results.address: 1 Dysart Street, London EC2A 2BX, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
Very nice private club on the very top of the building. There are multiple terraces and private rooms available or one can simply stay in the bar area. 
Good selection of cocktails and wines. Tasty food menu and great atmosphere.
Private club. Take the elevator in the courtyard to the 8th floor.

results.name: New Bloomsbury Set
results.address: 76 Marchmont Street, London WC1N 1AG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Friendly atmosphere, great staff and service. Brilliant cocktails as well - good for after work drinks.

Very cosy bar, some weekday evenings its quiet which I prefer to when it is busy and it can be hard to find space to stand with your drink and being an enclosed room it can be hard to hear. Fantastic cocktails at decent prices and the staff are all extremely friendly!
Very friendly atmosphere and super cosy. It can get busy, but in a nice way : )

I came to this bar for the first time last Sunday, for the Jonathan Kemp book launch, I was expecting a fabulous experience going off the reviews on its facebook page. On arriving at the venue I was impressed with the surroundings, with the pleasant decor with a layout ideal for an intimate drinks with friends. However....we duly waited at the bar to be served, and waited some more, out of the three bar staff behind the bar two were chatting with themselves admiring their mid drifts and the other one was nattering with two pals at the end of the bar. After five minutes of standing right in front of the two who were admiring themselves, myself and three friends left the premises and had a wonderful evening in the Lord John Russell around the corner, who served drinks promptly, efficiently and with a smile.

May I suggest that this bar trains the bar staff to actually serve drinks or remove the cloak of invisibility device that has been installed and stops them carrying out their job role.
Lovely bar staff, great atmosphere, and very friendly place. Live music the first Monday of the month from two wonderful singers. Highly recommended.

results.name: Jalouse
results.address: 17 Hanover Square, London W1S 1HU, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Omg what a dump! Went there for a Christmas gathering. Looks like your inside a huge massive cheese grater or a set piece from A Clive Barker horror film. Once the public descend in, not a good atmosphere, really rude sexist men, random men trying to make girls take a drink. Awful. Truely awful. Trampy. Broken toilets, no doors lock, some loo seats missing. Dark, dingy, dump. They should go look at DSTRKT to see how a club should be decorated.

I love fancy and high-end clubs, so Jalouse was a very natural choice for me, giving the fact of its fame for it being visited by upper-class crowd and good tracks. I am lucky to have a friend, who is a member there and therefore, it was easy for us to be admitted in. I heard so much before about the crystal ceiling and was quite excited to see it in person, as I still found it for enchanting. The music was diverse and the crowd was really cool, so I did have a blast and will definitely come back.

Long wait to get in, extremely unfriendly, even hostile staff, very poor layout for the night they had on (admittedly not the venue's but the organiser's fault) but still added to the bad feel of the evening, extortionately priced drinks (£8+ for a beer), and in general one of the most exploitative, unpleasant, up-itself venues I have been to in London. Dreadful.
very posh place to be..!! drinks quite expensive but worth the experience nice music for house music lovers on a saturday..!! strictly guest lists but a must visit night clubs in london

My only advice would be STAY AWAY!!
RUDE STAFF, BAD ATMOSPHERE.
We was told to arrive at 10pm for my sisters birthday where we then had to wait till opening at 11pm (even though they didn't actually open till around 11:30) The bouncers were extremely rude and practically making up the prices on the door. We had pre-booked a table inside and was told that once we payed in that we would have free drinks on our table. Once inside I had realised that for no reason what so ever they had not let half my group of friends in and that we didn't actually have a table! It was empty inside and had a bad, unwelcoming atmosphere. When going back upstairs to enquire about our table the lady behind the paying desk was stabbing me with her finger aggressivly to move back down the stairs, and called for a bouncer to throw me out when I tried to explain about our problem. We then left after being inside the club for about half an hour. Wish I had read other reviews before going as they seem to say the same thing. Ruined our night, waste of money and worst club I have ever experienced.

results.name: The Old School Yard
results.address: 109-111 Long Lane, London SE1 4PH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
After coming here for a birthday party and loving it we returned two more times in as many months- really good fun. However when a gift bag of birthday presents vanished from our table, i asked darren (the owner) whether it had been handed in- his sarcastic response 'well let me turn the music off and kick everyone out for your bag'- was unhelpful considering as a group of 20 we had spent hundreds on the bar. When I told him this, he took me outside and said 'i will help you look for it, even though you're being a bitch'. My boyfriend and random people who had witnessed the conversation were disgusted by him, and he soon ran away when these people confronted him. His own staff couldn't have been more apologetic and embarrassed.

 He was unapologetic- until he discovered my boyfriend's occupation could cause trouble for him- at this point he apologised and booked and paid for our taxi. I would never go back here- that guy is clearly not coping, and it put a really bitter end to the night. The bag also mysteriously reappeared as we were on our way out- despite everyone (including darren) having looked for it. Staff also mentioned that there is increasing trouble there. AVOID !!
As cheesy as they come. 241 cocktails. Spice girls on the stereo. Drunk after-work people from all around the area. Graffitti'd school lockers. Karaoke downstairs. Wow.

off the beaten track but great cocktails that were value for money.
bonus: old school video games

This place is easy to get to, literary a 5 minute walk from borough tube.

Eclectically decorated upstairs with some easy seating couches, video game booth and a obsession over green skinned pop culture characters over the bar ( i spotted Yoda, Hulk and Teenage Mutant Ninja turtles, what no Kermit or Godzilla?!?) Bar staff friendly and easy going.

Its deceptive though, kinda reminded me of scenes from two movies.That scene in Goodfellas where Henry Hill walks in straight through the back to get a seat? Yeah, to get downstairs you gotta be in the know. The second movie? That scene in the Cabin in the woods where they step into basement, inadvertently choosing their method of execution via the Aladdin's cave of weird stuff. Totally full of weird and wonderful stuff.

Some great karaoke booths ( although bizarrely the song list pick sheet is all titles and no artists!) spacious, if you come along in a group, you're bound to pick up the mic and have a great time!

Amazing cocktails, a ninja turtle arcade game, and karaoke in a secret basement room... what more could you ask for?? This is a great spot with a really fun, energetic environment, that is perfect for after work drinks with friends.

They apparently do amazing burgers, but were more than happy to accommodate for Veggies/vegans, and put together a special Vegan dinner platter for me - something quite rare in London.

If you are SE1 definitely check out this bar!

results.name: Yates's
results.address: 87–89 South St, Romford, Essex RM1 1PA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Not to bad , pub/bar during day and club at night. Great place

Very bad service. The cheeseburger is so bland and the buns were burned.
Red wine was of a mediocre taste, served in plastic glasses.

This was my first visit to a Yate's, also the last
Slow bar service unless your wearing next to nothing! the staff are not very friendly and the type of people that are attracted to this place aren't those you would want to be near
Absolutly useless. Service was rubbish. Took 45 minutes for a salad to come out and they even got that wrong. Our meals came out 10 minutes apart. I would never eat at a Yates again.
Toilets are really smelly and always broke (no toilet seat)

results.name: Gem Bar
results.address: 10 Beak St, Soho, London W1F 9RA, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Never go to this place if your lucky enough to read this e mail which I hope you are before you go ! door staff are extremely aggressive and I think are part of a bigger criminal organization! I was very lucky not to have got involved and just had a quick one and left while I could! I over herd the door staff talking about taking peoples address's of there system then following them later or turning up at there house to extract money!!!! Very dangerous People working there !!! please please watch out and be very careful where you go!!! this is new and poping up all over london !!! the moment you get any crap from any door man on a door before you went it or before you have done anything wrong please leave !!! and avoid the place dont risk your life with these cowards an bullies !!! also do not scan your ID at anytime on any system !!!! they can look at it dont let them make copies of your ID !!!!!!!!!

You'll be greeted by officious door staff who clearly skipped lessons at charm school. I got the distinct impression that they only care about counting the pound notes. Places like this belong in regional town centres not Soho. It goes without saying that I won't be returning.
It was quite nice in there, the people are different, the people who visits are different. it is a multicultural place which is very nice, socialising atmosphere.

If mass ordering sugary sweet cocktails during heaving happy hour is your thing after work - this is your mecca. Good location but all screams early twentys with LARGE glasses of Rose to me. Not my cup of tea. Food is served - all deep fried, pre cooked, bought in fodder. Great to line your stomach before purchasing another bottle of wine. There are FAR classer joints just over in Soho. Personal preference but I wont be visiting again.

Ended up drinking here on my birthday, after a comedy night in the downstairs bar. Really enjoyed the comedy (new material night) as was very intimate. We then came upstairs for a few drinks, and had a good time. The DJ provided party and pop tunes from across the last 3 decades or so - some classic tunes in there and he generally pitched it just right.

Whilst it was midweek and therefore relatively quiet, (I imagine it would be heavin gon a friday/saturday night), the place still had a good atmosphere. My one detraction was the bar staff were incredibly slow and inefficient. Even when staff were not serving others they took an age to get to you, preferring instead to finish wiping a table or rearranging some bottles. When you did get served there was a distinct disinterest in you, at one point the barman just disappeared out back without a word immediately after I ordered. I ended up ordering again from one of the other staff, and just after they had sorted most of the drinks the first barman reappeared clutching a wine glass wihtout any word of explanation. (How they manage to run out of glasses when it was that quiet I don't know!)

Anyway, drinks and music was OK but service was shocking. Prices were expensive, but no more so then you'd expect for a late license venue in this part of london. I won't be returning for a random drink at any point, but should there be an event here (e.g. birthday) then I wouldn't mind!

results.name: Lucky Voice
results.address: 173-174 Upper Street, London N1 1RG, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: Lucky Voice is probably the best place to go to if you like karaoke. It has a great selection of songs and a range of rooms to gather to groups of various sizes. One of the best features of LV is that you can go online and compile your own playlist so that you don't have to waste time going through the song catalogue after arriving at the lounge. They also stock goofy props in each room (wigs, hats, inflatable instruments) so you can really get into the spirit of karaoke. That being said, I do find Lucky Voice on the expensive side if you don't manage to book in advance.
Great but a bit expensive
Friendly staff, great rooms, fantastic song selection, good deals (especially if you're a local) - absolutely love it and would be there all the time if I could.

As the name implies its a Karaoke bar with Pizzas and some really nice cocktails. You are given a private room to you and your friends, about ten pounds for the entry. Perfect for the ones who love to show off their voce after a couple of drinks. You can have pizzas but outside your private room only! They also give some really cool props you can show off and get pictures with after a few drinks :)
