I've always liked Lucky Voice and they do great money-off offers and promotions but it's not as great as it used to be. A recent trip was extremely, extremely pricey and the crowd's gone from being cool to ever so slightly hen party

results.address: 34 Grosvenor Square, London W1K 2HD, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: What a disappointment! We came to this restaurant to celebrate my birthday and the food was terrible!! How can a Mayfair restaurant get a steak/frites so wrong? The meat was so salty it was inedible and had to be sent back. What a disappointment I would never go back.

Very good food. Rather old crowd. Distinctly disappointing service, given the cost of the place and the quality of the food. They forgot a side dish for one of the people in our party. He asked about it, the server said he'd look into it, and...no follow up at all. I can think of many better places drop £100 on a meal.

When a restaurant is rated second on a top 5 list, you expect it to be good. So I went to 34 in Mayfair with high hopes, after reading The Cow Council Top 5 at http://www.thecowclubcouncil.com/#!the-top-5/c3nb. The review on their website http://www.thecowclubcouncil.com/#!34/c1rff read promising, and I thought when even Jay Rayner liked it (http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2012/jan/01/jay-rayner-restaurant-review-34), what could go wrong? 

To cut it short, nothing did go wrong. But let's go through this pleasant evening in more detail. 34 is located in Mayfair, so you have to expect Mayfair prices - an evening at 34 is not a big night out on a tiny budget. I think the restaurant has a very classy atmosphere, there are some nice and some interesting paintings on the walls and a live piano player entertains the diners with some fine tunes. Thoroughly enjoyable.

Thanks to a recent wine tasting with Convivium Wine (http://conviviumwine.com/) hosted by Google+ Local London (https://plus.google.com/+GoogleLocalLondon), I discovered a new white wine that I really liked. And when I spotted an Albariño on the fine wine menu, I knew that I had to taste this one. If you don't know about Albariño, you can read about it on the WineTubeMap at http://conviviumwine.com/wine-tube-map/station/albarino - a very nice tool to explore new wines. So I asked for the Albariño and it tasted delicious. A fresh and crisp wine, just perfect. But I have to say, it was not the cheapest wine on the menu - yet again, this is Mayfair.

Now to the food, I was very happy to get a sample of about four different kinds of bread to begin with, and all tasted good. I decided to get a proper starter and ordered the fried duck egg with chorizo and watercress. What a delightful plate of food! The main was equally great, a tender and soft steak that melted in my mouth and really was worth it. 

Besides the food, the service also was a treat. The staff were very friendly and nice and simply provided a decent service. When I came in, some were joking behind the counter, and while a few people might find that unacceptable at such a serious restaurant, I found it welcoming to see that they are just people like me who want to enjoy themselves on the job. Maybe I had the best waiter in the world, I really liked him. Perhaps because he said that I selected his favourites, and he might say that to every single guest to make them feel good, after all that's what he's being paid for, but for some reason I believed him. 

When I walked out, I noticed the open kitchen - another nice feature of this place. 

While everything at 34 is on the expensive side, I personally think that food, wine and service is almost as good is it could get, and for such an extraordinary dining experience, I am happy to pay a bit more. You can feel pretty poor when leaving the venue without asking for a cab or jumping right into your Rolls-Royce or Mercedes SLS just in front of the restaurant or one of the Porsches or Landrovers parked all over the streets around 34. But then, I'd rather drink another glass of wine and take the bus, than getting a cab home for the same price.

If you like a good steak or good food in general and value impeccable service, I cannot recommend 34 highly enough.

Excellent food but there is one big problem with your address. 
Can you change the address in google map becouse it sayd grosvenor square which is not, the enterence is in south audley street

For their first new restaurant opening (in the UK at least) in six years, Caprice Holdings have sensibly stuck to their tried-and-tested formula of unfussy, unpretentious but interesting food, at reassuringly expensive but fair prices, in blandly comfortable surroundings with excellent service. Front of house is expertly led by all-girl dream team & Caprice stalwarts Gina Glennon and Laura Montana

results.name: The Cuckoo Club

Hahahahaha A club of idiots and simple people who pretend to be great men and businessmen in the evening when it is actually a more shitty club in London. 
London is full of good clubs and where best to spend our money without going to this hole idiots. 
 
Hahahahaha they want to be Pacha in Ibiza island or Berghain Club in Berlin but can not get it,for it must be class. 

A ridiculous club!
love it, best club in london

Never again. 
You can go in if you dress like a clochard with long and worn jeans, but you cannot enter if you dress WELL BUT WITH TROUSERS UNDER YOUR KNEES.

very friendly bouncers! was charged by the apparent owner 3 times the drinks ordered. i had some students with me and they were scared and payed. of course i gave them the money back but i reported it to lewisham polise stastion today. i was told that the CCTV cameras were shut off so the "manager" eddie krasniqi could "break my teeth" did not happen, the manager pushed me over so i hit the floor. did not do anything just went and paid.

The troglodyte on the front door doesn't change that this is my favourite club.

results.name: Plastic People
results.address: 149 Curtain Road, London EC2A 3QE, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: From being seminal in the emergence of dubstep pre-2010, where the vibe was truly special, to now, where adjectives used to describe it could be: sterile, boring and soulless. It has followed the general trend of the Shoreditch/east-London area to assume its current post-gentrified, post-Olympic blandness. If you read the reviews below where people complain about 'bland cocktails' - you will get an idea of its current clientele.

This is a small downstairs club, which has played host to some great djs in thepast, and your enjoyment will be down to the business and the skill of the DJ.

I have had some excellent nights where there have been few people and you could really dance and have a great time, and equally when its all hot close filled and sweaty.

When its busy due to its size you will find it hard to get a drink as the bar is in proportion to the rest of the place.

Admittedly you are less likely to see the big name djs who loved to come here, but it when its on is a great place to party

This is a nightclub for underground dance music. It has a superb sound system, really knowledgeable music policy, and total lack of other distraction. If you are into house, techno, or disco, I order you to attend PP. Otherwise avoid please.
All about the music - amazing vibes

Best club in London. Small, grimy, awesome.

If you're looking for a club with a mixologist and trendy decor go elsewhere. Come here for the music.

results.name: The Silver Bullet
results.address: 5 Station Place, London N4 2DH, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
What can one say about the Silver Bullet?! 

ITS AWESOME! 

Have some of the best underground live acts and DJs playing in an intimate venue where you can get right to the front and skank along with your favourite acts! 

Really friendly staff and crowd. One of the few good bars left in London! 

Check them out if you havent been already! Always something good going on and easy transport links too and fro. Not bad prices on beers either!

great lil spot that functions well as bar, venue and club. Music policy is broad but on a mmusic lovers tip - from Blues and jazz sessions early in the week through funk, soul, reggae, etc to more full-on club events playing Jungle,old-skool, electronic etc.
Open late late mon to sat too for the night owls/non-9-to-5ers
We put a party on at Silver Bullet on Saturday. Great vibe and great team. Recommended!
Great place. You'll find it hard to drink in a place with friendlier staff. Always a good selection of live music and DJ's on, and not expensive either. Basically, everything you could ask for.
An A1 tip-top clubbing jam fair, wrapped up in a big bag like DISCO FUDGE. It doesn't get much better than that.

results.name: The Alibi
results.address: 91 Kingsland High Street, London E8 2PB, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
The Alibi is a diamond in Dalston’s rough. Opened and run by underground collective Real Gold, its doors opened March 2010 and has been a little basement of fun ever since. The entry is always free, the drinks are cheap and the music is eclectic. There are various little sections in The Alibi to get lost in, including a small but brilliant dancefloor with an Acoustic Void soundsystem. TSL recommend getting here between 11pm-11:30pm to take advantage of a good ambience and avoid queues...

To find more unique and independent places why not visit the Twenty Something London website!

the dive bar if there ever was one the alibi is a great place to drink in east london. bar staff are cool and very good looking (ask for axel!) and this place always has a good vibe. not cheap but well worth it.
Trendy bar in Dalston, nice little venue, small but quick bar, small dancefloor, small toilets, small everything but surprisingly accomodating for its size.
Spit’n’sawdust basement venue that’s ripe for that stumbly stage of the night. It gets rammed (and I mean rammed) and it’s the opposite of fancy but good club nights and gigs.
I been there last week and tgis place was the best place I ever been

results.name: The Alley Cat
results.address: 4 Denmark Street, London WC2H 8LP, United Kingdom

indReviews.text: A fun little underground bar for gigs and the odd rock night. Can get really busy on popular nights but it gets a good atmosphere and it's easy to pop outside for some air. A good alternative to the Fox now it's closed.

Located underneath where the famous Regents Sound Studios is located, this small bar provides an excellent environment for the blues. Every wednesday night there is a jam session with some of the best blues musicians in London. Yet anyone can go up and jam, no matter what experience you have. The host, Sam, is a very nice and helpful fellow.
I am a little bit drunk but it seems very nice and was free to get in on a Thursday night and they seem to be playing music that I like....... And that girl over there looks nice.
Rubbish - do not touch with a barge pole!

Great Bar tp perform at Denmark st.
Many giggs and gamming
discent prices

results.name: Hilton Garden Inn Luton North Hotel
results.address: Butterfield Business Park, Hitchin Road, Luton, Bedfordshire LU2 8DL, United Kingdom

indReviews.text:
# WRONG POSTCODE # USE ** LU2 8DL **. The listed postcode lu2 8dd will take you to the wrong location, and whilst myself and my neighbours would love to meet you, we are growing a tad tired of giving directions to the Hotel :-) especially at 1am in the morning !!! 

Clearly the Hotel management seem unconcerned that you will have problems locating them as they have made no attempt (in the last 5 years) to resolve this issue. 

Enjoy your stay at the Hotel and please use LU2 8DL in your Sat Nav :-)

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights whilst visiting family from Australia. 
Must say the Hotel from the outside looks tired and clinical. But on the inside it is fabulous - especially the welcoming open gas fire in the casual lounge/bar area.
What wonderful service we had from all of the staff. Do yourself a favour and go for the full breakfast deal...well worth it. We dined a few times and couldn't fault the food. Probably a little pricey, but very pleasant. The rooms were nice enough. Adjustable bed firming dial on side of bed - unusual but find it when you first book in.
Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The lobby is nice, the stall is friendly, the bar is a nice touch, but the condition of the bathroom was pretty bad. The tiles rocked under my feet, the grout was missing from multiple shower tiles and the mold had a formidable hold on the shower. It had a distinctly musty smell to it. I will choose the Hampton inn next time.

I spent a weekend here last year. I loved the coziness of this Hotel. It is well located just 15 mins drive from Luton Airport and on the leafy and quiet Hertfordshire part of Luton. 
The food here is excellent and the Hilton standards are amazingly upheld here.
I thoroughly enjoyed my weekend and the Manager is a credit to the Organisation.

Great hotel for either airport stop overs or business meetings. I've stayed on both occasions. Staff were flawless and always with a warm smile. Rooms were spotless, the only downfall was the time that it took for the food to arrive as we were eating at the restaurant, but I think that it was a one time thing. I'll surely visit again.
